original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: yo g'a tsa r+ya bh'u mi sye bo dhi satva bh'u mi by'a khy'a /
analyzed: yo g'a tsa r+ya bh'u mi sye bo dhi satva bh'u mi by'a khy'a /
translated: Yogācāryabhūmi-sūtra-bodhisattvabhūmi-vyākhyā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rnam par bshad pa /
translated: From the Stages of Yogic Practice, the Explanation of the Stage of a Bodhisattva

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: 'phags pa byams pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Maitreya.

original: dang por bstan bcos kyi lus rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dang por bstan bcos kyi lus rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: First, in order to present the body of the treatise,

original: chos bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said these ten dharmas... and so forth.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The path of a bodhisattva is the application to the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: 'bras bu ni spangs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni spangs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The result is the twofold abandonment and the twofold wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i ye shes dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i ye shes dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The obscuration of the afflictions is abandoned, the obscuration to the knowable is abandoned, there is pure exalted wisdom, and there is unobstructed exalted wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas par ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas par ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu'o //
translated: The qualities of Buddhahood are the one hundred and forty unique qualities of a Buddha.

original: 'di dag nyid gnyis ka yang theg pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid gnyis ka yang theg pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: These two are also called the Great Vehicle.🔽Because one goes from here,

original: 'di nas 'gro bas sam /
analyzed: 'di nas 'gro bas sam /
translated: Or else, because it is the place where one goes.🔽

original: 'di dag 'gro @2a * //🔽ba'i phyir theg pa'am /
analyzed: 'di dag 'gro @2a * // ba'i phyir theg pa'am /
translated: because they go,🔽it is a vehicle,

original: bgrod bya'am / 'gro ba ni theg pa zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: bgrod bya'am / 'gro ba ni theg pa zhes byas nas so //
translated: or a path, or a going.

original: chen po yang de yin la lam yang de yin pas na theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la lam yang de yin pas na theg pa chen po'o //
translated: It is the Great Vehicle because it is great and it is a path.

original: yang theg pa chen po ni chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: yang theg pa chen po ni chen po rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas so //
translated: Moreover, the Great Vehicle is so called because it possesses seven kinds of greatness.

original: chos chen po ni stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa dpag tu med pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos ston pa la sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: chos chen po ni stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa dpag tu med pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos ston pa la sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: The greatness of teaching is the teaching of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle in limitless sūtras, such as the Hundred Thousand.

original: sems bskyed pa chen po ni yon tan dang skyon thams cad thob pa dang spangs pa'i mthar thug pa la gnas pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa chen po ni yon tan dang skyon thams cad thob pa dang spangs pa'i mthar thug pa la gnas pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The great generation of the Thought is the generation of the Thought for the unsurpassed, right, perfect enlightenment, abiding in the ultimate of all virtues and faults, of all acquisitions and abandonments.

original: mos pa chen po ni zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams la mngon par mos pa nyid do //
analyzed: mos pa chen po ni zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams la mngon par mos pa nyid do //
translated: The great devotion is the devotion to the profound and the magnificent teachings.

original: bsam pa chen po nyid ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sa la sems can thams cad la bdag dang mnyam pa'i bsam pa thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsam pa chen po nyid ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sa la sems can thams cad la bdag dang mnyam pa'i bsam pa thob pa nyid do //
translated: The great intention is the attainment of the intention equal to that of all sentient beings on the ground of pure superior intention.

original: tshogs chen po nyid ni sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams skad cig re re la yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa nye bar sogs par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs chen po nyid ni sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams skad cig re re la yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa nye bar sogs par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The great collection is the collection of merit and knowledge of the Bodhisattvas who have entered the grounds, which is gathered in each instant, and is immeasurable.

original: dus chen po nyid ni bskal pa mi nyung ba grangs med par rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: dus chen po nyid ni bskal pa mi nyung ba grangs med par rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: The great time is the application without interruption for many eons, not few.

original: 'bras bu chen po nyid ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bdag @2b nyid che ba thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po nyid ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bdag @2b nyid che ba thob pa nyid do //
translated: The great fruit is the attainment of the greatness of the nature of a Buddha, which is not shared in common with all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa de dag kyang mdor bsdu na gnas skabs gnyis te /🔽rgyu'i gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs so //🔽de la gzhi la sogs pa rgyu ni ji ltar rigs par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa de dag kyang mdor bsdu na gnas skabs gnyis te / rgyu'i gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs so // de la gzhi la sogs pa rgyu ni ji ltar rigs par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs so //
translated: These stages of the bodhisattva are, in brief, of two kinds:🔽the stage of cause and the stage of result.🔽The stage of cause is included in the first seven stages, because they are the cause for the stage of result. The stage of result is included in the last three stages, because they are the result of the stage of cause.

original: tha ma ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kho nas bsdus pa nyid yin no //🔽yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa ma lus pa ni gnas gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //🔽gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas dang / gzhi'i rjes su mthun pa'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas dang / gzhi'i mthar thug pa'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas so //
analyzed: tha ma ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kho nas bsdus pa nyid yin no // yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa ma lus pa ni gnas gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya'o // gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas dang / gzhi'i rjes su mthun pa'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas dang / gzhi'i mthar thug pa'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas so //
translated: The stage of cause is included in the first seven stages, because they are the cause for the stage of result. The stage of result is included in the last three stages, because they are the result of the stage of cause.🔽The stage of cause is included in the first seven stages, because they are the cause for the stage of result. The stage of result is included in the last three stages, because they are the result of the stage of cause.

original: gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas ni le'u bco brgyad kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas ni le'u bco brgyad kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The stage of cause is included in the first seven stages, because they are the cause for the stage of result. The stage of result is included in the last three stages, because they are the result of the stage of cause.🔽The stage of cause is included in the first seven stages, because they are the cause for the stage of result. The stage of result is included in the last three stages, because they are the result of the stage of cause.

original: gnyis pa ni le'u bzhis bsdus so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni le'u bzhis bsdus so //
translated: The second is included in four chapters.

original: gsum pa ni le'u lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gsum pa ni le'u lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The third is of the nature of five chapters.

original: yang gnas gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang gnas gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: Again, it should be understood as included in three topics:

original: rgyu'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ste ;
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ste ;
translated: the special cause, the special result, and the special state of both.

original: dang po dang / tha ma dang / bar ma rnams ji ltar rigs par ro //
analyzed: dang po dang / tha ma dang / bar ma rnams ji ltar rigs par ro //
translated: The first, the last, and the middle are included as appropriate.

original: de la gzhi la sogs pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la gzhi la sogs pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
translated: The order of the basis, etc. is as follows:

original: dang po nyid nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la slob par byed pa na de'i rgyu'i tshogs rnam par gsum ni gzhi ste /
analyzed: dang po nyid nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la slob par byed pa na de'i rgyu'i tshogs rnam par gsum ni gzhi ste /
translated: When one first trains in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, the three collections of its causes are the basis.

original: de nye bar blangs nas 'jug pa zhes bya bas ni gzhi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nye bar blangs nas 'jug pa zhes bya bas ni gzhi bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “having taken up, one enters” indicates the basis.

original: de las tha ma byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: de las tha ma byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la 'jug pa na /
translated: When one enters the basis characterized by application to the bodhisattva practice, which is the last of those,

original: dge sbyong dang thun mong du gyur ba'i rtags 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang thun mong du gyur ba'i rtags 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: the signs common to the spiritual practitioner arise.

original: rtags gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar yang dag par chud pa 'thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rtags gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar yang dag par chud pa 'thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The signs by which one is considered a bodhisattva are:

original: brtse ba dang bcas pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / brtan pa dang / lag brkyang ba dang / don zab mo'i dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'o //🔽yang rtags da dag ni legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' la sogs pa phyogs kyi chos la sbyor ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs sam /
analyzed: brtse ba dang bcas pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / brtan pa dang / lag brkyang ba dang / don zab mo'i dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'o // yang rtags da dag ni legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' la sogs pa phyogs kyi chos la sbyor ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs sam /
translated: being compassionate, being a good speaker, being steadfast, being openhanded, and being one who explains the profound meaning.🔽Moreover, these signs are applied to the qualities of the side of right action, etc.

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are applied to the side of the householder or to the side of the monastic.

original: de lta bas na de'i rjes la phyogs bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i rjes la phyogs bstan to //
translated: Therefore, after that, the side is taught.

original: yang rtags de dag 'gro ba de dag tu phyogs de dag gis 'jug par gyur pa rnams las kyang lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyangs pa rnams la 'byung gi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rtags de dag 'gro ba de dag tu phyogs de dag gis 'jug par gyur pa rnams las kyang lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyangs pa rnams la 'byung gi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to show that these signs occur in those who have purified their superior attitude, not in others, among those who have entered that side,

original: de'i rjes la @3a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes la @3a * //
translated: after that,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan to //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan to //
translated: the superior attitude is taught.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub kyi gzhi la zhugs pa rnams la ji skad bstan pa'i rtags rnams mthong bar gyur cing byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba dang yang dag par ldan par gyur pas /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub kyi gzhi la zhugs pa rnams la ji skad bstan pa'i rtags rnams mthong bar gyur cing byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba dang yang dag par ldan par gyur pas /
translated: Those who have entered the stages of enlightenment as they have been explained see the signs that have been explained and are endowed with the application of the factors of enlightenment.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyong bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis dang / bcu gsum pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par sbyong bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis dang / bcu gsum pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la gnas pa bstan te /
translated: Thus, in brief, bodhisattvas who purify the bodhisattvas' superior intention on the stages of enlightenment as they have been explained abide in the twelve bodhisattva levels and the thirteenth level of the tathagatas.

original: gnas pa 'di dag la gnas shing gnas pa thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir skye ba rnam pa lnga len par byed
analyzed: gnas pa 'di dag la gnas shing gnas pa thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir skye ba rnam pa lnga len par byed
translated: Abiding in these levels, bodhisattvas who enter all the levels take on five kinds of birth in order to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings without any sense of wrongdoing.

original: pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i rjes la skye ba bstan to //
analyzed: pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i rjes la skye ba bstan to //
translated: and after that, the stages of development are taught.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa drug gis sems can rnams yang dag par 'dzin to zhes bya bar de'i rjes la yongs su 'dzin pa nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa drug gis sems can rnams yang dag par 'dzin to zhes bya bar de'i rjes la yongs su 'dzin pa nye bar bstan to //
translated: In the same way, after that, the stages of complete acceptance are taught, in order to show that the bodhisattvas who are established in the bodhisattva practice that is included in all the stages completely accept sentient beings in six ways.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i gnas pa bcu gsum du gtogs pa de dag sa bdun du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la sa nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i gnas pa bcu gsum du gtogs pa de dag sa bdun du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la sa nye bar bstan to //
translated: After that, the stages are taught, in order to show that those who are included in the thirteen stages as they have been described are the seven stages.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas nye bar bzung nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur bas de'i rjes la spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas nye bar bzung nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur bas de'i rjes la spyod pa bstan to //
translated: After that, the practices are taught, because the bodhisattva practices are fourfold on all the bodhisattva stages, beginning with the stage of action in faith.

original: de lta bu'i spyod pa dang ldan pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa las brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i mthar thug par gtogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu bstan pa ni rab tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i spyod pa dang ldan pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa las brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i mthar thug par gtogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu bstan pa ni rab tu gnas pa ste /
translated: The one hundred and forty unique qualities of the Buddha are taught.

original: de la snang ba dang tshig gi sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la snang ba dang tshig gi sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, it is called “well-established” because it is endowed with the application of light and words.

original: sangs rgyas de la rab tu bzhugs pas na rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de la rab tu bzhugs pas na rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Buddha is well-established in that, therefore, it is called “well-established.”

original: 'dis 'dzin par byed pas na gzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dis 'dzin par byed pas na gzhi ste /
translated: It is a basis because it causes grasping.

original: rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it causes realization.

original: thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub thob pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni rigs la sogs pa'i chos gsum yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub thob pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni rigs la sogs pa'i chos gsum yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The three dharmas of lineage and so on should be known as the dharmas that are concordant with the attainment of enlightenment by bodhisattvas at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end.

original: gzhi'i dbye ba yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar @3b rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi'i dbye ba yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar @3b rig par bya ste /
translated: The classification of the basis should be known in brief as fivefold.

original: ngo bo'i dbye ba bstan pa dang / de'i don bstan pa dang / rtsa ba'i gzhir bstan pa nyid dang / nye ba'i gzhir bstan pa dang / rnam grangs nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo'i dbye ba bstan pa dang / de'i don bstan pa dang / rtsa ba'i gzhir bstan pa nyid dang / nye ba'i gzhir bstan pa dang / rnam grangs nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the divisions of the nature, the explanation of its meaning, the explanation as the fundamental ground, the explanation as the proximate ground, and the explanation of the synonyms.🔽With regard to that, from the perspective of the divisions of the nature, it says:

original: de la ngo bo'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi rigs dang / dang po sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad ni gzhi zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la ngo bo'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi rigs dang / dang po sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad ni gzhi zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva's own lineage, the generation of the mind, and all the dharmas that are factors of enlightenment are called the ground.

original: dang po'i gzhi ni rigs so //
analyzed: dang po'i gzhi ni rigs so //
translated: The initial ground is the lineage.

original: bar du ni sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bar du ni sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: In the middle, it is the generation of the mind.

original: de'i phyi nas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos so //
analyzed: de'i phyi nas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos so //
translated: After that, it is the dharmas that are factors of enlightenment.

original: yang na chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: yang na chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas so //
translated: Or, it is divided into small, medium, and great.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yin te /
translated: All the dharmas included in the perfections such as generosity are also dharmas that are factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub thob pa la rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub thob pa la rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: Because they are conducive to the attainment of enlightenment, they should be known as the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang gi rjes su mthun par gyur ba de la de'i phyogs zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang gi rjes su mthun par gyur ba de la de'i phyogs zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: In the world, that which is conducive to something is called a part of it.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang gis rigs la sogs pa chos gsum la gzhi zhes bya zhes the tshom du gyur pa rnams la rnam par gnyis kyis de dag gzhir gyur pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang gis rigs la sogs pa chos gsum la gzhi zhes bya zhes the tshom du gyur pa rnams la rnam par gnyis kyis de dag gzhir gyur pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of basis by means of two aspects for those who have doubts about what the cause and what the condition is for the three dharmas of lineage, etc.,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says: Why is that?

original: de ltar de dag gis ni snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gzhi'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gis ni snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gzhi'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he explains the meaning of basis by means of the fact that the latter arises from the former and by means of the completion of perfect enlightenment.

original: de ltar 'di dag gis ni mngon sum dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i byang chub thob pa'i tshogs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gzhi zhes bstan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag gis ni mngon sum dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i byang chub thob pa'i tshogs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gzhi zhes bstan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, they are called “bases” because they are the cause of the attainment of enlightenment, either directly or indirectly, and because they are the cause of the perfection of the equipment for the attainment of enlightenment.

original: rigs la brten cing gnas nas zhes bya ba ni don de nyid ston par byed pa dang / rab tu gnas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rigs la brten cing gnas nas zhes bya ba ni don de nyid ston par byed pa dang / rab tu gnas par byed pa ste /
translated: “Relying on and abiding in the lineage” means that one teaches and establishes the meaning of that.

original: rigs yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means “if there is a lineage.”

original: skal ba can du bstan pa'i phyir mthu dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skal ba can du bstan pa'i phyir mthu dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Endowed with power” is said in order to show that one is fortunate.

original: yang skal ba can zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang dag pa'i don la sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang skal ba can zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang dag pa'i don la sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, “fortunate” here means that one generates the thought of enlightenment in the true sense.

original: de'i rigs med pa rnams la ni ji lta ba bzhin gyi sems bskyed pa med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs med pa rnams la ni ji lta ba bzhin gyi sems bskyed pa med do zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that those who do not have that lineage do not generate the thought in the proper way.

original: sems bskyed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor bar 'gyur bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob kyi /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor bar 'gyur bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob kyi /
translated: The generation of the thought is called a “perfection” because it is applied to generosity and so on.

original: sems ma bskyed pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽sems @4a * //
analyzed: sems ma bskyed pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / sems @4a * //
translated: Not by not generating the mind.🔽In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: bskyed pa la brten cing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bskyed pa la brten cing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Based on generating the mind.

original: 'di dag gnyi ga yang gong nas gong du 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyi ga yang gong nas gong du 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa nyid do //
translated: Both of these are the basis for the arising of the higher and higher.

original: sems bskyed pa nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the application to generosity and so on by just generating the mind obtains the name “perfection,” he says: the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag nyid ji ltar rigs par bsod rnams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag nyid ji ltar rigs par bsod rnams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that just these six perfections are the collection of merit and the collection of wisdom as is appropriate, he says: the collection of merit and the collection of wisdom.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs te /
translated: The perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of patience are the accumulation of merit.

original: bdag gi dngos po dang / longs spyod dang 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po dang / longs spyod dang 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have the result of the perfection of the self, of wealth, and of retinue.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin te /
translated: The perfection of meditation and the perfection of wisdom are the accumulation of wisdom.

original: 'bras bu 'bral bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'bral bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have the result of the separation from obscurations.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs so //
translated: The perfection of effort is on both sides.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa las ma gtogs pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa las gzhan bstan pa thams cad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa las ma gtogs pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa las gzhan bstan pa thams cad do //
translated: All the factors of enlightenment means all the teachings other than the perfections, such as the means of gathering, that are taught in the teachings on the perfections.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes ci'i phyir rjod par byed /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes ci'i phyir rjod par byed /
translated: Why does the sutra say “in order to fully and completely awaken to perfect enlightenment”?

original: 'thob par 'gyur ba zhes ci'i phyir mi smra zhe na /
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ba zhes ci'i phyir mi smra zhe na /
translated: Why does it not say “in order to attain”?

original: don ni de nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: don ni de nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way.

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / thob par 'gyur ba dang / reg par 'gyur ba dang / mngon gsum du byed ces bya ba rnams don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / thob par 'gyur ba dang / reg par 'gyur ba dang / mngon gsum du byed ces bya ba rnams don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because “to fully and completely awaken,” “to attain,” “to touch,” and “to actualize” are synonyms.

original: tshig gis 'jug pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin pas don la yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gis 'jug pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin pas don la yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: Since the use of words is governed by one’s wishes, one should investigate their meaning.

original: yang na rim gyis 'thob par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir yang ste /
analyzed: yang na rim gyis 'thob par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir yang ste /
translated: Or else, in order to show that one attains them gradually,

original: spangs pa dang / ye shes dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sngar bstan pa de dag ni dus gcig tu thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: spangs pa dang / ye shes dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sngar bstan pa de dag ni dus gcig tu thob par mi nus te /
translated: for it is not possible to attain the abandonment, the knowledge, perfect enlightenment, and the unshared qualities of a buddha all at once, as they were presented earlier.

original: sa dang sa rnams la spangs pa dang / ye shes khyad par can du 'gyur bar sbyor @4b ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang sa rnams la spangs pa dang / ye shes khyad par can du 'gyur bar sbyor @4b ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are applied to the special abandonment and special intuition on each spiritual level.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum du gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum du gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, it is said to be threefold:

original: pags par gtogs pa dang / sha mthangs su gtogs pa dang / snying por gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: pags par gtogs pa dang / sha mthangs su gtogs pa dang / snying por gtogs pa'o //
translated: the skin-level, the flesh-level, and the marrow-level.

original: de la dang por ni pags par gtogs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: de la dang por ni pags par gtogs pa spong ngo //
translated: Of these, first one abandons the skin-level,

original: de nas ni sha mthangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ni sha mthangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: then the flesh-level,

original: phyi nas ni snying por gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi nas ni snying por gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and finally the marrow-level.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzugs dang / ming gi tshogs kyi khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid byang chub ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzugs dang / ming gi tshogs kyi khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid byang chub ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The essence of the unshared qualities of the Buddha is also taught to be enlightenment, which is the essence of the special collections of names and forms.

original: de dag gnyi ga yang sa dang po nas nye bar bzung nas sa dang sa la khyad par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga yang sa dang po nas nye bar bzung nas sa dang sa la khyad par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Both of these are obtained as special qualities on each spiritual level, beginning with the first.

original: de'i phyir na bstod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir na bstod pa /
translated: Therefore, in praise of this, it is said:

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma lus pa //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma lus pa //
translated: The perfect complete enlightenment is

original: khyod la gtad pa lta bur mngon par snang //🔽dri ma med pa'i mtsho chu dangs pa la //
analyzed: khyod la gtad pa lta bur mngon par snang // dri ma med pa'i mtsho chu dangs pa la //
translated: It appears as if it were something that is given to you.🔽Just as the forms of the moon and stars

original: zla ba skar ma'i gzugs rnams snang ba bzhin //
analyzed: zla ba skar ma'i gzugs rnams snang ba bzhin //
translated: appear in a clear, unclouded lake,🔽so the ten powers and the four forms of fearlessness🔽are clearly taught in the third stage.

original: zhes bya ba dang / slob dpon sgra gcan zin bzang pos kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / slob dpon sgra gcan zin bzang pos kyang /
translated: The master Rāhulabhadra also says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dir ni gnas gnyis par //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dir ni gnas gnyis par //
translated: The Tathāgata has said that in this second stage

original: stobs bcu po ni thob par gyur pa gsungs //
analyzed: stobs bcu po ni thob par gyur pa gsungs //
translated: one attains the ten powers.🔽He has also clearly taught that in the third stage

original: mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi po thob pa yang //🔽gnas gsum par ni gsal po nyid du gsungs //🔽zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi po thob pa yang // gnas gsum par ni gsal po nyid du gsungs // zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: one attains the four forms of fearlessness.

original: rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis ni rigs la gnas pa nyid rtsa ba'i gzhir bstan te /
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis ni rigs la gnas pa nyid rtsa ba'i gzhir bstan te /
translated: The passage beginning with the words “Those who are not established in the lineage” teaches that the establishment in the lineage is the root ground,

original: gzhi gzhan la ltos pa med par gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rigs med na de dag yod par gyur kyang gzhi zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhi gzhan la ltos pa med par gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // rigs med na de dag yod par gyur kyang gzhi zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is the ground itself, without depending on any other ground.🔽If there were no lineage, even if those other things existed, there would be no ground.

original: gzhan de dag med par gyur kyang rigs ni gzhi nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan de dag med par gyur kyang rigs ni gzhi nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if those other things did not exist, the lineage would be the ground.

original: sems bskyed par gyur pa dang sbyor pa byas par gyur kyang rigs med par gyur na gzhi yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems bskyed par gyur pa dang sbyor pa byas par gyur kyang rigs med par gyur na gzhi yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If one has generated the thought of enlightenment and engaged in the application, but does not have the lineage, then the basis is not present.🔽Even if one who does not have the lineage generates the thought of enlightenment and engages in the application, one does not obtain the goal just as it is.

original: rigs med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang sbyor ba byed pas kyang don ji lta ba mi 'thob pa ni bya bas rdzas sbyong bar byed kyi rngas med par ni ma yin no zhes bya bas nges par shin tu yang skal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs med pa'i sems bskyed pa dang sbyor ba byed pas kyang don ji lta ba mi 'thob pa ni bya bas rdzas sbyong bar byed kyi rngas med par ni ma yin no zhes bya bas nges par shin tu yang skal ba med pa yin no //
translated: Even though one who does not have the lineage is not able to attain the goal just as it is, one is still very fortunate, because one is purifying the substance by action, not without a basis.

original: rigs yod par gyur na sems bskyed pa dang sbyor ba la sogs pa med du zin kyang skal ba dang ldan pa rnams dus yun ring pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rigs yod par gyur na sems bskyed pa dang sbyor ba la sogs pa med du zin kyang skal ba dang ldan pa rnams dus yun ring pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Even though one who has the lineage does not generate the thought of enlightenment or engage in the application, etc., one is fortunate, because one will perfect unsurpassed, true, complete enlightenment in a long time.

original: de lta bas na sems bskyed kyang rung ma bskyed kyang rung rigs nyid rtag tu gzhi zhes @5a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems bskyed kyang rung ma bskyed kyang rung rigs nyid rtag tu gzhi zhes @5a * //
translated: Thus, whether one generates the thought of enlightenment or not, the lineage itself is always the basis.

original: brngod do // 'bad pa la yang dag par gnas su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brngod do // 'bad pa la yang dag par gnas su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even though one abides in effort, etc.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba byed du zin kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gal te rigs la gnas kyang zhes bya ba sogs pas ni sems bskyed pa dang / spyod pa la sbyor ba dag gis ni nye bar gyur pa'i gzhi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba byed du zin kyang zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te rigs la gnas kyang zhes bya ba sogs pas ni sems bskyed pa dang / spyod pa la sbyor ba dag gis ni nye bar gyur pa'i gzhi bstan pa yin no //
translated: Even if one engages in the practice of generosity and so on, the meaning is that one is still far from enlightenment.🔽If one abides in the lineage, but does not generate the thought and does not engage in the practice, one is still far from unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment.

original: bzlog pa'i sems ma bskyed pa dang / sbyor ba ma brtsams pa ni skal ba dang ldan par bden na yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang ring bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i sems ma bskyed pa dang / sbyor ba ma brtsams pa ni skal ba dang ldan par bden na yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang ring bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: If one does not generate the thought and does not undertake the practice, one is still far from unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment, even if one is endowed with good fortune.

original: bzlog pas ni nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pas ni nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is near.

original: gzhi de nyid mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ming gi rnam grangs gzhan dang gzhan gyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi de nyid mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ming gi rnam grangs gzhan dang gzhan gyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya'o //
translated: In order to make that very point clear, the defining characteristics of other synonyms should be taught.

original: rnam grangs 'di dag kyang don gcig pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'di dag kyang don gcig pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Since these synonyms have the same meaning, there is no fault.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ming gi rnam grangs gsungs pa ni dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bstan to//
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ming gi rnam grangs gsungs pa ni dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bstan to//
translated: The buddhas have also taught the synonyms of the lineage because of their purpose.

original: don tha dad pa ltar na yang 'bras bu nges par 'dzin pas na gzhi ste /
analyzed: don tha dad pa ltar na yang 'bras bu nges par 'dzin pas na gzhi ste /
translated: Even though the meanings are different, it is the basis because it determines the result.

original: 'bras bu gnas pa'i rgyun 'byung bar byed pas rgyu nyid kyi phyir ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gnas pa'i rgyun 'byung bar byed pas rgyu nyid kyi phyir ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the cause because it is the cause that produces the stream of the result that is present.

original: rgyus 'bras bu kun du 'phel bar byed pa ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: rgyus 'bras bu kun du 'phel bar byed pa ni rgyu ste /
translated: It is the condition because it is the cause that increases the result,

original: chus autpala bzhin no //
analyzed: chus autpala bzhin no //
translated: like water for a lotus.

original: 'bras bu'i dus na yang rjes su 'jug pas brten to //🔽rim gyis 'byung bar byed pas na nyer gnas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na yang rjes su 'jug pas brten to // rim gyis 'byung bar byed pas na nyer gnas so //
translated: It is the support because it is the support of the result that is present.🔽It is the proximate cause because it is the cause that produces the result in sequence.

original: 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the antecedent because it precedes the result.

original: 'bras bu nges par 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu nges par 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the abode because it is the abode of the result.

original: rigs ji lta ba bzhin du dang po sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs ji lta ba bzhin du dang po sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first generation of the mind is in accordance with the lineage.

original: sems bskyed pa dang / spyod pa la sbyor ba dag kyang gzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang / spyod pa la sbyor ba dag kyang gzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and the generation of the Thought and the application to the practice are the nature of the ground.

original: rnam grangs de yang des bstan par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs de yang des bstan par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: And that enumeration is to be taught by that.

original: rigs rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The classification of the family is to be known as sixfold:

original: rab tu dbye ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rnam grangs nyid dang / rnam pa nyid dang / bye brag nyid dang ; rtags nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rnam grangs nyid dang / rnam pa nyid dang / bye brag nyid dang ; rtags nyid do //
translated: as classification, as nature, as enumeration, as aspect, as distinction, and as sign.

original: de la rab tu dbye ba'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de la rab tu dbye ba'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therein, in order to demonstrate the establishment of the classification, it is said:🔽In brief, it is twofold.

original: mdor na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rgyud mang po rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin pa de lta na ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mdor na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rgyud mang po rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin pa de lta na ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In that way, the nature is established as twofold.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa zhes bya ba @5b ni ngo bo nyid kyis sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa zhes bya ba @5b ni ngo bo nyid kyis sgrub pa ste /
translated: The naturally existing is the establishment by nature.

original: ma bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: ma bsgrubs pa /
translated: It is not established.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pas rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pas rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not transformed by manifest action.

original: de las bzlog pa ni yang dag par bsgrubs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni yang dag par bsgrubs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as being well-established.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ni sems ma bskyed pa rigs la gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ni sems ma bskyed pa rigs la gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: In that regard, the naturally existing lineage is the stage of the non-arisen thought of enlightenment.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa las skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa las skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a product of the wholesome roots that are born from the cause of the extremely pure Dharma-element.

original: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The thought of enlightenment that is arisen should be understood as being different from that.

original: rigs de nyid gnas skabs kyi khyad par gzhan du gyur pa la ming gzhan gyis bstan pa na yang dag par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs de nyid gnas skabs kyi khyad par gzhan du gyur pa la ming gzhan gyis bstan pa na yang dag par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That very lineage, when it is in another stage that is different, is taught by another name, namely, the well-established.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par las ming tha dad du btags pa ni mar sar dang / mar zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par las ming tha dad du btags pa ni mar sar dang / mar zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
translated: The different names that are given in the different stages are like the names ghee and milk.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Or, they are like the names conditioned and consciousness.

original: yang na rigs nges pa ni rang bzhin gyis gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na rigs nges pa ni rang bzhin gyis gnas pa yin la /
translated: Or else, the fixed potential is natural,

original: rigs ma nges pa ni yang dag par bsgrub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rigs ma nges pa ni yang dag par bsgrub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and the unfixed potential is accomplished,

original: rkyen gyi khyad par gyis bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyi khyad par gyis bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accomplished through special conditions.

original: yang na mthar gyis 'jug pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na mthar gyis 'jug pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis gnas pa yin la /
translated: Or else, the bodhisattva who is endowed with the application of the gradual entry is of natural potential,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa sngon du song ba'i byang chub tu yongs su gyur pa can ni gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa sngon du song ba'i byang chub tu yongs su gyur pa can ni gnyis pa ste /
translated: and the one who has converted the śrāvaka vehicle to the Mahayana is of the second type,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i sa bon la rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i sa bon la rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: because the seed of supramundane virtue is called the potential.

original: sa bon de yang 'dus byas las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod pa la grol ba gzung bar mi nus pa /
analyzed: sa bon de yang 'dus byas las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod pa la grol ba gzung bar mi nus pa /
translated: And that seed is not apprehended as being either the same as or different from the aggregates,

original: skye mched drug gi khyad par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi khyad par zhes bya'o //
translated: and it is called the special six sense spheres.

original: skye mched drug po de yang sems can dang rdzas kyi rtsa bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug po de yang sems can dang rdzas kyi rtsa bar gyur pa'o //
translated: And those six sense spheres are the root of sentient beings and of substances.

original: de'i phyir sems can gyi khyad par ro zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gyi khyad par ro zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be said that it is a special sentient being.

original: gang dang ldan pas sems can dang / snying po dang / gcig pu dpa' ba dang / skyes bu'i khyad par zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas sems can dang / snying po dang / gcig pu dpa' ba dang / skyes bu'i khyad par zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the sentient being, the essence, the sole hero, and the special person.

original: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye bas thob pa de dang der skye mched gang yang rung ba dang mi phyed par gyur ba la rigs zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye bas thob pa de dang der skye mched gang yang rung ba dang mi phyed par gyur ba la rigs zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, in order to teach that the family is the non-separation from any of the sense-spheres, in the state of meditative attainment and in the state of birth,

original: skye mched drug gzung ngo //
analyzed: skye mched drug gzung ngo //
translated: the six sense-spheres are grasped.

original: de yang de dang de la brten nas byung ba'i dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos sems bskyed pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob bo //
analyzed: de yang de dang de la brten nas byung ba'i dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos sems bskyed pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob bo //
translated: And that is the wholesome mind and mental activities that arise in dependence on this and that, and by the generation of the mind, it obtains the name of perfection.

original: de'i phyir na yang skye mched drug gi khyad @6a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang skye mched drug gi khyad @6a * //
translated: Therefore, the special six sense-spheres

original: par la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: par la brjod par bya'o //
translated: should be expressed.

original: yang na skye mched drug po de dag nyid bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob par gyur pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas gnas gyur pa na ji ltar rigs par ming dang gzugs kyi rnam par gzhag pa rab tu thob bar gyur te /
analyzed: yang na skye mched drug po de dag nyid bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob par gyur pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas gnas gyur pa na ji ltar rigs par ming dang gzugs kyi rnam par gzhag pa rab tu thob bar gyur te /
translated: Or else, when the six sense spheres are transformed by the attainment of the perfection of the highest meditation on them, then the state of name-and-form is attained, as appropriate.

original: rdzas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they become substantial.

original: des na skye mched drug gi khyad par kho na rigs yin no //
analyzed: des na skye mched drug gi khyad par kho na rigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the six sense spheres are the only type that is tenable.

original: yang de dag gi khyad par de ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / sa la sogs par rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sbyor bas skye ba gcig nas gcig tu 'gro ba'i phyir gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang de dag gi khyad par de ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / sa la sogs par rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sbyor bas skye ba gcig nas gcig tu 'gro ba'i phyir gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Moreover, that type of them is called “coming from one to another” because it is the uninterrupted application of the realms, destinies, birth processes, stages, etc. to the process of going from one birth to another.

original: de ltar na gnas skabs gang du yang rigs ni rgyun 'chad pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas skabs gang du yang rigs ni rgyun 'chad pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the type is never interrupted in any situation.

original: de ltar skye mched drug gi khyad par gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs kyang 'ga' zhig gi res 'ga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar skye mched drug gi khyad par gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs kyang 'ga' zhig gi res 'ga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, although the special six sense spheres come from one to another, they are sometimes interrupted.

original: dper na dmyal ba rnams dang / lha rnams kyi reg bya'i skye mched drug dang ldan pa rnams kyi mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa'i tshor ba myong bar gyur pa'i rten du gyur pa 'jug pa rgyun 'chad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dmyal ba rnams dang / lha rnams kyi reg bya'i skye mched drug dang ldan pa rnams kyi mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa'i tshor ba myong bar gyur pa'i rten du gyur pa 'jug pa rgyun 'chad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the six sense spheres of the hell beings and the gods are the basis for the experience of unpleasant and pleasant feelings, respectively, but their operation is interrupted.

original: de lta bu ma yin pas thog ma med pa'i dus can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin pas thog ma med pa'i dus can zhes bya ste /
translated: But it is not like that, so it is said to be beginningless.

original: sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o//
translated: It is said that it has no prior limit.

original: de ltar na dus dpag tu med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dus dpag tu med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that it is immeasurable in time.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir chos nyid kyis thob pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir chos nyid kyis thob pa ste /
translated: It is obtained naturally because it exists by its own intrinsic reality.

original: sus kyang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sus kyang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not created by anyone, and it is future.

original: yang na gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa'i phyir thog ma med pa'i dus can no //
analyzed: yang na gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa'i phyir thog ma med pa'i dus can no //
translated: Or else, it is beginningless because it has come down from beginningless time.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir chos nyid kyis thob pa'o zhes phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bur bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir chos nyid kyis thob pa'o zhes phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bur bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since it is beginningless, it is obtained naturally.

original: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba goms par byas pa las thob pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽dang por bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs las byung ba rigs nges pa'am /
analyzed: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba goms par byas pa las thob pa zhes bya ba ni / dang por bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs las byung ba rigs nges pa'am /
translated: Obtained from the cultivation of roots of virtue in the past refers to

original: rigs ma nges pa'am /🔽byang chub tu 'gyur ba can no /
analyzed: rigs ma nges pa'am / byang chub tu 'gyur ba can no /
translated: the certainty or uncertainty of the spiritual gene that arises from the power of the roots of virtue that were first generated.🔽The certainty of the spiritual gene refers to the spiritual gene that is capable of producing enlightenment.🔽In this context, both aspects are accepted.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir ni rnam pa gnyi ga yang 'dod do zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga dang ldan pas skal ba can dang / mthu yod par 'gyur zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur bas @6b de'i phyir gnyi ga yang gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir ni rnam pa gnyi ga yang 'dod do zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga dang ldan pas skal ba can dang / mthu yod par 'gyur zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur bas @6b de'i phyir gnyi ga yang gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is endowed with both, it is fortunate and capable, and it is capable of fully and completely realizing unsurpassed enlightenment. Therefore, both are called the basis.

original: de ltar rigs kyi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rigs kyi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the nature of the spiritual gene,

original: rnam grangs bstan par bya ste /🔽kha cig 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs bstan par bya ste / kha cig 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: he now teaches its synonyms.

original: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir rigs so //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir rigs so //
translated: Because it is the cause of the realization of the supramundane qualities, it is called gene.

original: de 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir sa bon no //🔽rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i phyir khams so //
analyzed: de 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir sa bon no // rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i phyir khams so //
translated: Because it is the cause of their origination, it is called seed.🔽Because it is the cause of their possession, it is called constituent element.

original: bcos ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcos ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is the cause of their transformation, it is called nature.

original: rnam grangs kyi dbye ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi dbye ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the synonyms.

original: 'bras bu yang dag par ma grub pa ni 'bras bu dmigs par ma gyur pa nyid do //🔽yang 'bras bu ni rigs kyi rtags sam /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang dag par ma grub pa ni 'bras bu dmigs par ma gyur pa nyid do // yang 'bras bu ni rigs kyi rtags sam /
translated: The unrealized result is the non-actualization of the result.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtags yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtags yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The result should be understood as the sign of the spiritual gene or the sign of the bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin du rtags gsal po med pa'i gnas skabs shes par dka' ba dang / yongs su gcad par dka' ba dang / nges par gzung bar dka' ba ni cha phra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtags gsal po med pa'i gnas skabs shes par dka' ba dang / yongs su gcad par dka' ba dang / nges par gzung bar dka' ba ni cha phra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the subtle is difficult to know, difficult to discern, and difficult to grasp when there is no clear evidence.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rgya che ba ste /
translated: The opposite of that is the extensive.

original: 'bras bu nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result is perceived.

original: yang na rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ni phra ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ni phra ba ste /
translated: Or, the subtle is natural,

original: skye mched drug gi khyad par gyis rab tu phye ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi khyad par gyis rab tu phye ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is merely distinguished by the difference of the six sense bases.

original: yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni rgya che ba ste /
translated: The extensive is cultivated,

original: 'bad pa'i khyad par gyis rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa'i khyad par gyis rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is well cultivated by the difference of effort.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs la sogs pa las rigs 'di khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs la sogs pa las rigs 'di khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this lineage is superior to the lineage of the śrāvaka, etc.,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de dang ldan pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de dang ldan pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said, “Those who possess that bodhisattva lineage, etc.”

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni nyan thos kyi gtso bor gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni nyan thos kyi gtso bor gzung ba'i don to //
translated: “All” means those who are considered to be the foremost śrāvakas.

original: nyan thos kyi gtso bo rnams kyang rung /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi gtso bo rnams kyang rung /
translated: even the chief of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi bse ru lta bu yang rung /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi bse ru lta bu yang rung /
translated: even the rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddhas,

original: khyad par de dag med pas de dag las nges par 'das nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par de dag med pas de dag las nges par 'das nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: because there is no distinction among them.🔽What need is there to mention the others?

original: gzhan thams cad lta la smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa gzhan dag las shin tu yang 'das par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad lta la smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa gzhan dag las shin tu yang 'das par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it surpasses even the others, the mundane beings.

original: de'i phyir bla na med pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir bla na med pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore, it is called unsurpassed,

original: de'i gong mar gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong mar gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing higher than it.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs khyad par du 'phags pa yin par mi bzod nas dris pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs khyad par du 'phags pa yin par mi bzod nas dris pa ste /
translated: This is asked because of being unable to accept the superiority of the bodhisattva lineage.

original: nyan thos @7a * //
analyzed: nyan thos @7a * //
translated: The lineage of the śrāvakas

original: dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs kyang rnam par grol ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs kyang rnam par grol ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: and pratyekabuddhas is also the cause of liberation,

original: rnam par grol ba la yang tha dad du bya ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba la yang tha dad du bya ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: and there is no distinction to be made in liberation.

original: rigs thams cad ni mnyam pas mnyam pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rigs thams cad ni mnyam pas mnyam pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all lineages are equal.

original: rnam par dag pa thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi rgyus bla na med pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par gyi rgyus bla na med pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the unexcelled distinction by means of the cause of the special, uncommon purity,

original: nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pa yin pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pa yin pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: it is said: The obscuration of the afflictions is the obscuration of the afflictions because the afflictions themselves are the obscuration.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi mi shes pa dang ldan pas rang gi gnyen po'i phyogs dge ba'i chos skye ba la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi mi shes pa dang ldan pas rang gi gnyen po'i phyogs dge ba'i chos skye ba la gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the obscuration of the afflictions because it is the cause of the nonarising of the virtuous qualities that are the antidote to the afflictions due to the possession of afflicted nescience.

original: shes bya nyid sgrib pa yin pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ste ;🔽nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa dang ldan pas shes bya de nyid ni de dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: shes bya nyid sgrib pa yin pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ste ; nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa dang ldan pas shes bya de nyid ni de dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration of the knowable because the knowable itself is the obscuration.🔽It is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the knowledge of the knowable due to the possession of unafflicted nescience.🔽It is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the knowledge of the knowable due to the possession of unafflicted nescience.

original: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes de las gzhan pa'i shes pa las lhag par gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir bstod pa /🔽khyod kyi ye shes gcig gis ni //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes de las gzhan pa'i shes pa las lhag par gyur pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir bstod pa / khyod kyi ye shes gcig gis ni //
translated: That is to say, it is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the knowledge of the knowable due to the possession of unafflicted nescience.

original: shes bya ma lus kun khyab can //🔽khyod las gzhan pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: shes bya ma lus kun khyab can // khyod las gzhan pa thams cad kyi //
translated: That is to say, it is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the knowledge of the knowable due to the possession of unafflicted nescience.🔽That is to say, it is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the knowledge of the knowable due to the possession of unafflicted nescience.🔽That is to say, it is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the knowledge of the knowable due to the possession of unafflicted nescience.🔽That is to say, it is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the knowledge of the knowable due to the possession of unafflicted nescience.🔽That is to say, it is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the knowledge of the knowable due to the possession of unafflicted nescience.

original: shes bya shes pa las lhag gyur //
analyzed: shes bya shes pa las lhag gyur //
translated: That is to say, it is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the knowledge of the knowable due to the possession of unafflicted nescience.🔽That is to say, it is the obscuration of the knowable because it is the cause of the nonarising of the

original: zhes bya bas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas /

original: de ltar na nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'i lus yin pa dang / gcig tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'i lus yin pa dang / gcig tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the result of the spiritual lineages of the śrāvaka, etc. is the body of liberation, and the result of the single vehicle is nirvāṇa.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu ni sku gsum dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu ni sku gsum dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the bodhisattva is the three bodies and the result of nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir khyad par gong na med pa dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par gong na med pa dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it is endowed with a superiority that is unsurpassed.

original: yang khyad par de dag ni 'bras bu'i dus su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: yang khyad par de dag ni 'bras bu'i dus su shes pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, these distinctions are known at the time of the result.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya bas thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar rigs las gyur pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya bas thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar rigs las gyur pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Furthermore, in order to demonstrate the distinctions that arise from the spiritual lineage at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end, he says:

original: dbang po las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po las gyur pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: dbang po las gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po las gyur pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The distinction that arises from the faculties is the distinction that arises from the faculties.

original: de bzhin du khyad par thams cad kyis khyad par can du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par thams cad kyis khyad par can du gyur pa'o //
translated: In the same way, it is distinguished by all the distinctions.

original: dbang po las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sems ma bskyed pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po las gyur pa'i khyad par ni sems ma bskyed pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The difference due to the faculties should be understood by those who have not generated the mind of enlightenment.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i phan par brjod pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / shin tu yang spangs pa dang / de thob par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i phan par brjod pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / shin tu yang spangs pa dang / de thob par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'o //
translated: The benefit for the sravakas, etc. is the abandonment of all the afflictions, the complete abandonment, and the knowledge of the four noble truths that causes that attainment.

original: de ltar na de dag ni rang gi theg pa la 'jug pa'i dus su @7b sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i gnas skabs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni rang gi theg pa la 'jug pa'i dus su @7b sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i gnas skabs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they are engaged at the time of entering their own vehicle, desiring the result of nirvana, the state of separation from suffering.

original: bya ba nyung ba nyid dang / 'bras bu chung ba nyid dang / bdag nyid 'gengs pa nyid dang / bdag nyid dul ba dang / bdag nyid zhi ba dang / bdag nyid mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: bya ba nyung ba nyid dang / 'bras bu chung ba nyid dang / bdag nyid 'gengs pa nyid dang / bdag nyid dul ba dang / bdag nyid zhi ba dang / bdag nyid mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bya bas so //
translated: They are engaged for the sake of having few activities, for the sake of a small result, for the sake of filling oneself, for the sake of taming oneself, for the sake of pacifying oneself, and for the sake of attaining nirvana for oneself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag la phan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag la phan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The benefit for oneself of the bodhisattvas is also twofold.

original: ye shes rnam pa gnyis dang / spangs pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa gnyis dang / spangs pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The two kinds of transcendent wisdom and the two kinds of elimination.🔽🔽

original: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two kinds of intuition and the two kinds of abandonment are not common to the disciples, because they are included in the life-stream of the bodhisattva.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa'i gang zag rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa'i gang zag rnams so //
translated: The other refers to the persons who are in the spiritual gene and those who are not.

original: de dag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de dag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva is engaged in their welfare,

original: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
translated: because he is engaged in the welfare of others.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ni sems bskyed pa'i dus su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ni sems bskyed pa'i dus su rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is engaged in the welfare of both, and this should be understood as the time of generating the thought of enlightenment.

original: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa de nyid de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa de nyid de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the accomplishment of the welfare of others,

original: rnam par phye nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par phye nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach it by way of analysis,

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, for the sake of the welfare of many people, etc.

original: de la skye bo mang po ni rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa'i gang zag rnams su 'dod do //
analyzed: de la skye bo mang po ni rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa'i gang zag rnams su 'dod do //
translated: Therein, many people are those persons who are not in the spiritual gene.

original: de dag la phan pa ni mi dge ba'i chos spong du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la phan pa ni mi dge ba'i chos spong du 'jug pa ste /
translated: Their welfare is the engagement in the abandonment of non-virtuous dharmas.

original: dus de srid pa'i sbyor bas dang po dag yang dag par spangs nas dus de srid du ngan 'gror 'gro ba las bskyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus de srid pa'i sbyor bas dang po dag yang dag par spangs nas dus de srid du ngan 'gror 'gro ba las bskyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For as long as they have not completely abandoned the first two, for that long they are protected from going to miserable realms.

original: bde ba ni dge ba'i chos la yang dag par sbyar bas phyi ma dag yang dag par spong ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba ni dge ba'i chos la yang dag par sbyar bas phyi ma dag yang dag par spong ba ste /
translated: The fourth is the complete abandonment of the future, through the correct application of virtue.

original: bde 'gro la 'god pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde 'gro la 'god pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it establishes one in happy realms.

original: dge ba la sdang nga /
analyzed: dge ba la sdang nga /
translated: Those who are hostile to virtue,

original: skal ba med pa /
analyzed: skal ba med pa /
translated: who are unfortunate,

original: snod du ma gyur pa ngan 'gror 'gro ba de dag la ded dpon bzhin du phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa mi gtong bar dus kyi 'ong ba la sdod cing /
analyzed: snod du ma gyur pa ngan 'gror 'gro ba de dag la ded dpon bzhin du phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa mi gtong bar dus kyi 'ong ba la sdod cing /
translated: who are not vessels, and who are going to miserable realms, the bodhisattva does not abandon the intention to benefit and gladden them as a caravan leader does, but remains for a long time,

original: rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
translated: and he enters into the world for the sake of their protection.

original: gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can mngon par rtogs pa'i skal ba can lha dang mi rnams kyi don du zhugs pa yin te /🔽don zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can mngon par rtogs pa'i skal ba can lha dang mi rnams kyi don du zhugs pa yin te / don zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: He also enters for the sake of gods and humans who are fortunate enough to have the realization of the Dharma of nirvana.

original: phan pa ni der mngon par 'byin par byed pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: phan pa ni der mngon par 'byin par byed pa'i lam mo //
translated: The benefit is the path that leads to that.

original: bde ba ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Happiness is the state of abiding in happiness in this very life.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i khyad par gyis lus dang sems @8a * //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i khyad par gyis lus dang sems @8a * //
translated: The special quality of pliancy is the experience of physical and mental bliss,
