original: bde ba'am / rnam par grol ba'i bde ba rab tu myong ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba'am / rnam par grol ba'i bde ba rab tu myong ba'o //
translated: or the bliss of liberation.

original: des na lha dang mi gzung ba ni de dag mngon par rtogs pa'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na lha dang mi gzung ba ni de dag mngon par rtogs pa'i skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the reference to gods and humans is because they are destined to realize the four noble truths.

original: nyan thos rnams ni smon lam btab pa'i phyi nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni smon lam btab pa'i phyi nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The listeners, after making aspirational prayers, attain the knowledge of the four noble truths as impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de dag dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i mthar thug pa'i thogs pa med pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de dag dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i mthar thug pa'i thogs pa med pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The bodhisattvas, on the other hand, attain the knowledge of the four noble truths, expertise in the five sciences, and the unobstructed gnosis that is omniscience.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos rnams ni gcig nyid la mkhas pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos rnams ni gcig nyid la mkhas pa'am /
translated: Similarly, the listeners are skilled in the single vehicle,

original: phung po la sogs pa rnam pa lnga la mkhas pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam pa gnyis sam /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnam pa lnga la mkhas pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam pa gnyis sam /
translated: Skill in the five aspects of the aggregates and so on.

original: rnam pa bcu la'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu la'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas have two aspects or ten aspects.

original: de ltar na rnam pa mang po la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa las gyur pa'i khyad par yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa mang po la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa las gyur pa'i khyad par yin no ;
translated: Thus, skill in the many aspects is the distinctive excellence of skill.

original: / de la 'bras bu las gyur pa'i khyad par ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: / de la 'bras bu las gyur pa'i khyad par ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The distinctive excellence of result should be understood as the unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment, which is preeminent.

original: rtags 'di dag gis rigs yod pa nyid du mtshon par byed pas ni rigs kyi rtags so //🔽yang de'i rtags sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i rtags yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtags 'di dag gis rigs yod pa nyid du mtshon par byed pas ni rigs kyi rtags so // yang de'i rtags sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i rtags yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The signs of the potential are called signs of the potential because they indicate the existence of the potential.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags zhes brjod de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags zhes brjod de /
translated: Moreover, they are called signs of the transcendences because they are the signs that precede the transcendences such as generosity.

original: sbyin pa nas bzung nas shes rab kyi bar la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis yang dag par sgrub par byed pa de la rtags zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa nas bzung nas shes rab kyi bar la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis yang dag par sgrub par byed pa de la rtags zhes brjod do //
translated: The signs of the perfections are the practice of the perfections of giving, etc. up to the perfection of wisdom, by means of body, speech, and mind.

original: yang de dag ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang / spyin pa la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun par ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de dag ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang / spyin pa la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun par ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, they should be understood as the essence of giving, etc. and as the conformity to giving, etc. as is appropriate.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags rnams mdor rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags rnams mdor rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The signs of the perfections should be understood in brief as follows:

original: sbyin pa dang / longs spyod dang / 'du ba'i sgo dang / rnyed pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / longs spyod dang / 'du ba'i sgo dang / rnyed pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are to be known as being based on wealth, on enjoyment, on the door of gifts, and on gain.

original: de la sbyin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, giving is twofold:

original: rdzas la ltos pa dang / rdzas la mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas la ltos pa dang / rdzas la mi ltos pa'o //
translated: that which is based on material things and that which is not based on material things.

original: de la rdzas la ltos pa'i phyin pa'i ni gzhan yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rang gi rdzas gtong ba ste /
analyzed: de la rdzas la ltos pa'i phyin pa'i ni gzhan yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rang gi rdzas gtong ba ste /
translated: Of these, the giving that is based on material things is the giving of one's own possessions for the sake of others.

original: lus bstan par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: lus bstan par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the manifestation of the body.

original: yang sbyin pa de rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang sbyin pa de rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, that giving is twofold:

original: @8b bdag gir gtogs pa dang / gzhan gyir gtogs pa'o //🔽bdag gir gtogs pa'i sbyin pa de ni bsam pa nyid dang / sbyor ba nyid kyis yang dag par nan tan byed pa ni rtags so //🔽de la rang bzhin nyid kyis sbyin pa la dga' ba yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsams pas yang dag par nan tan byed pa bstan te /🔽rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i rang bzhin can gyi sbyor ba nyid kyis so //🔽sbyin pa la mngon par mos pa ni sbyin pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: @8b bdag gir gtogs pa dang / gzhan gyir gtogs pa'o // bdag gir gtogs pa'i sbyin pa de ni bsam pa nyid dang / sbyor ba nyid kyis yang dag par nan tan byed pa ni rtags so // de la rang bzhin nyid kyis sbyin pa la dga' ba yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsams pas yang dag par nan tan byed pa bstan te / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i rang bzhin can gyi sbyor ba nyid kyis so // sbyin pa la mngon par mos pa ni sbyin pa la dga' ba'o //

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gzhan dag la bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin te zhes bya bas ni yang dang yang ster ba'i sbyin pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gzhan dag la bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin te zhes bya bas ni yang dang yang ster ba'i sbyin pa bshad pa yin no //

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis sbyin par byed ces bya bas ni sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas dus gsum du rab tu dga' ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa ni rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis sbyin par byed ces bya bas ni sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas dus gsum du rab tu dga' ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa ni rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: Giving with a joyful mind shows giving with a joyful mind in the three times, in relation to giving.

original: nyung ngu las kyang bgo bsha' byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du sbyin pa dang dka' ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: nyung ngu las kyang bgo bsha' byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du sbyin pa dang dka' ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving even a little shows giving at all times and giving what is difficult to give.

original: bzang po sbyin par byed pa ni dman pa sbyin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po sbyin par byed pa ni dman pa sbyin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Giving good things shows giving what is excellent, not what is inferior.

original: yang de ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that should be understood as threefold:

original: brtags shing brtags shing 'thab mo byas nas mi sbyin pa dang / bzang zhing mang po yod bzhin du dman zhing nyung ba mi sbyin pa dang / dam pa gya nom pa yod la shin tu dman pa mi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: brtags shing brtags shing 'thab mo byas nas mi sbyin pa dang / bzang zhing mang po yod bzhin du dman zhing nyung ba mi sbyin pa dang / dam pa gya nom pa yod la shin tu dman pa mi sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving after examining means not giving without examination. Giving after examining means not giving what is excellent when inferior things are available. Giving after examining means not giving when excellent things are available, but giving when only inferior things are available.

original: sbyin pa mi byed pa la yang 'dzem par byed ces bya ba ni slong ba po med cing mi slong ba na yid la yang dag par gdung ba skye bar 'gyur bas ngo tsha ba ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa mi byed pa la yang 'dzem par byed ces bya ba ni slong ba po med cing mi slong ba na yid la yang dag par gdung ba skye bar 'gyur bas ngo tsha ba ste /
translated: One also feels shame in not giving, means that when there is no one to beg and no one begs, one feels shame in the arising of mental anguish.

original: bdag ni skal ba chung bar gyur pas bdag gi bdog pa rnams 'bras bu med par gyur te /
analyzed: bdag ni skal ba chung bar gyur pas bdag gi bdog pa rnams 'bras bu med par gyur te /
translated: I am of little fortune, and my possessions are fruitless.

original: ngur khrod kyi shing gi 'bras bu bzhin du nye bar longs spyad pa la mkho bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: ngur khrod kyi shing gi 'bras bu bzhin du nye bar longs spyad pa la mkho bar ma gyur to //
translated: Like the fruit of a tree in a charnel ground, they are not useful for enjoyment.

original: de ltar re zhig bdag nyid kyi bdog pa gtong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sbyin pa'i rtags bstan pa yin no //🔽nga ni gzhan du gtogs pa'i sbyin pa la yang dag par nan tan byed pa'i rtags bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bdag nyid kyi bdog pa gtong ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sbyin pa'i rtags bstan pa yin no // nga ni gzhan du gtogs pa'i sbyin pa la yang dag par nan tan byed pa'i rtags bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of giving, which is the giving up of one's own possessions, has been taught.

original: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In order to teach the characteristic of giving that is based on the possessions of others, it is said: Also, with regard to others...

original: gang zag rnam pa bzhir shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa bzhir shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know that there are four types of persons with regard to giving.

original: sbyin pa'i yon tan dang bsngags pa @9a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i yon tan dang bsngags pa @9a * //
translated: The qualities and praise of giving,

original: yongs su mi shes pa kun du rmongs pa dang / bag med pa dang / zhum pa dang / yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa kun du rmongs pa dang / bag med pa dang / zhum pa dang / yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: ignorance, heedlessness, discouragement, and correct engagement.

original: de la kun du rmongs pa rnams la sbyin pa'i yon tan dang bsngags pa rab tu bstan cing bshad pas yang dag par bstan nas /
analyzed: de la kun du rmongs pa rnams la sbyin pa'i yon tan dang bsngags pa rab tu bstan cing bshad pas yang dag par bstan nas /
translated: Among them, those who are ignorant are taught by demonstrating and explaining the virtues and praises of generosity.

original: sbyin pa sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i bsngags pa rjod par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i bsngags pa rjod par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are made to praise generosity because they are caused to practice generosity.

original: bag med pa dang zhum pa sbyin pa la yang dag par sbyor ba dang gzengs bstod pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed du 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag med pa dang zhum pa sbyin pa la yang dag par sbyor ba dang gzengs bstod pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed du 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those who are heedless and discouraged are caused to generate enthusiasm in order to be encouraged to practice generosity.

original: yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams rab tu dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir sbyin phod pa mthong na yang yi rangs pa dang yid bde bar 'gyur zhes bya bas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa rnams rab tu dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir sbyin phod pa mthong na yang yi rangs pa dang yid bde bar 'gyur zhes bya bas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Those who are correctly engaged are made to rejoice and be happy when they see the generosity of others in order to generate joy.

original: de ltar re zhig bdog cing yod pa'i rdzas yongs su btang ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bdog cing yod pa'i rdzas yongs su btang ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the giving of owned and possessed substances,

original: yongs su longs spyad pa'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i rtags bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyad pa'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i rtags bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the sign of generosity that is the giving of things that are fully enjoyed,

original: bla ma rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, “to gurus, etc.”

original: de la khyim pa'i phyogs kyi bla ma ni ma dang pha'o //
analyzed: de la khyim pa'i phyogs kyi bla ma ni ma dang pha'o //
translated: Among them, the gurus of the householder are his mother and father.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams kyi ni mkhan po dang slob dpon rnams so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams kyi ni mkhan po dang slob dpon rnams so //
translated: The gurus of the ordained are his preceptor and teacher.

original: rgan rabs rnams kyi ni khyim pa'i phyogs rnams la ni rigs kyis rgan pa'o //
analyzed: rgan rabs rnams kyi ni khyim pa'i phyogs rnams la ni rigs kyis rgan pa'o //
translated: The elders are those who are senior by virtue of their family lineage among householders.

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la ni tshangs par spyod pa dang bcas pa'i dge slong gi dngos po'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la ni tshangs par spyod pa dang bcas pa'i dge slong gi dngos po'o //
translated: Those who are senior by virtue of their spiritual life are the monks who have kept the vows of ethical discipline for a long time.

original: yon gnas rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yon gnas rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who are worthy of gifts are

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / dge ba'i chos kyi dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams so //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / dge ba'i chos kyi dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams so //
translated: those who are endowed with ethical discipline, good qualities, and the virtuous qualities of spiritual practice, whether they be householders or the ordained.

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la ni rtogs pa'i chos dang lung gi chos 'dzin pa shes rab can rnams dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis brtsis pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la ni rtogs pa'i chos dang lung gi chos 'dzin pa shes rab can rnams dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis brtsis pa'o //
translated: In the case of the side of going forth, it is reckoned by those who are wise in upholding the Dharma of realization and the Dharma of scripture, and by those who are endowed with pure conduct.

original: bkur stir bya bar 'os pa rnams la yang langs nas mdun du bsu bas stan stobs par byed ces bya ba ni stan la 'dug cig par go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bkur stir bya bar 'os pa rnams la yang langs nas mdun du bsu bas stan stobs par byed ces bya ba ni stan la 'dug cig par go bar byed pa'o //
translated: And for those who are worthy of honor, one stands up, welcomes them, and offers them a seat.

original: de ltar yod cing bdog pa'i rdzas yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i rtags dang yongs su longs spyod pa'i sbyin pa'i rtags bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar yod cing bdog pa'i rdzas yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i rtags dang yongs su longs spyod pa'i sbyin pa'i rtags bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the signs of generosity in giving away one's possessions and the signs of generosity in enjoying one's possessions,

original: rdzas la mi ltos pa'i sbyin pa'i rtags bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzas la mi ltos pa'i sbyin pa'i rtags bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the signs of generosity that does not depend on possessions,

original: rdzas la mi ltos pa'i @9b sbyin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rdzas la mi ltos pa'i @9b sbyin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: it says, Generosity that does not depend on possessions is of two kinds.

original: man ngag nye bar bstan pas lus nye bar brtan par byed pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rab tu sbyin pas srog nye bar brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: man ngag nye bar bstan pas lus nye bar brtan par byed pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rab tu sbyin pas srog nye bar brtan par byed pa'o //
translated: It stabilizes the body by teaching instructions and it stabilizes life by giving fearlessness.

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: The first of these is stated in the verse:🔽Whether asked or unasked,

original: dris kyang rung ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni /🔽gsol ba btab kyang rung ma btab kyang rung zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dris kyang rung ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni / gsol ba btab kyang rung ma btab kyang rung zhes bya ba ste /
translated: means whether requested or unrequested.

original: don du gnyer ba'am mi gnyer ba dag la yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'am mi gnyer ba dag la yang rung ba'o //
translated: It is proper for those who are interested or not interested in the matter.

original: sems can gyi bya ba dag la zhes bya ba ni bya bya bar 'os pa skabs la bab pa'i tshe yon tan dang skyon mi shes pa dag la yang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi bya ba dag la zhes bya ba ni bya bya bar 'os pa skabs la bab pa'i tshe yon tan dang skyon mi shes pa dag la yang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: As for the phrase, “in the activities of sentient beings,” it means that even those who do not know the good qualities and faults of a situation are not at fault when they act in a proper way in a timely manner.

original: mi slu ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi slu ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “not deceptive” and “not mistaken” is the same.

original: rigs pa'i man ngag ces bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i man ngag ste /
analyzed: rigs pa'i man ngag ces bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i man ngag ste /
translated: “Instruction in reasoning” means instruction that is irreproachable.

original: de dag la yang bya bar 'os pa dang / bya bar 'os pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dang skyon ni 'di dag go zhes man ngag nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang bya bar 'os pa dang / bya bar 'os pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dang skyon ni 'di dag go zhes man ngag nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of instruction in the good qualities and faults of what is proper and improper to do.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed cing zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byin par byed pa dang / rten sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed cing zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byin par byed pa dang / rten sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: He gives fearlessness means he gives relief and he gives support.

original: yongs su skyob par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa de dag las grol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su skyob par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa de dag las grol bar byed pa ste /
translated: He protects completely means he liberates from those fears.

original: thar bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thar bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he liberates.

original: sgo sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni sgo mang po nas zhugs pa ste 'jigs pa de dang de las byung ba'i zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sgo sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni sgo mang po nas zhugs pa ste 'jigs pa de dang de las byung ba'i zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Through various doors means through many doors. The idea is that he comes from this and that fear.

original: mang po drag po zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad cing dus ring por 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mang po drag po zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad cing dus ring por 'byung ba'o //
translated: Many and violent means that they occur continuously for a long time.

original: drag po ni chen po nyid do //
analyzed: drag po ni chen po nyid do //
translated: Violent means great.

original: gzhan la gnod pa mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir gzhan de nyid la yongs su gtong ba'i mchan nyid can gyi rdzas sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir gzhan de nyid la yongs su gtong ba'i mchan nyid can gyi rdzas sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to giving material things, which is characterized by giving to others in order to prevent harm to others, he says:

original: gzhan gyi nor gtams na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor gtams na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even if he has buried the wealth of others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rigs la gnas pa dag nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis nam yang gzhan gyi nor gtams pa 'phrog par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rigs la gnas pa dag nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis nam yang gzhan gyi nor gtams pa 'phrog par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the spiritual lineage never steals the wealth of others through the power of the mental afflictions and secondary mental afflictions.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:🔽“He does not take what was not given” means that he does not steal and does not cheat.🔽“Even when he is in debt, he does not deceive” means that he pays back the principal along with the interest.🔽“He does not take what was not given” means that he does not leave without paying his bill.

original: dor mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'phrog par mi byed cing co 'dri bar mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dor mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'phrog par mi byed cing co 'dri bar mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “He does not divide up the wealth of the family” means that he does not act deceitfully.

original: bu lon chags na yang blu bar mi byed ces bya ba ni skyed ji tsam 'phel dang bcas par ster bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bu lon chags na yang blu bar mi byed ces bya ba ni skyed ji tsam 'phel dang bcas par ster bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Even when he is in debt, he does not deceive” means that he pays back the principal along with the interest.

original: dor mi byed do zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa byas nas langs nas mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dor mi byed do zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa byas nas langs nas mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: “He does not take what was not given” means that he does not leave without paying his bill.

original: rigs rgyud kyi nor yod par gyur pa rnams la bgo ba sha 'byed cing g-yo mi byed @10a * //
analyzed: rigs rgyud kyi nor yod par gyur pa rnams la bgo ba sha 'byed cing g-yo mi byed @10a * //
translated: “He does not divide up the wealth of the family” means that he does not act deceitfully.

original: la blu bar mi byed de /
analyzed: la blu bar mi byed de /
translated: “He does not deceive” means that he does not cheat.

original: chung ngu tsam ston pa'am /🔽ngan pa ston pa'am /
analyzed: chung ngu tsam ston pa'am / ngan pa ston pa'am /
translated: He does not teach a little and then stop.🔽He does not teach badly.

original: ye mi ster ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ye mi ster ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: He does not fail to teach.

original: rin po che brtag pa la mi mkhas shing /
analyzed: rin po che brtag pa la mi mkhas shing /
translated: He is not unskilled in evaluating jewels.

original: rin po che mi shes pa dag dang / nyo tshong byed pa na rdzas kyi bdag pos rin chung ngu btab pa las /
analyzed: rin po che mi shes pa dag dang / nyo tshong byed pa na rdzas kyi bdag pos rin chung ngu btab pa las /
translated: The word even is used to include those who do not know the value of the jewel.

original: bdag nyid rin po che brtag pa la shin tu mkhas pas des phab pa'i rin des de nyo bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: bdag nyid rin po che brtag pa la shin tu mkhas pas des phab pa'i rin des de nyo bar mi byed cing /
translated: When he is buying something, the owner of the jewel may name a low price, but the bodhisattva, who is very skilled at evaluating jewels, will not pay that price.

original: ji tsam ri ba yang dag par bstan nas //
analyzed: ji tsam ri ba yang dag par bstan nas //
translated: He will show the owner the true value of the jewel, saying, This is worth so much.

original: gal te bdag la rdzas bdog na ji tsam ri bas de len par byed do //
analyzed: gal te bdag la rdzas bdog na ji tsam ri bas de len par byed do //
translated: If the owner has need of the jewel, he will take it for that price.

original: med na de la ji tsam ri ba yang dag par ston par byed do //
analyzed: med na de la ji tsam ri ba yang dag par ston par byed do //
translated: If he does not need it, he will show him the true value, saying, This is worth so much.

original: de ltar phyin ci ma log par yang dag par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci ma log par yang dag par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown it to him without error,

original: de ci nas gzhan gyis kyang blu bar mi 'gyur bar yang dag par khong du chud par byed do //🔽nye bar longs spyad pa'i khyad par gyis phan gdags pa'i sbyin pas yang dag par nan tan bya ba'i rtags yang dag par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ci nas gzhan gyis kyang blu bar mi 'gyur bar yang dag par khong du chud par byed do // nye bar longs spyad pa'i khyad par gyis phan gdags pa'i sbyin pas yang dag par nan tan bya ba'i rtags yang dag par bstan pa ni /
translated: he will cause him to understand it so that no one else can cheat him.🔽The generosity of benefiting others by giving them what they need is shown by the following verse, which is a summary of the practice of generosity.

original: phan gdags pa'i bye brag rnams kyang sbyin pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i bye brag rnams kyang sbyin pa zhes brjod de /
translated: The verse says, The various kinds of help are called generosity.

original: gtang bar bya ba yin pas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: gtang bar bya ba yin pas zhes byas nas so //
translated: and he should give it away.

original: ji skad du mdo gzhan dag las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo gzhan dag las /
translated: As it is said in other sūtras:

original: bza' ba dang btung ba'i sbyin ba dag tu 'gyur zhes rgya cher gsungs pas bza' ba dang btung ba rgya chen po yod cing bdog par gyur na de la bgo bsha' byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba'i sbyin ba dag tu 'gyur zhes rgya cher gsungs pas bza' ba dang btung ba rgya chen po yod cing bdog par gyur na de la bgo bsha' byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “When he has a great deal of food and drink, he should share it.”

original: longs spyod rnams 'byung ba'i sgor gyur pa gang yin pa la yang dag pa'i nan tan gyis sbyin pa'i rtags ston par byed do //
analyzed: longs spyod rnams 'byung ba'i sgor gyur pa gang yin pa la yang dag pa'i nan tan gyis sbyin pa'i rtags ston par byed do //
translated: He shows the sign of generosity by his right practice, which is the door to the arising of wealth.

original: nus pa yod par gyur na longs spyod rgya chen po 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las kyi mtha' la sbyor gyi /
analyzed: nus pa yod par gyur na longs spyod rgya chen po 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las kyi mtha' la sbyor gyi /
translated: He engages in the kind of work that will increase his wealth, if he has the ability to do so.

original: las kyi mtha' chung ngu la ni ma yin /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' chung ngu la ni ma yin /
translated: He does not engage in the kind of work that will only maintain his present condition, much less that which would result in a decrease.

original: de lta bu la bsam pa yang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de lta bu la bsam pa yang mi 'jug go //
translated: He does not even think about such work.🔽He does not engage in the kind of work that is a small door to wealth.

original: 'du ba'i sgo chung ngu dag la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mos pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'du ba'i sgo chung ngu dag la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mos pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the lack of lack of aspiration.

original: longs spyod 'byung ba'i sgo ma yin pa de dag la rgyab kyis phyogs par byed pa ni longs spyod la nan tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod 'byung ba'i sgo ma yin pa de dag la rgyab kyis phyogs par byed pa ni longs spyod la nan tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Turning one's back on those who are not doors to the arising of wealth is called being intent on wealth.

original: de'i dbang du bas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i dbang du bas nas smras pa /
translated: Having been subjugated by that, he said:

original: zhugs pa ni 'di dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhugs pa ni 'di dag yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: These are the practices.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: One attains freedom from attachment means that one wishes to be free from the opposing side.

original: de dag la skyon mthong ba dang mi mthun par mthong bas rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la skyon mthong ba dang mi mthun par mthong bas rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By seeing faults in them and seeing them as opposing, one abandons them.

original: @10b sngon bsten pa la yang ngo tsha skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @10b sngon bsten pa la yang ngo tsha skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One also feels shame for having previously relied on them.

original: de'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ston to zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ston to zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it shows shame and modesty.

original: 'gyod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one feels regret.

original: longs spyod thob pa la sgrub pa'i rtags de nyid kyang sbyin pa'i rtags su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod thob pa la sgrub pa'i rtags de nyid kyang sbyin pa'i rtags su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that very sign of practice in obtaining wealth as a sign of generosity,🔽he said:

original: longs spyod rgya chen po dag rnyed na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nor chen po rnyed pa'i dus na yang dman pa rnams kyis rnyed pa ltar shin tu chags par mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: longs spyod rgya chen po dag rnyed na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nor chen po rnyed pa'i dus na yang dman pa rnams kyis rnyed pa ltar shin tu chags par mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: Even when he obtains great wealth, he does not become attached to it as do the inferior people.

original: shas cher brkam par mi 'gyur zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shas cher brkam par mi 'gyur zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, he is not greedy for the most part.

original: ma chags pa'i sbyor bas longs spyod la ltos pa med par gnas par 'gyur ro //🔽mdor bsdu na 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyis /
analyzed: ma chags pa'i sbyor bas longs spyod la ltos pa med par gnas par 'gyur ro // mdor bsdu na 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyis /
translated: By the application of nonattachment, he remains independent of wealth.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, morality should be understood as twofold: the morality of engagement and the morality of nonengagement.

original: de la ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni nyes par spyod pa las ldog pa'i sdom pa blangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni nyes par spyod pa las ldog pa'i sdom pa blangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of nonengagement is the morality of the vow to refrain from immorality.

original: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims te /
translated: The morality of engagement is the morality of gathering virtuous qualities and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de dag ni bsil bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bsil bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are cool by nature.

original: nyes par spyod pa rgya che ba'am /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa rgya che ba'am /
translated: It is a great evil deed.🔽

original: rgya chung ba'i nyes par spyod pa'i khyad par nges par bstan pas /
analyzed: rgya chung ba'i nyes par spyod pa'i khyad par nges par bstan pas /
translated: The distinction between extensive and non-extensive misdeeds is taught.

original: ldog pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach the morality of turning away from misdeeds,

original: lus dang ngag gi las mi dge ba chung ngu dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las mi dge ba chung ngu dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he says, “They possess small non-virtuous actions of body and speech.”

original: lus dang ngag gi smos pa ni /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi smos pa ni /
translated: The mention of body and speech is

original: ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag gi sdom pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag gi sdom pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the morality of turning away from misdeeds is included in the vows of body and speech.

original: nyes par spyod pa rgya che ba ni las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa rgya che ba ni las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Extensive misdeeds are included in the paths of action.

original: rgya che ba ma yin pa ni las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ma yin pa ni las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-extensive misdeeds are not included in the paths of action.

original: de la las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / mjug gi dbang du byas nas nyes par spyod pa chung ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / mjug gi dbang du byas nas nyes par spyod pa chung ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the smallness of misdeeds from the point of view of the preparation, actual basis, and conclusion of the paths of action,

original: lus dang ngag gi las chung ngu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las chung ngu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he says, “They possess small actions of body and speech.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan pa la sems kyi rgyud rtag par nyon mongs pa drag cing mthug pa ma yin pa dag la sems can rnams kyi srog dang longs spyod dang / chung ma la gnod pa byed pa'i lus dang ngag gi las 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan pa la sems kyi rgyud rtag par nyon mongs pa drag cing mthug pa ma yin pa dag la sems can rnams kyi srog dang longs spyod dang / chung ma la gnod pa byed pa'i lus dang ngag gi las 'byung ba med de /
translated: In those who possess the bodhisattva lineage, the mental continuum is never strongly and deeply afflicted, and they do not engage in the actions of body and speech that harm the life, property, and spouses of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi thugs rje chen po'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi thugs rje chen po'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they possess the seed of the great compassion of the buddhas.

original: @11a * // shin tu rjes su mi mthun pa ma yin pa ni mi 'dod pa 'bras bu chen po 'byin par mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @11a * // shin tu rjes su mi mthun pa ma yin pa ni mi 'dod pa 'bras bu chen po 'byin par mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are not extremely unwholesome, meaning that they are not able to produce a great result that is not desired.

original: shin tu drag po ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu drag po ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not extremely violent, meaning

original: drag po ni sems kyi drag po dang / lus kyi drag po'o //
analyzed: drag po ni sems kyi drag po dang / lus kyi drag po'o //
translated: violence is either mental or physical.

original: de la sems kyi drag po ni sems can rnams la snying rje med pa'i sems kyis bsad pa dang / rdeg pa'i sems bskyed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyi drag po ni sems can rnams la snying rje med pa'i sems kyis bsad pa dang / rdeg pa'i sems bskyed par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, mental violence should be understood as the generation of the thought to kill or beat sentient beings with a mind devoid of compassion.

original: lus kyi drag po nyid ni bag med cing ngo tsha dang bral bas rdeg pa dang / rab tu rdeg par byed cing lag pa khrag gis sbags pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi drag po nyid ni bag med cing ngo tsha dang bral bas rdeg pa dang / rab tu rdeg par byed cing lag pa khrag gis sbags pa'o //
translated: The body is violent because of carelessness and shamelessness, and it strikes and strikes hard, with hands smeared with blood.

original: sems can la shin tu gnod pa dang ldan pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can la shin tu gnod pa dang ldan pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not that it is not very harmful to sentient beings.

original: drag po'i las byed ba nyid sems can la shin tu gnod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: drag po'i las byed ba nyid sems can la shin tu gnod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The very performance of violent actions is very harmful to sentient beings.

original: de lta bas na de ni de nyid kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni de nyid kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is its distinctive feature.

original: de ltar re zhig las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the preparation for the karmic path is taught from this point of view.

original: mjug gi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: mjug gi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The conclusion is taught from the point of view of the conclusion.

original: sdig pa'i las shig byas su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las shig byas su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said: “Even if one has done some evil action,”

original: byang chub sems dpa' las kyi lam gyi mthar thug par gyur pa na yang byas pa'i las de dang rjes su mthun par sems par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las kyi lam gyi mthar thug par gyur pa na yang byas pa'i las de dang rjes su mthun par sems par mi byed kyi /
translated: even when a bodhisattva has reached the end of the karmic path, he does not think in accordance with the action that was done.

original: bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i las de la dmad nas bdag nyid 'gyod pa mang bar gnas shing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i las de la dmad nas bdag nyid 'gyod pa mang bar gnas shing /
translated: Having reproached oneself for the action one has done, one dwells in a great deal of remorse.

original: myur ba myur bar te /
analyzed: myur ba myur bar te /
translated: Quickly, quickly,

original: las byas ma thag tu 'gyod pa yin gyi de'i rgyu mtshan gyis mthong ba'i chos nyid la nyes par mthong bar gyur nas /
analyzed: las byas ma thag tu 'gyod pa yin gyi de'i rgyu mtshan gyis mthong ba'i chos nyid la nyes par mthong bar gyur nas /
translated: one regrets the action as soon as it is done, and not because one sees the fault in the present life.

original: de'i rjes la 'gyod pa lta bu ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'gyod pa lta bu ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not regret it later.

original: de la yang 'dzem bzhin du spyod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang 'dzem bzhin du spyod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, one engages in it while being restrained.

original: dngos gzhi'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught from the perspective of the actual basis.

original: ma byas na yang gzhan nyes dmigs che la byed pa na yang sems bag tsha ba dang / 'dzem pa bzhin du ste /
analyzed: ma byas na yang gzhan nyes dmigs che la byed pa na yang sems bag tsha ba dang / 'dzem pa bzhin du ste /
translated: Even if one does not do it, it is a great fault. When one does it, one does it with a mind that is fearful and restrained.

original: ngo tsha ba dang bcas pa'i sems dang mi mthun pa'i sems kyis sdig de byed kyi /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang bcas pa'i sems dang mi mthun pa'i sems kyis sdig de byed kyi /
translated: One does that evil with a mind that is ashamed, not with a mind that is not in accord with that.

original: dga' ba dang yid bde bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang yid bde bas ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not do it with joy and mental satisfaction.

original: rigs kyi stobs dang bsam pa'i khyad par gyis de lta bu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi stobs dang bsam pa'i khyad par gyis de lta bu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is because of the strength of one’s family and the difference in one’s thoughts that one becomes that kind of person.

original: nyes par spyod pa rgya che ba ma yin pa la kun du spyod pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa rgya che ba ma yin pa la kun du spyod pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The difference in the extent of their misdeeds is considered.🔽

original: sems can rnams la lag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la lag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: The difference in the practice of the bodhisattva is shown by the words, “not with a hand, etc.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rigs dang ldan pa la @11b mnar sems dang / gnod sems kyis lag pa dang / bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha la sogs pas sems can rnams la brnag dka' ba dang / drag po'i sdug bsngal bskyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rigs dang ldan pa la @11b mnar sems dang / gnod sems kyis lag pa dang / bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha la sogs pas sems can rnams la brnag dka' ba dang / drag po'i sdug bsngal bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with the spiritual gene does not inflict unbearable and violent suffering on sentient beings with a hand, a clod, a stick, a weapon, etc., out of malice and ill will.

original: sems can rnams la rjes su brtse ba mang ba'i phyir dang ; de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par mi byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rjes su brtse ba mang ba'i phyir dang ; de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sun par mi byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he has great compassion for sentient beings and because he is by nature one who does not offend the Tathagata.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rang bzhin gyis mnyes gshin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mnyes gshin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “He is naturally compassionate.”

original: snying rjes sems can rnams la rjes su brtse ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa la re ba med pa'i sems dang / tshe 'di la lan du phan 'dogs pa la re ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rjes sems can rnams la rjes su brtse ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa la re ba med pa'i sems dang / tshe 'di la lan du phan 'dogs pa la re ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of their compassion, they have a mind that is full of love for sentient beings, a mind that is free of hope for the evolutionary development of their generosity, and a mind that is free of hope for any return for their generosity in this life.

original: rang bzhin gyis mnyes gshin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mnyes gshin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be naturally affectionate.

original: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of their equality of self and other, they have the superior intention that is appropriate to their spiritual lineage.

original: sems can la dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can la dga' ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are said to love sentient beings.🔽The ten aspects of the spiritual life are the practice of generosity, etc.🔽The ten aspects of the spiritual life are the practice of generosity, etc.🔽The ten aspects of the spiritual life are the practice of generosity, etc.🔽The ten aspects of the spiritual life are the practice of generosity, etc.

original: rnam pa bcus ji ltar rigs par sems can la sogs pa'i yul la yang dag par sgrub par byed pas 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtags bstan pa'i phyir /🔽bkur sti bya bar 'os pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs kyi rtags yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcus ji ltar rigs par sems can la sogs pa'i yul la yang dag par sgrub par byed pas 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtags bstan pa'i phyir /🔽bkur sti bya bar 'os pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs kyi rtags yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du'o //

original: de la 'jig rten shes pa'i dbang dbang du byas nas khyad par can dang / mnyam pa dang / dman pa'i sems can rnams la nus pa ci yod pa dang / di ltar 'os par sgrub par byed phan /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten shes pa'i dbang dbang du byas nas khyad par can dang / mnyam pa dang / dman pa'i sems can rnams la nus pa ci yod pa dang / di ltar 'os par sgrub par byed phan /
translated: In this regard, with regard to the knowledge of the world, one should practice to the best of one's ability and as much as one is able with regard to superior, equal, and inferior sentient beings.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum spangs la /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum spangs la /
translated: One should abandon the three secondary defilements

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam pas rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam pas rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and one should practice with the factors that are their antidotes.

original: de la khyad par can gyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la khyad par can gyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa ni /
translated: In this regard, the teaching with regard to the superior is as follows:

original: bkur sti bya bar 'os pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bkur sti bya bar 'os pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should also serve those who are worthy of honor.

original: yang de dag ni sngar bstan pa'i bla ma dang / rgan rabs dang / mchod gnas rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de dag ni sngar bstan pa'i bla ma dang / rgan rabs dang / mchod gnas rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who are worthy of honor are to be known as the gurus, the elders, and the venerable ones who were previously taught.

original: de dag la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phrag dog spangs la /
analyzed: de dag la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phrag dog spangs la /
translated: One should abandon the secondary defilement of envy with regard to them,

original: bsnyen bkur dang / g-yog gi las la yang dag par nan tan byed par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur dang / g-yog gi las la yang dag par nan tan byed par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: and one should practice properly the duties of service and attendance.🔽 That very thing is called bowing down.

original: de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: 'dud pa'i las kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dud pa'i las kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: By the action of bowing down.

original: mnyam pa rnams la 'gran pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas /
analyzed: mnyam pa rnams la 'gran pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the secondary defilement of rivalry with equals,

original: de'i sems bsrung bar @12a * //
analyzed: de'i sems bsrung bar @12a * //
translated: he should protect his mind.

original: bya zhing / dmad par mi bya bar rab tu gnas pas yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya zhing / dmad par mi bya bar rab tu gnas pas yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the correct practice of living in a state of not despising others,

original: mthun par 'dzin pa dang / shes nyen can dang / pha rol gyi sems dang mthun par 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthun par 'dzin pa dang / shes nyen can dang / pha rol gyi sems dang mthun par 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he is one who holds to the agreeable, who is discreet, and who engages in conformity with the minds of others.

original: dman pa rnams la brnyas pa yang /
analyzed: dman pa rnams la brnyas pa yang /
translated: Despising the lowly is

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin pas rnam par spangs la /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin pas rnam par spangs la /
translated: also a secondary defilement. Having abandoned it,

original: mdangs bzang po bstan nas mngon du phyogs par byas la /
analyzed: mdangs bzang po bstan nas mngon du phyogs par byas la /
translated: he should show a good countenance, and face them.

original: yang dag par bsgrub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the correct practice of living in a state of not despising others,

original: 'dzum pa sngon du gtong pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzum pa sngon du gtong pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: he is one who holds to the agreeable, who is discreet, and who engages in conformity with the minds of others.

original: sems can phan 'dogs pa rnams la byas pa gzo zhing gyas pa shes pas rtag tu gnas nas lan du phan gdags pa'i phyir rab tu gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can phan 'dogs pa rnams la byas pa gzo zhing gyas pa shes pas rtag tu gnas nas lan du phan gdags pa'i phyir rab tu gnas pa yin no //
translated: He is one who is grateful and appreciative to those who help sentient beings, and always lives in a state of gratitude. He lives in a state of gratitude in order to repay their kindness.

original: phan gdags pa yang dang yang rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor bas gnas pas na byas pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: phan gdags pa yang dang yang rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor bas gnas pas na byas pa shes pa'o //
translated: One is grateful because one remembers again and again the help that others have given one, and one is obliged because one is ready to help others in return.

original: bdag gis 'di la lan du phan gdags par 'os pa yin zhes drin shes pas na byas pa gzo ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la lan du phan gdags par 'os pa yin zhes drin shes pas na byas pa gzo ba'o //
translated: One is grateful because one remembers the kindness of others, thinking, I must repay their kindness.

original: sems can slong ba rnams la ste /🔽phongs par gyur pa rnams kyi don bsgrubs pas bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: sems can slong ba rnams la ste / phongs par gyur pa rnams kyi don bsgrubs pas bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: One is obliged to sentient beings who ask for something.🔽One is obliged because one fulfills the wishes of those who are in need.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.

original: gzhan 'dun par byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni yang dag pa'i nan tan te /🔽drang por byed kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //🔽bya'o zhes khas blangs nas dus ring por mi sgrub par 'jog pa ni g-yo dang sgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'dun par byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni yang dag pa'i nan tan te / drang por byed kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no // bya'o zhes khas blangs nas dus ring por mi sgrub par 'jog pa ni g-yo dang sgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.🔽 One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.

original: rang gi las kyi mtha' rnams yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: rang gi las kyi mtha' rnams yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: One is obliged because one is a means of accomplishing the aims of others.

original: chos kyis zhes bya ba ni rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyis zhes bya ba ni rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: One is obliged because one is a means

original: bab col ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bab col ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: “Not rash” means not committing evil.

original: yang na gdong mchi ma dang bcas par dub dang / rang gi bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa'i skyes bu dag kyang chos ma yin pa la mi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gdong mchi ma dang bcas par dub dang / rang gi bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa'i skyes bu dag kyang chos ma yin pa la mi sbyor ba'o //
translated: Or else, with a tearful face, he does not engage in non-Dharma even when exhausted, and does not engage his own male and female servants and laborers in non-Dharma.

original: gzhan dbang du gyur pa rang dbang med pa dag stobs kyis bkug nas mi sbyor ba yang bab col ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dbang du gyur pa rang dbang med pa dag stobs kyis bkug nas mi sbyor ba yang bab col ma yin pa'o //
translated: He does not engage others who are under his control but lack independence in non-Dharma by force, and this is not rash.

original: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnams yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnams yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to the accomplishment of the bases of meritorious action, it is said:

original: rang bzhin gyis kyang bsod nams la dga' ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kyang bsod nams la dga' ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “He is naturally fond of merit, and so on.

original: gzhan bsod nams byed pa dag gi grogs bya ba la yang gus @12b pa dang bcas par byed na /
analyzed: gzhan bsod nams byed pa dag gi grogs bya ba la yang gus @12b pa dang bcas par byed na /
translated: If he is respectful in helping others who are engaged in meritorious actions,

original: rang gi bsod nams kyi las la ni shin tu yang 'bad par byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi bsod nams kyi las la ni shin tu yang 'bad par byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: he will be very diligent in his own meritorious actions.

original: de lta bu la 'bad par bya ba ni sbyin pa dag sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la 'bad par bya ba ni sbyin pa dag sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should strive in this way and give gifts.

original: bsod nams dag kyang bya ba yin no //🔽smyung bar gnas par yang bya'o //🔽tshul khrims dag kyang yang dag par blangs nas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dag kyang bya ba yin no // smyung bar gnas par yang bya'o // tshul khrims dag kyang yang dag par blangs nas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
translated: Having taken up the moral precepts, one should observe them.🔽One should understand the other practices as they are taught in other sutras, such as the one that says:🔽One should understand the other practices as they are taught in other sutras, such as the one that says:🔽One should understand the other practices as they are taught in other sutras, such as the one that says:
