original: de dag gi sdug bsngal bdag gi rgyud kyi bzhin du mthong ba'i snying gzhan la gnod pas shin tu gnod pas shin tu gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi sdug bsngal bdag gi rgyud kyi bzhin du mthong ba'i snying gzhan la gnod pas shin tu gnod pas shin tu gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of one's heart is pained as if by an arrow is that one sees the suffering of others as if it were one's own suffering.

original: chos yang dag par blang ba ched cher 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni yi dam blangs pa la bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos yang dag par blang ba ched cher 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni yi dam blangs pa la bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one holds the Dharma as most important is stated in order to show that one has taken up the vow of a bodhisattva.

original: lus dang srog dang / longs spyod la ltos pa med par gyur pas na tshe phyi mched cher 'dzin pa yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang srog dang / longs spyod la ltos pa med par gyur pas na tshe phyi mched cher 'dzin pa yin zhes bya'o //
translated: One holds the future as most important because one is not concerned with one's body, life, or possessions.

original: 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba la chags na'ang nag po'i phyogs kyi nyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba la chags na'ang nag po'i phyogs kyi nyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Even when one is attached to the pleasures of this world, one sees the disadvantages of the dark side.

original: kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta na mang po la lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni da ltar yang shin tu sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta na mang po la lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni da ltar yang shin tu sdug bsngal la /
translated: One sees the danger in even the slightest misdeed, much less in great ones. One is in great pain even now,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan dag kyang 'byung ba'i skye mched du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan dag kyang 'byung ba'i skye mched du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and one is a source of other sufferings as well.

original: chos dang 'gal ba med pa dang / don nye bar ldan pa dang / rigs pa dang bral pa ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan gyi bya ba dag la grogs bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos dang 'gal ba med pa dang / don nye bar ldan pa dang / rigs pa dang bral pa ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan gyi bya ba dag la grogs bya ba'i phyir /
translated: He is not opposed to the Dharma, he is not devoid of reason, and he is not devoid of the benefit of others.

original: 'gro bar byed pa na bdag nyid kyis dam pa'i bya bas byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pa na bdag nyid kyis dam pa'i bya bas byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: When he goes to help others in their activities, he himself is engaged in the highest activity.

original: don dang ldan pa ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to show that he is not devoid of benefit, it is said:🔽He does not harm himself or others.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag la gnod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar re zhig pa'i bya ba dag la grogs bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag la gnod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar re zhig pa'i bya ba dag la grogs bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown the activities of the bodhisattva,

original: yang bya ba ma yin pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang bya ba ma yin pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to prohibit the activities of the bodhisattva,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur par byas la bya ba ma yin pa las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur par byas la bya ba ma yin pa las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he should become a spiritual friend and turn away from the activities of the bodhisattva.

original: bya ba ma @13a * //🔽yin pa 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba ma @13a * // yin pa 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: What are the activities of the bodhisattva?

original: bya ba ma yin ba ni bdag dang gzhan phung bar byed pa'i las de dag ni gcig tu bya ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin ba ni bdag dang gzhan phung bar byed pa'i las de dag ni gcig tu bya ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: They are the activities of the bodhisattva that are harmful to oneself and others.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the ten paths of unwholesome action.

original: de'i phyir sdig pa mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdig pa mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the ten paths of unwholesome action.”

original: de bzhin du re zhig gsol ba ma btab cing ma bcol ba dag la yang grogs byed du 'gro bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du re zhig gsol ba ma btab cing ma bcol ba dag la yang grogs byed du 'gro bar bstan nas /
translated: In this way, he has explained how one goes to assist others without being asked or requested.

original: gzhan gyis bcol zhing gsol ba btab pa rnams la grogs byed du 'gro ba bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du byed cing gzhan la rag las par byed de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bcol zhing gsol ba btab pa rnams la grogs byed du 'gro ba bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du byed cing gzhan la rag las par byed de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To explain how one goes to assist others who have been asked and requested, he says, “One comes under the control of others and becomes dependent on others.”

original: gzhan gyi bya ba'i rjes su zhugs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba'i rjes su zhugs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: To follow the activities of others is to come under the control of others.

original: de'i phyir bdag gi 'dor du bcug nas rang rang gi don la ci dga' mgur spyod par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gi 'dor du bcug nas rang rang gi don la ci dga' mgur spyod par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one is made to give up one’s own affairs and is made to do whatever others want.

original: tshul khrims mtshungs pa ni de'i las dang rang gi mtshungs pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: tshul khrims mtshungs pa ni de'i las dang rang gi mtshungs pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: “Having the same moral discipline” means having the same moral discipline as the other.

original: bzod pa mtshungs pa ni de'i las dang 'dra bar skyo ba med par byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: bzod pa mtshungs pa ni de'i las dang 'dra bar skyo ba med par byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: Patience is equal, because it is the state of mind that is not wearied by the same kind of work.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du byed pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du byed pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause of being controlled by others,

original: sems mnyen zhing zhes bya ba ni snying nye ba nyid dang sems kyi rgyud 'jam par byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems mnyen zhing zhes bya ba ni snying nye ba nyid dang sems kyi rgyud 'jam par byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he says, “his mind is tender,” because he has a mind that is affectionate and gentle.

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas par gyur na yang khro ba dang khon du 'dzin par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir yun ring du 'dzin par mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas par gyur na yang khro ba dang khon du 'dzin par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir yun ring du 'dzin par mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: In order to demonstrate that he does not become angry or hold a grudge when harmed by others, he says, “he does not hold grudges for a long time,” and so on.

original: so sor brtags pa nas sems gzu'o tsam du rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa nas sems gzu'o tsam du rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he should establish his mind in mere tolerance,

original: de'i mod la de'i sems bzang por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i mod la de'i sems bzang por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: he says, “immediately his mind becomes good.”

original: de ltar re zhig sems can la khro ba med par 'jug pa bstan pas 'jug pa'i tshul khrims bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sems can la khro ba med par 'jug pa bstan pas 'jug pa'i tshul khrims bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the morality of engagement through the teaching on the absence of anger toward sentient beings,🔽he now explains the morality of mastery.

original: yang ngag gi legs par spyad pa rnam pa bzhi la 'jug pas /
analyzed: yang ngag gi legs par spyad pa rnam pa bzhi la 'jug pas /
translated: Moreover, one engages in the four kinds of right speech.

original: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtags bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtags bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the sign of the morality of engagement,

original: bden pa ched cher 'dzin pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bden pa ched cher 'dzin pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: he says, “He holds truth dear.”

original: bden pa ched cher 'dzin pas srog dang / longs spyod dang / rgyal srid kyi ched du yang bden pa spangs nas bsams bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba yin no //
analyzed: bden pa ched cher 'dzin pas srog dang / longs spyod dang / rgyal srid kyi ched du yang bden pa spangs nas bsams bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba yin no //
translated: Because he holds truth dear, he does not, even for the sake of his life or wealth or kingdom, consciously utter falsehoods, having abandoned the truth.

original: dbyen bya bar mi dga' zhing mi byed ces bya ba ni dbyen bya bar bsam pa med cing mi byed ces bya ba'i @13b don to //🔽mi byed do zhes bya ba ni dbyen gyi tshig smra bar mi byed ces bya ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: dbyen bya bar mi dga' zhing mi byed ces bya ba ni dbyen bya bar bsam pa med cing mi byed ces bya ba'i @13b don to // mi byed do zhes bya ba ni dbyen gyi tshig smra bar mi byed ces bya ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: “ He does not delight in, nor does he engage in, disharmony” means that he does not have the intention to create disharmony, nor does he engage in it.🔽“ He does not engage in” means that he does not utter words that create disharmony.

original: ma gtsigs pa ni skabs dang 'brel pa med par 'jug pa'i tshig go //🔽bdag dang gzhan dag la phan pa med pa'i tshig ni mi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: ma gtsigs pa ni skabs dang 'brel pa med par 'jug pa'i tshig go // bdag dang gzhan dag la phan pa med pa'i tshig ni mi dgos pa'o //
translated: “ He does not utter” means that he does not utter words that are not connected with the occasion.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir don med pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir don med pa'o //
translated: “ He does not utter words that are useless” means that he does not utter words that are not beneficial to himself or others.🔽“ He does not utter words that are meaningless” means that he does not utter words that are not connected with a purpose.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i tshig smra bas na bab chol du yang smra ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i tshig smra bas na bab chol du yang smra ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: He does not speak incoherently, because he speaks with pleasant words.

original: pha rol gyi zhe gcod pa mi smra ba ni gzhan gyi gnad la 'phog pa mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi zhe gcod pa mi smra ba ni gzhan gyi gnad la 'phog pa mi smra ba'o //
translated: He does not speak words that cut into the quick of others, because he does not speak words that wound others.

original: tha na bdag gi bran g-yog la sogs pa dman pa rnams la yang tshig rtsub po smra bar mi byed na /
analyzed: tha na bdag gi bran g-yog la sogs pa dman pa rnams la yang tshig rtsub po smra bar mi byed na /
translated: He does not speak harsh words even to his servants, etc., who are inferior to him.

original: gzhan dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gzhan dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: How much less would he to others!

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis tshig rtsub po las ldog pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis tshig rtsub po las ldog pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the avoidance of harsh words in two ways,

original: pha rol la gnod pa byed pa na mi smra ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol la gnod pa byed pa na mi smra ba ni /
translated: he does not speak when he is about to harm another.

original: pha rol gyi zhe gcod pa mi smra zhes bya ba yin no //🔽yon tan rjod par byed pa nyid ni /
analyzed: pha rol gyi zhe gcod pa mi smra zhes bya ba yin no // yon tan rjod par byed pa nyid ni /
translated: This is the meaning of “he does not speak words that cut into the quick of others.🔽” He speaks words that are agreeable,

original: yon tan la dga' ba yin zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: yon tan la dga' ba yin zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: because he delights in virtue.

original: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas nas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i dbang du byas nas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'i /
translated: The avoidance of harsh words should be understood as the presentation of the signs of the perfection of patience, from the point of view of patience in enduring the harm done by others.

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not the patience of accepting suffering.

original: chos la nges par rtogs pa'i yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos la nges par rtogs pa'i yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the patience of certainty with regard to the Dharma.

original: dus gnyis su bsam pa dang sbyor bas bzod par byed cing /
analyzed: dus gnyis su bsam pa dang sbyor bas bzod par byed cing /
translated: Patience is practiced in two ways: through attitude and through application.

original: bzod pa med pa ni shin tu dmad pa yin pa dang / nyes dmigs dang bcas pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: bzod pa med pa ni shin tu dmad pa yin pa dang / nyes dmigs dang bcas pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: It is reprehensible and has disadvantages, so it is reprehensible.

original: nyes dmigs ldan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes dmigs ldan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has disadvantages and is disadvantageous.

original: bzod pa de yang gzhan gnod pa byed par gyur pa'i tshe bsam pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bzod pa de yang gzhan gnod pa byed par gyur pa'i tshe bsam pa bstan pa ni /
translated: That patience is taught in terms of attitude and application when someone is harming you.

original: kun nas mnar sems su mi byed la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems su mi byed la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The attitude is stated in the line “I will not be hostile,”

original: gang yang slar gnod pa bya bar mi sems pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang slar gnod pa bya bar mi sems pa'o //
translated: which means that you do not think of harming that person in return.

original: sbyor ba ni gnod pa yang mi byed do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gnod pa yang mi byed do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The application is stated in the line “I will not harm,”

original: sems kyis gnod pa bya bar mi rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis gnod pa bya bar mi rtsom pa'o //
translated: which means that you do not intend to harm that person.

original: gnod pa byas pa'i mjug tu bzod pa gsol zhing gros btab na de bzod pa de len cing nyan no //
analyzed: gnod pa byas pa'i mjug tu bzod pa gsol zhing gros btab na de bzod pa de len cing nyan no //
translated: If you ask for forgiveness and counsel after harming someone, that person will accept your patience and listen to you.

original: bzod pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: bzod pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to demonstrate the application of patience,

original: zhe la mi 'dzin cing yun ring du khon du 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyi gas kyang bzod pa'i bsam pa gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhe la mi 'dzin cing yun ring du khon du 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyi gas kyang bzod pa'i bsam pa gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: the two phrases “does not hold it in the mind” and “does not hold it for a long time” clearly demonstrate the attitude of patience.

original: de ltar bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i dus gnyi gar gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i nyid bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags su rig par @14a * //
analyzed: de ltar bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i dus gnyi gar gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'i nyid bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags su rig par @14a * //
translated: Thus, at both the time of attitude and the time of application, the patience of not retaliating against another’s harm should be known as the sign of the perfection of patience.

original: bya'o ; / brtson 'grus rnam pa lnga dang / de dag gi 'bras bu phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o ; / brtson 'grus rnam pa lnga dang / de dag gi 'bras bu phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of effort should be understood as being presented from the perspective of the five types of effort and their result, benefit.

original: dus kun du sbyor ba nyid ni rtag tu byed pa'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: dus kun du sbyor ba nyid ni rtag tu byed pa'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: Constant application is the effort of always acting.

original: des sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one becomes established in the effort of application.

original: de'i rtags bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rtags bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate its sign,

original: nang par sngar ldang zhing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nang par sngar ldang zhing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Get up before dawn and so on.

original: bde ba ha cang nyams su len par mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bde ba ha cang nyams su len par mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: “Rising early in the morning” and so on up to “not indulging in excessive comfort.”

original: de ltar na mnyan par bya bar 'os pa rnams la brtson 'grus kyis rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na mnyan par bya bar 'os pa rnams la brtson 'grus kyis rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, he teaches that one should be diligent in listening to what is to be studied.

original: gus par byed pa nyid ni rtag tu bya ba'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: gus par byed pa nyid ni rtag tu bya ba'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: “Respectfulness” is the diligence of constant practice.

original: de ni brtan pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni brtan pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “steadfastness.”

original: de'i rtags ni bya ba zhig byung na don de 'grub par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang nye bar gyur pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rtags ni bya ba zhig byung na don de 'grub par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang nye bar gyur pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The sign of that is: “When some action is to be done, in order to accomplish that aim” means when the action is at hand.

original: de la sbyor bar mi byed pa'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sbyor bar mi byed pa'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two causes for not applying oneself:

original: byed par 'dod pa'i 'dun pa med pa dang / le lo la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: byed par 'dod pa'i 'dun pa med pa dang / le lo la sbyor ba'o //
translated: lack of the desire to do it and the application of laziness.

original: de dag gnyi ga yang so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zil gyis mnan nas ji srid rdzogs kyi bar du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga yang so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zil gyis mnan nas ji srid rdzogs kyi bar du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Both of these are overcome by the power of discernment and one applies oneself until it is finished.

original: go cha brtan pa la rab tu sbyor ba nyid dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'i brtson 'grus kyis spro bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: go cha brtan pa la rab tu sbyor ba nyid dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'i brtson 'grus kyis spro bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: He is firmly devoted to the armor, and he is enthusiastic through the effort that has arisen from application.

original: de'i rtags kyis bya ba thams cad la mnyam par sbyor bas nges par brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rtags kyis bya ba thams cad la mnyam par sbyor bas nges par brtan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And through the sign of that, he is certainly firm, since he is applied equally to all actions.

original: nges par brtan pa nyid bshad pa ni /🔽ma byas sam /
analyzed: nges par brtan pa nyid bshad pa ni / ma byas sam /
translated: The explanation of firmness is:🔽He does not abandon effort until the work is done

original: ma zin gyi bar du brtson pa mi 'dor zhing zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma zin gyi bar du brtson pa mi 'dor zhing zhes bya ba ste /
translated: or until he has attained.

original: bya bar 'os pa ma byas pa dang / thob par bya ba ma thob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya bar 'os pa ma byas pa dang / thob par bya ba ma thob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: he does not do what should not be done, and he does not attain what should be attained.

original: bar du brtson pa mi 'dor zhing zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: bar du brtson pa mi 'dor zhing zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: He does not abandon effort until the work is done

original: res 'ga' lus dang sems yongs su skyo zhing ngal ba'i 'jigs pas brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa de med par brtan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: res 'ga' lus dang sems yongs su skyo zhing ngal ba'i 'jigs pas brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa de med par brtan pa'i phyir /
translated: means that he is not afraid of the fatigue and weariness of body and mind, and so he does not initiate effort intermittently.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad myong bas sgyid lug par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad myong bas sgyid lug par mi byed pa ste /
translated: He does not become discouraged by experiencing all sorts of suffering.

original: ngo bo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: He does not change his nature.

original: zhum par mi byed pa'i brtson 'grus kyis pha rol gnon pa brtan par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: zhum par mi byed pa'i brtson 'grus kyis pha rol gnon pa brtan par 'gyur ro ;
translated: By the effort of not being discouraged, one becomes firm in overcoming the opponent.

original: / de'i rtags ni /
analyzed: / de'i rtags ni /
translated: The sign of that is

original: don gyi mchog rgya chen po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi mchog rgya chen po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the supreme meaning, which is called “vast.”

original: rnam par yangs shing rgya che ba dang / gya nom pa'i don la sems zhum pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par yangs shing rgya che ba dang / gya nom pa'i don la sems zhum pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind is not discouraged about the meaning that is very vast and extensive,

original: shin tu yangs shing rgya che ba dag yongs su rdzogs par bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bsgrub par mi nus so zhes bdag nyid la brnyas par mi @14b byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu yangs shing rgya che ba dag yongs su rdzogs par bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bsgrub par mi nus so zhes bdag nyid la brnyas par mi @14b byed pa'o //
translated: and one does not disparage oneself by thinking, “I cannot accomplish the very vast and extensive perfections.”

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: bdag gis ni 'di rtogs par nus te /
analyzed: bdag gis ni 'di rtogs par nus te /
translated: “I can understand this,

original: zho sha dang ldan no snyam du spro ba bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //🔽ngoms pa med pa'i brtson 'grus ni chung ngu tsam mam /
analyzed: zho sha dang ldan no snyam du spro ba bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no // ngoms pa med pa'i brtson 'grus ni chung ngu tsam mam /
translated: I have the ability,” and one generates enthusiasm.

original: dman pa tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i sbyor bas dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: dman pa tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i sbyor bas dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: Insatiable effort is not giving up the effort of applying to virtue by the application of not being satisfied with just a little or just a little bit.

original: de'i phyir sems zhum par mi byed cing bdag la khyad du gsod par mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems zhum par mi byed cing bdag la khyad du gsod par mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he does not become discouraged and does not disparage himself.

original: de ltar sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five aspects of the effort of application are

original: dpa' ba dang / brtan pa dang / sra ba dang / sran thub pa dang / sems can snying po dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / mi 'jigs par gyur par de dang der 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dpa' ba dang / brtan pa dang / sra ba dang / sran thub pa dang / sems can snying po dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / mi 'jigs par gyur par de dang der 'gro ba'o //
translated: heroic, firm, strong, courageous, and fearless, and he proceeds in this and that.

original: de'i phyir tshogs chen po'i nang du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs chen po'i nang du 'gro ba'am /
translated: Therefore, he proceeds in the midst of a great assembly

original: dka' ba dga' yang brtan pa yin zhing zhes brjod do //🔽gzhan dag dang lhan cig 'gyed pa'am /
analyzed: dka' ba dga' yang brtan pa yin zhing zhes brjod do // gzhan dag dang lhan cig 'gyed pa'am /
translated: and is firm even in difficult situations.🔽He is firm in disputes

original: phyir rgol ba'am /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'am /

original: mi phal pa gzhan dag gis bya bar dka' ba'i las dag la yang brtan pa yin zhing /
analyzed: mi phal pa gzhan dag gis bya bar dka' ba'i las dag la yang brtan pa yin zhing /

original: sems zhum pa med pa ni brtan pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sems zhum pa med pa ni brtan pa zhes brjod do //

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i bya ba gcig tu nges par bya dgos pa'i don dang ldan pa'i brtsal ba chen po dag la yang shas cher skyo bar mi byed do //🔽bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba dang tshad med pa bzhi'i sbyor ba dang / de dag gnye ga'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i bya ba gcig tu nges par bya dgos pa'i don dang ldan pa'i brtsal ba chen po dag la yang shas cher skyo bar mi byed do // bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba dang tshad med pa bzhi'i sbyor ba dang / de dag gnye ga'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: And they do not become weary of the great efforts that are necessary to achieve the profound and vast practices that are required for the definitive attainment of the one practice.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags rnams par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags rnams par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The signs of the perfection of meditative absorption should be understood in terms of the practice of meditative absorption and the practice of the four immeasurables, as well as the causes of those two.

original: de la las dang po'i bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba ni rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de la las dang po'i bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba ni rnam pa lnga'o //

original: las dang po pa ni rtsom pa'i dang po'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa ni rtsom pa'i dang po'o //

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /

analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa'i rtags kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /

translated: When he is dwelling in solitude and reflecting on his own aim, etc. When he is reflecting on the three objects of the purification of the means, he is endowed with the cultivation of mental attention.

analyzed: rtog pa la kun du spyod na sems rnam par g-yo bar 'gyur bas tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba na /
translated: When he is engaged in discursive thought, his mind becomes agitated, and so he thinks, When the collection is perfected,

analyzed: rnam par rtog pas sems bsgyur bar mi nus pas yongs su bzung nas mi gnas so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: discursive thought will not be able to disturb the mind. Thus, he does not dwell in the mind that is seized by discursive thought.

original: byams pa tshad med pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: byams pa tshad med pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to the immeasurability of love, it is said:

original: mi mdza' ba'i phyogs la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi mdza' ba'i phyogs la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Even in regard to the hostile class, etc.

original: de'i rigs can nyon mongs pa chung ba'i rgyud la dang po nyid du mi mdza' ba'i phyogs la yang bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa'i bsam pa skye bar 'gyur na /

translated: When, in the continuum of one who is of that type and who has few defilements, the intention to achieve the happiness of even the hostile class arises in the beginning,

original: gzhan dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gzhan dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention others?

original: snying rje'i dbang du byas na smras pa /🔽sems can sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang du byas na smras pa / sems can sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the power of compassion, it is said:🔽When you see or hear of the state of sentient beings who are suffering with various sufferings,

original: brdeg pa dang / bcing ba dang / gcad pa dang / dbug pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis gnod par gyur pa'i gnas skabs mthong ngam thos na snying rje chen po bskyed nas sdug bsngal de dag bsal @15b ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brdeg pa dang / bcing ba dang / gcad pa dang / dbug pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis gnod par gyur pa'i gnas skabs mthong ngam thos na snying rje chen po bskyed nas sdug bsngal de dag bsal @15b ba'i phyir /
translated: you should generate great compassion and, in order to remove that suffering,

original: nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub par byed do //
translated: you should accomplish it to the best of your ability.

original: dga' ba'i rtags kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: dga' ba'i rtags kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to the power of joy, it is said:

original: rang bzhin gyis kyang sems can rnams la phan par 'dod pa dang / bde bar 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kyang sems can rnams la phan par 'dod pa dang / bde bar 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: By nature, sentient beings desire benefit and happiness.

original: rang gi ngang gis sems can rnams la bde ba 'byung bar gyur cig ces dga' ba dang bde ba thob par gyur pa rnams la rjes su yi rang zhing dga' ba'o //🔽btang snyoms tshad med pa'i rtags kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis sems can rnams la bde ba 'byung bar gyur cig ces dga' ba dang bde ba thob par gyur pa rnams la rjes su yi rang zhing dga' ba'o // btang snyoms tshad med pa'i rtags kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: One has equanimity toward those who are suffering, thinking, May they be free from suffering!🔽 One has equanimity toward those who are neither happy nor suffering, thinking, May they never be separated from the happiness that is free from suffering!🔽 One has equanimity toward friends, thinking, May they be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!🔽 One has equanimity toward enemies, thinking, May they be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!

original: rgud par gyur pa dag la yang mi dga' ba med pa yin zhes bya ba la bdag dang gzhan gyi rgud pa dag gis sems g-yo bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rgud par gyur pa dag la yang mi dga' ba med pa yin zhes bya ba la bdag dang gzhan gyi rgud pa dag gis sems g-yo bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: One has equanimity toward oneself, thinking, May I be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!🔽 One has equanimity toward all sentient beings, thinking, May all sentient beings be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!🔽 One has equanimity toward the three times, thinking, May the past, future, and present be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!

original: mya ngan gyis kun du rmongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal thams cad la bzod nas btang snyoms su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan gyis kun du rmongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal thams cad la bzod nas btang snyoms su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One has equanimity toward the ten directions, thinking, May the east, south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, nadir, and zenith be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!🔽 One has equanimity toward the three realms, thinking, May the desire, form, and formless realms be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!

original: de dag gi rgyu'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: One has equanimity toward the three vehicles, thinking, May the vehicles of the disciples, solitary sages, and bodhisattvas be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!🔽 One has equanimity toward the three vehicles, thinking, May the vehicles of the disciples, solitary sages, and bodhisattvas be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!🔽 One has equanimity toward the three vehicles, thinking, May the vehicles of the disciples, solitary sages, and bodhisattvas be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!🔽 One has equanimity toward the three vehicles, thinking, May the vehicles of the disciples, solitary sages, and bodhisattvas be endowed with happiness and the causes of happiness!

original: yid kyang gzhungs te zhes bya ba la /🔽sogs pa la /
analyzed: yid kyang gzhungs te zhes bya ba la /🔽sogs pa la /
translated: One has equanimity toward the three vehicles

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas yid gzhungs pa dang ; dran pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di gnyis ni shin tu phan pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas yid gzhungs pa dang ; dran pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di gnyis ni shin tu phan pa byed pa yin no //
translated: In terms of the application of meditative stabilization and the immeasurables, these two dharmas called “intelligence” and “memory” are very helpful.

original: yid gzhungs pas ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i chos rnams mang po myur du blang ba dang 'dzin par nus te /
analyzed: yid gzhungs pas ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i chos rnams mang po myur du blang ba dang 'dzin par nus te /
translated: By means of intelligence, one is able to quickly take up and hold many dharmas that are endowed with meditative stabilization.

original: yid gzhungs pa ni shes rab kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir dang / don sems pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa ni shes rab kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir dang / don sems pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because intelligence is a special kind of wisdom, and because it has the ability to think about the meaning,

original: shin tu 'dzin nus par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu 'dzin nus par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: one is able to hold it very well.

original: de ltar yid gzhungs pa'i byed pa rnam pa gsum bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar yid gzhungs pa'i byed pa rnam pa gsum bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the three kinds of activity of intelligence,

original: dran pa'i byed pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dran pa'i byed pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: in order to teach the activity of memory, he says,

original: des byas nas ring du lon pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des byas nas ring du lon pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Having done that, for a long time…” and so on.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In terms of the three kinds of wisdom, in order to teach the signs of the perfection of wisdom,🔽he says,

original: skye bas thob pa'i dbang du byas nas rig pa'i gnas shes bya thams cad la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /🔽lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa'i dbang du byas nas rig pa'i gnas shes bya thams cad la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In terms of the innate, it is said that he possesses the wisdom that is innate, in order to engage in all objects of knowledge, the sciences.

original: lud las skyes pa'i dbang du byas te smras pa /
analyzed: lud las skyes pa'i dbang du byas te smras pa /
translated: In terms of the wisdom that arises from cultivation, it is said that he is not of a deluded nature.

original: yid mi rtul ba dang blo mi zhan pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yid mi rtul ba dang blo mi zhan pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In terms of the wisdom that arises from learning, it is said that he is not of a dull nature or a weak-minded nature.

original: legs par bstan pa dang ; nyes par bstan pa'i don rang ges shes par nus pa'o //🔽rtogs pa las byung ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /🔽rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: legs par bstan pa dang ; nyes par bstan pa'i don rang ges shes par nus pa'o // rtogs pa las byung ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa / rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He is able to understand the meaning of good explanations and bad explanations by himself.🔽In terms of the wisdom that arises from realization, it is said that he is not of a deluded nature.

original: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rmongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs rig pa 'byung bar gyur pas rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa'o @16a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rmongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs rig pa 'byung bar gyur pas rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa'o @16a * //
translated: He is not of a deluded nature because the antidote to delusion, which has the characteristic of ignorance, has arisen.

original: shes rab de dag gi byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab de dag gi byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the functions of those wisdoms,🔽it is said that he is not of a deluded nature.

original: bag med pa'i gnas de dag spong ba zhes bya ba ni nyes dmigs kyi gnas thams cad yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnas de dag spong ba zhes bya ba ni nyes dmigs kyi gnas thams cad yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: The phrase they abandon those states that are the basis for carelessness means that they completely abandon all states that are the basis for the misfortune.

original: so sor rtog pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The phrase they possess the power of discernment means that they are endowed with the power of discernment.

original: de lta bu'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dang yang dag pa dang ldan pa'i dkar po'i chos kyi rigs kyi rtags bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dang yang dag pa dang ldan pa'i dkar po'i chos kyi rigs kyi rtags bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the signs of the spiritual lineage of the virtuous qualities that are associated with generosity, etc.,

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: the root text states, “These are the signs of a bodhisattva’s spiritual lineage.”

original: 'di lta bu'i rtags 'di dag ni rigs yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rtags su gyur pa'o zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rtags 'di dag ni rigs yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog par byed pa'i rtags su gyur pa'o zhes bya ba'o /
translated: These are the signs that indicate the existence of the spiritual lineage.

original: rigs pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid do /
analyzed: rigs pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid do /
translated: The spiritual lineage is the very nature of the activities of body, speech, and mind.

original: rnges su dpag tu rung ba ni /
analyzed: rnges su dpag tu rung ba ni /
translated: It is suitable to be inferred

original: rjes su dpag tu rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag tu rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is suitable to be inferred.

original: 'di dag gis rigs yod par rjes su dpog par byed pa'i byed pa bstan gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag gis rigs yod par rjes su dpog par byed pa'i byed pa bstan gyi /
translated: These indicate the activity of inferring the existence of the lineage.

original: ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not indicate the possession of the very essence of the lineage.

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su 'dzin pa ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi spyod yul yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su 'dzin pa ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi spyod yul yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate the possession of the very essence of the lineage as the domain of a buddha,

original: yang dag pa'i don du nges par bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du nges par bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he says, “In order to definitely ascertain the perfect meaning, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su gzung ba ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su gzung ba ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‘the possession of the very essence of the lineage’ is as follows.

original: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate the cause and the effect that is consistent with such a lineage,

original: de ltar yon tan ldan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan ldan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: he says, “Thus, endowed with good qualities, etc.

original: sems ma bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na yang rtags dang yang dag par ldan pa la 'di lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems ma bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na yang rtags dang yang dag par ldan pa la 'di lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even in the state of not having generated the thought of awakening, one who is endowed with the signs will have such good qualities.

original: 'jug pa'i dus su ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don ma lus pa la nan tan byed pas bzang ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i dus su ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don ma lus pa la nan tan byed pas bzang ba'o //
translated: At the time of engagement, one is good because one is intent on one’s own and others’ aims without exception.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor bas blu ba med pa'i phyir dge ba'o //🔽sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor bas blu ba med pa'i phyir dge ba'o // sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: It is virtuous because it is not deceptive due to irreversible application.

original: dkar po'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with virtuous qualities in the context of the practice of the perfections such as generosity.

original: de lta bur thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba'i rigs ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i thun mong ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi yon tan rnams kyi rgyu nyid du rigs kyi /
analyzed: de lta bur thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba'i rigs ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i thun mong ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi yon tan rnams kyi rgyu nyid du rigs kyi /
translated: Such a spiritual gene is the cause of the uncommon qualities of buddhahood, which will be explained.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cause of anything else.

original: des ni rigs las gzhan pa ni de'i rgyur mi rigs so zhes gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni rigs las gzhan pa ni de'i rgyur mi rigs so zhes gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This clearly shows that anything other than the spiritual gene is not its cause.🔽It is difficult to generate because it is difficult to obtain, since it is attained after a long time through the accumulation of great stores of merit and

original: rnyed par dka' bas na bskyed par dka' ba ste dus yun ring pos bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bsags nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / dka' ba spyad pa brgya stong du mas thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed par dka' bas na bskyed par dka' ba ste dus yun ring pos bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bsags nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / dka' ba spyad pa brgya stong du mas thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: knowledge and through hundreds of thousands of difficult practices of the six perfections.

original: dpag tu med @16b pa dang grangs med pa'i yon tan gyis brgyan pas na gtso bo'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med @16b pa dang grangs med pa'i yon tan gyis brgyan pas na gtso bo'o //
translated: The chief is adorned with immeasurable and innumerable good qualities.

original: grangs dang mthu 'di lta bu'o zhes bstan par mi nus pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: grangs dang mthu 'di lta bu'o zhes bstan par mi nus pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable because it cannot be taught that its number and power are such and such.

original: rtag tu chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'chi 'pho dang bral ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'chi 'pho dang bral ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is unmoving because it is always the essence of the Dharma Body and is thus free from death and rebirth.

original: de las gong mar gyur pa med pas bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de las gong mar gyur pa med pas bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is unsurpassed because there is nothing higher than it.

original: yang ci rigs de lta bu dang ldan pa la dus thams cad du rtags 'di dag yod par 'gyur ram zhen /🔽ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang ci rigs de lta bu dang ldan pa la dus thams cad du rtags 'di dag yod par 'gyur ram zhen / ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Do these signs exist at all times for one who possesses such a nature?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni ji srid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /🔽gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi las thams cad dam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni ji srid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te / gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi las thams cad dam /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they do not, he says, The bodhisattva...

original: kha cig gis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur pa de srid du de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig gis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur pa de srid du de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as he is not free from the four defilements, or from some of them, he possesses them.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis mnan par gyur na ni de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis mnan par gyur na ni de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are overwhelmed by the secondary mental afflictions, they will not possess them.

original: rtags rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ni skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba nas so //
analyzed: rtags rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ni skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba nas so //
translated: The arising of the signs is not occurring.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rtags dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i skabs su ni ngan song du skye bar 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtags dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i skabs su ni ngan song du skye bar 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of possessing the signs is not reborn in the lower realms.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can du gyur na ni der skye bar 'gyur pa'i las byas nas ngan song dag tu yang lan 'ga' skye ba srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can du gyur na ni der skye bar 'gyur pa'i las byas nas ngan song dag tu yang lan 'ga' skye ba srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: However, if he is afflicted by the secondary mental afflictions, he can commit the actions that lead to rebirth there. It is possible that he will be reborn in the lower realms.🔽He is also sometimes reborn in the lower realms.

original: ngan song dag tu yang skabs 'ga' skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de ltar re zhig pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rtags dang ldan pa bde 'gror skyes pa rnams gzhan dag las khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa ltar /
analyzed: ngan song dag tu yang skabs 'ga' skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de ltar re zhig pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rtags dang ldan pa bde 'gror skyes pa rnams gzhan dag las khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa ltar /
translated: In this way, those who possess the signs of the six perfections are reborn in the happy realms and are superior to others.

original: de'i rigs dang ldan pa rnams res 'ga' ngan song du skyes par gyur na yang der skyes pa gzhan dag las khyad par rnam pa ldas khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rigs dang ldan pa rnams res 'ga' ngan song du skyes par gyur na yang der skyes pa gzhan dag las khyad par rnam pa ldas khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
translated: Even if those who possess that potential are sometimes born in lower rebirths, they are superior to others born there in ten ways.

original: skabs 'ga' skyes par gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skabs 'ga' skyes par gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even if they are born there sometimes means

original: ji ltar de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams la rgya mtsho chen por g-yengs pa'i gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal gyi mgrin pa chud par dka' ba yin pa ltar bde 'gror skye ba dka' ba yin ta /
analyzed: ji ltar de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams la rgya mtsho chen por g-yengs pa'i gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal gyi mgrin pa chud par dka' ba yin pa ltar bde 'gror skye ba dka' ba yin ta /
translated: just as it is difficult for the neck of a turtle to enter the hole of a yoke floating on the great ocean, so it is difficult for them to be born in happy rebirths.

original: der skyes nas yun ring por de nas thar bar mi nus pa yin la /
analyzed: der skyes nas yun ring por de nas thar bar mi nus pa yin la /
translated: Once born there, they cannot escape for a long time.

original: de'i rigs dang ldan pa rnams ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba de ltar dkon pa yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rigs dang ldan pa rnams ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba de ltar dkon pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: But it is rare for those who possess that potential to go to lower rebirths,

original: brgya lam na zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: brgya lam na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: so it is said that they are born there once in a hundred.

original: skyes par gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni tshe ji srid par de'i rigs dang ldan pa rnams der gnas par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skyes par gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni tshe ji srid par de'i rigs dang ldan pa rnams der gnas par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if they are born there, those who possess that potential do not remain there for the duration of their lives.

original: bar du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur te /
translated: In the middle, they die.

original: dper na bde 'gror skyes pa'i sems can kha cig @17a * //
analyzed: dper na bde 'gror skyes pa'i sems can kha cig @17a * //
translated: For example, some sentient beings born in the happy rebirths die immediately after birth, due to the power of their previous karma.

original: sngon gyi las drag po'i dbang gis skyes ma thag la sogs par 'chi bar 'gyur ba bzhin du rigs dang ldan pa dag ngan song du skyes pa yang snying rje chen po'i stobs dang / 'gyod pa drag pos de ma thag tu 'chi bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las drag po'i dbang gis skyes ma thag la sogs par 'chi bar 'gyur ba bzhin du rigs dang ldan pa dag ngan song du skyes pa yang snying rje chen po'i stobs dang / 'gyod pa drag pos de ma thag tu 'chi bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, those who are endowed with the lineage, even though born in the lower realms, should be understood to die immediately due to the power of great compassion and intense regret.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / brtan pa'i stobs dang / yang dag par ldan pas sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chung du myong bar 'gyur gyi der skyes pa'i sems can gzhan bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / brtan pa'i stobs dang / yang dag par ldan pas sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chung du myong bar 'gyur gyi der skyes pa'i sems can gzhan bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: By the power of discernment and the power of stability, they experience only slight feelings of suffering, not like other sentient beings born there.

original: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba des reg na yang rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa'i ngan song gis 'gyod cing skyo bar gyur la mi mthun pa dang / ngan par blta zhing spong bar 'dun par so sor rig pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba des reg na yang rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa'i ngan song gis 'gyod cing skyo bar gyur la mi mthun pa dang / ngan par blta zhing spong bar 'dun par so sor rig pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they experience such feelings of suffering, they feel regret and become disenchanted with the lower realms, which are included within the cause and effect of suffering. They will have the insight to view these lower realms as something to be rejected and to aspire to abandon them.

original: bdag ni re zhig brtan pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: bdag ni re zhig brtan pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: They will think, “I am someone who is steadfast,

original: so sor rtog pa'i mthu dang ldan la /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i mthu dang ldan la /
translated: who has the power of discernment,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chud ngu tsam myong ba yang 'di 'dra na /🔽gzhan dag gi gnas skabs ji lta bur 'gyur zhes gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis shin tu gnod par gyur nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chud ngu tsam myong ba yang 'di 'dra na / gzhan dag gi gnas skabs ji lta bur 'gyur zhes gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis shin tu gnod par gyur nas /
translated: and who experiences only a little of the suffering of the lower realms.🔽What must the situation be like for others?”

original: snying rje chen po'i sems skyed par byed de /🔽sangs rgyas kyi thugs rje chen po'i sa bon gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i sems skyed par byed de /🔽sangs rgyas kyi thugs rje chen po'i sa bon gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: They will be greatly troubled by the suffering of others and will give rise to the mind of great compassion.🔽This is taught by the following:

original: sangs rgyas kyi snying rje chen po'i rgyu'i rigs de nyid kyis bskul bas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi snying rje chen po'i rgyu'i rigs de nyid kyis bskul bas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is because of that very cause of the great compassion of the Buddha that he is urged.

original: nyon mongs pa ni mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir dkar po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir dkar po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: Affliction is not in accord with virtuous dharmas because it is non-virtuous.

original: sems dri ma can du byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dri ma can du byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: It is a secondary affliction because it defiles the mind.

original: blun pa ni de kho na nyid dang / de kho na nyid ma yin ba yongs su shes pa la mi mkhas pa dang / mi dge ba'i grogs pos yongs su gzung ba'o //
analyzed: blun pa ni de kho na nyid dang / de kho na nyid ma yin ba yongs su shes pa la mi mkhas pa dang / mi dge ba'i grogs pos yongs su gzung ba'o //
translated: Foolishness is unskillfulness in knowing reality and what is not reality, and being held by a non-virtuous friend.

original: de'i sdig pa can gyi grogs kyis yongs su gzung bas /
analyzed: de'i sdig pa can gyi grogs kyis yongs su gzung bas /
translated: Because of being held by that sinful friend,

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams ni mi skye la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams ni mi skye la /
translated: unproduced virtuous dharmas are not produced,

original: skyes pa rnams ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: and those that are produced are completely lost.

original: des na de'i sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, his mental continuum becomes afflicted.

original: de'i phyir yang de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that reason, it is also called a secondary affliction.

original: phyir rgol bas dbang byas shing de'i sems rnam par rmongs par gyur pas lus dang sems la rang dbang med par 'gyur ro //🔽rang dbang med par 'jug par 'gyur bas dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: phyir rgol bas dbang byas shing de'i sems rnam par rmongs par gyur pas lus dang sems la rang dbang med par 'gyur ro // rang dbang med par 'jug par 'gyur bas dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing /

translated: Because of being controlled by the adversary and because of the confusion of his mind, he has no control over his body and mind.

original: de ltar na mdor bsdu na lus dang sems brtan par byed pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par gsal bar byed pa'i tshig gnyis dang / gnyis kyis yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mdor bsdu na lus dang sems brtan par byed pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par gsal bar byed pa'i tshig gnyis dang / gnyis kyis yin par rig par bya'o //

original: gal te rigs dang ldan na skal ba dang ldan par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te rigs dang ldan na skal ba dang ldan par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If one possesses good fortune, one will possess strength.🔽If one possesses strength, one will attain supreme enlightenment.🔽If one possesses the spiritual gene, one will possess good fortune.🔽If one possesses good fortune, one will possess strength.🔽If one possesses strength, one will attain supreme enlightenment.🔽If one possesses the spiritual gene, one will possess good fortune.🔽If one possesses good fortune, one will possess strength.

original: stobs dang ldan par gyur na yang gang gi phyir 'khor ba thog ma med pa yin pa ltar sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang thog ma med pa'i dus can yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan par gyur na yang gang gi phyir 'khor ba thog ma med pa yin pa ltar sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang thog ma med pa'i dus can yin par 'dod na /
