original: thams cad kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
analyzed: thams cad kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
translated: If one possesses strength, one will attain supreme enlightenment.🔽If one possesses the spiritual gene, one will possess good fortune.🔽If one possesses good fortune, one will possess strength.🔽If one possesses strength, one will attain supreme enlightenment.🔽If one possesses the spiritual gene, one will possess good fortune.🔽If one possesses good fortune, one will possess strength.🔽If one possesses strength, one will attain supreme enlightenment.🔽If one possesses the spiritual gene, one will possess good fortune.🔽If one possesses good fortune, one will possess strength.🔽If one possesses strength, one will attain supreme enlightenment.🔽If one possesses the spiritual gene, one will possess good fortune.🔽If one possesses good fortune, one will possess strength.🔽If one possesses strength, one will attain supreme enlightenment.🔽If one possesses the spiritual gene, one will possess good fortune.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan pa yang rgyu bzhis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan pa yang rgyu bzhis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: If one possesses good fortune, one will possess strength.🔽If one possesses strength, one will attain supreme enlightenment.🔽If one possesses the spiritual gene, one will possess good fortune.🔽If one possesses good fortune, one will possess strength.🔽If one possesses strength, one will attain supreme enlightenment.

original: rgyu 'di dag nyid ni thob par sla ba'i phyir dang / byang chub thob pa'i rgyu nyid ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu 'di dag nyid ni thob par sla ba'i phyir dang / byang chub thob pa'i rgyu nyid ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: If one possesses the spiritual gene, one will possess good fortune.

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin na yang phal cher mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi gnas skabs nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin na yang phal cher mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi gnas skabs nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if one has the perfect lineage, one is still mostly in a condition that is adverse to the perfections.

original: byang chub kyi lam phyin ci ma log pa ston pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / mos pa dang / khams kyi bye brag shes nas phyin ci ma log pa'i theg pa chen po'i lam ston par byed pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam phyin ci ma log pa ston pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / mos pa dang / khams kyi bye brag shes nas phyin ci ma log pa'i theg pa chen po'i lam ston par byed pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
translated: The path to enlightenment is taught without error means that it is very difficult to find a Buddha or Bodhisattva who, knowing the differences in faculties, inclinations, and natures, teaches the path of the universal vehicle without error.

original: de ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes par ma byas pas ni byang chub thob par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyes par ma byas pas ni byang chub thob par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, without pleasing the spiritual master, it is not possible to attain enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad cing yongs su zin kyang rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dbang gis gnas nas phyin ci log tu slob pa ni phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad cing yongs su zin kyang rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dbang gis gnas nas phyin ci log tu slob pa ni phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Even if one meets and is accepted by the spiritual master, if one studies with a wrong attitude, one practices wrongly, because one is dominated by the attitude that holds one's own view to be best.

original: byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag nyid du chos thams cad yod do zhes 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid du yang med do zhes med par 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag nyid du chos thams cad yod do zhes 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid du yang med do zhes med par 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The childish are attached to the idea that all things exist in the self-existence imagined by themselves, and they are attached to the idea that they do not exist in their own characteristics.

original: mtha' gnyis su ma lhung du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la mos pa chung bar gyur pas sbyor ba g-yel zhing le lo byed pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su ma lhung du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la mos pa chung bar gyur pas sbyor ba g-yel zhing le lo byed pa ste /
translated: Even if they do not fall into the two extremes, the bodhisattvas, because of their small aspiration for the training, are negligent in their practice and lazy.

original: snyom las dang ldan pas rtag tu byed pa dang / dam par byed pa'i btson 'grus med pa ni /
analyzed: snyom las dang ldan pas rtag tu byed pa dang / dam par byed pa'i btson 'grus med pa ni /
translated: They are indolent and do not have the effort that is constant and intense.

original: de ltar re zhig dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba dman pas byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba dman pas byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, for the time being, they do not attain enlightenment because of their inferior practice of the good doctrine.

original: @18a * // sngar bstan pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag yod du zin kyang dbang po yongs su ma smin pa'i rgyud ni snod ma yin pas tshogs longs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: @18a * // sngar bstan pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag yod du zin kyang dbang po yongs su ma smin pa'i rgyud ni snod ma yin pas tshogs longs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if those three causes previously mentioned do exist, the stream of consciousness whose faculties are not mature is not a fit vessel, and so the accumulations are not completed.

original: des kyang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And so, they do not attain enlightenment.

original: yun ring du zhes bya ba ni yun ring du 'dris par byas pa'i sbyor bas tshogs yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //🔽rigs med na ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni byang chub 'thob pa'i rgyu yod kyang rung /
analyzed: yun ring du zhes bya ba ni yun ring du 'dris par byas pa'i sbyor bas tshogs yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o // rigs med na ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni byang chub 'thob pa'i rgyu yod kyang rung /
translated: For a long time means that the accumulations are not completed through the practice of familiarity for a long time.

original: med kyang rung 'thob par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: med kyang rung 'thob par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: If there is no lineage, then it is impossible for anyone to attain enlightenment, whether or not the causes of enlightenment exist.

original: shin tu snod ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu snod ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is not a suitable vessel.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i dang po rigs kyi le'u'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i dang po rigs kyi le'u'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the first chapter of the Bodhisattvabhumi, the chapter on the basic foundation of the lineage.

original: // / de lta bu'i rigs la brten nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs kyi gzhi'i le'u'i rjes la sems bskyed pa'i gzhi nges par bstan par bya ba yin pas dang po nyid du sems
analyzed: // / de lta bu'i rigs la brten nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs kyi gzhi'i le'u'i rjes la sems bskyed pa'i gzhi nges par bstan par bya ba yin pas dang po nyid du sems
translated: The chapter on the basic foundation of the lineage is followed by the chapter on the basic foundation of the generation of the thought of enlightenment, because it is necessary to teach the basic foundation of the generation of the thought of enlightenment, in order to show that the generation of the thought of unexcelled perfect enlightenment occurs on the basis of such a lineage.

original: bskyed pa de rnam pa lngas bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa de rnam pa lngas bstan par bya ste /
translated: This generation is indicated by five topics.

original: de'i zab pa dang rgya che ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zab pa dang rgya che ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate its profundity and its vast extent.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ni rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ni rgya che ba'o //
translated: The first four topics indicate its vast extent.

original: phyi ma ni zab pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni zab pa'o //
translated: The last indicates its profundity.

original: de las gzhan pa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad sdud pa yin pas ngo bo nyid rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad sdud pa yin pas ngo bo nyid rgya che ba'o //
translated: The first topic is the vastness of its essence, since it includes all other true prayers.

original: de la smon lam yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la smon lam yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of true prayers:

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i smon lam dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam mo //🔽de la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i smon lam ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i smon lam dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam mo // de la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i smon lam ni /
translated: false prayers and true prayers.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'khor ba'i nyes pas gnod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'khor ba'i nyes pas gnod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: A false prayer is a prayer for the happiness of oneself and others, or for the avoidance of the suffering of bad destinies and of the evils of cyclic existence.

original: yang dag pa'i smon lam la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i smon lam la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: A true prayer is of three kinds:

original: dman pa dang / 'bring dang / mchog gi bye brag gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dman pa dang / 'bring dang / mchog gi bye brag gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: The inferior, middling, and superior are those of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: yang 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam la bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: yang 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam la bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Here, however, it is the bodhisattva’s vow that is intended.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam de yangs so so la rnam pa du mar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam de yangs so so la rnam pa du mar shes par bya ste /
translated: That vow of the bodhisattva is to be understood as having many aspects in each of the three.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan nyid kyis sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni smon lam ste sems las byung ba'i khyad par yin pas bsam pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan nyid kyis sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni smon lam ste sems las byung ba'i khyad par yin pas bsam pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mental disposition is the vow, which is a special mental factor, a special volition, since it is the mental disposition that is the vow.

original: de lta bas na byang chub kyi sems kyang theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub kyi sems kyang theg pa chen po ste /
translated: Thus, the thought of awakening is also the Great Vehicle.

original: yon tan gyis sems mngon par @18b 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni smon lam mo //
analyzed: yon tan gyis sems mngon par @18b 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni smon lam mo //
translated: The vow is characterized by the mental disposition that is endowed with the qualities.

original: yang de ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam ji snyed yod pa yongs su sdud pa ste /
analyzed: yang de ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam ji snyed yod pa yongs su sdud pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the collection of all the bodhisattva’s true vows.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of non-degeneration.

original: de'i phyir smon lam ni sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir smon lam ni sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the generation of the resolve should be understood as the essence of the vow.

original: sems de mngon par 'du byed pa yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sems de mngon par 'du byed pa yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The generation of the resolve is also with objective support.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Because it is with objective support, it is also with aspect.

original: des na de'i rnam pa dang dmigs pa nges par gzung ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: des na de'i rnam pa dang dmigs pa nges par gzung ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to determine its aspect and objective support, he says:

original: 'di ltar sems mngon par 'du byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems mngon par 'du byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, one generates the resolve, etc.

original: bdag gi rgyud bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'dod pa ni sems kyis 'di ltar smon par byed de /
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'dod pa ni sems kyis 'di ltar smon par byed de /
translated: One who desires the highest, complete enlightenment for oneself generates the resolve in this way:

original: theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can rigs la gnas pa rgyu dang 'bras bu la yang 'dod par byed do //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can rigs la gnas pa rgyu dang 'bras bu la yang 'dod par byed do //
translated: One desires the dharmas of nirvana included in the three vehicles, as well as the cause and result, for one who is endowed with the spiritual lineage.

original: de'i phyir bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad kyi don yang byed par gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can thams cad kyi don yang byed par gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, may I, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, also perform the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pas don byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pas don byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: There, even those of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha type are benefited by being established in nirvāṇa.

original: des na shin tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god par gyur cig ces smras pa yin no //
analyzed: des na shin tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god par gyur cig ces smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “May I establish them in the nirvāṇa that is a complete pacification.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since bodhisattvas are to be established in the nirvāṇa that is not a location, therefore it is said, “in the wisdom of the tathāgatas.”

original: de ltar rnam pa 'di lta bus byang chub dang sems can gyi don du gnyer ba ni sems bskyed pa yin pas de'i phyir don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa 'di lta bus byang chub dang sems can gyi don du gnyer ba ni sems bskyed pa yin pas de'i phyir don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the generation of the Thought is the striving for enlightenment and the welfare of sentient beings in this way. Therefore, it is established as the aspect of striving.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don ma lus pa don du gnyer ba yin pa'i phyir rgya che ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don ma lus pa don du gnyer ba yin pa'i phyir rgya che ba'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the aspect of vastness because it strives for the complete welfare of self and other.

original: de ltar rnam pa 'de lta bus byang chub dang / yang rnam pa de lta bur sems bskyed pa de'i dmigs pa ji lta bu zhig la dmigs nas bskyed ce na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa 'de lta bus byang chub dang / yang rnam pa de lta bur sems bskyed pa de'i dmigs pa ji lta bu zhig la dmigs nas bskyed ce na /
translated: Thus, the generation of the Thought is the striving for enlightenment and the welfare of sentient beings in this way. But in what sort of object does one focus when generating the Thought in this way?

original: de'i phyir sems bskyed pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems bskyed pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “And that generation of the Thought,” and so on.

original: de la byang chub la dmigs pa ni de'i dbang gis byang ba yin la /
analyzed: de la byang chub la dmigs pa ni de'i dbang gis byang ba yin la /
translated: Therein, the focus on enlightenment is the purification by the power of that.

original: sems can gyi don ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: The welfare of sentient beings is the principal [focus].

original: de'i phyir / stobs bcu'i yon tan dag gis mdzad pa las gzhan khyod la phra mi mnga' zhes bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / stobs bcu'i yon tan dag gis mdzad pa las gzhan khyod la phra mi mnga' zhes bstod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a praise: “You, who have the qualities of the ten powers, have no other activity than that.”

original: gzhan nas kyang @19a * //
analyzed: gzhan nas kyang @19a * //
translated: And also from another [source]:

original: gsungs pa / gang gi de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni zhar la 'ongs pa ste //🔽zhes bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa / gang gi de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni zhar la 'ongs pa ste // zhes bstod pa yin no //
translated: The verse praises the Tathāgata’s nature as a mere by-product.

original: de bzhin du yon tan dang skyon thams cad rab kyi mthar thug par thob pa dang / lhag ma ma lus par zad par gyur pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i dngos po la 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du dmigs pa ni dmigs pa rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan dang skyon thams cad rab kyi mthar thug par thob pa dang / lhag ma ma lus par zad par gyur pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i dngos po la 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du dmigs pa ni dmigs pa rgya che ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the objective is vast because it focuses on unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, which is the attainment of all virtues and the elimination of all faults to the ultimate degree, and because it focuses on the welfare of all sentient beings in all world-realms to the ends of space, and on that for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: 'jug pa rgya che ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'jug pa rgya che ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of vast engagement,

original: sems bskyed pa de yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: that generation of the thought is virtuous by way of the factors of enlightenment, etc.

original: sems bskyed pa de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis dge ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis dge ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That generation of the thought should be understood as virtuous by way of two aspects.

original: shes rab dang snying rje zhes bya ba'i dge ba'i tsa ba dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi dge ba'i tsa ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje zhes bya ba'i dge ba'i tsa ba dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi dge ba'i tsa ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and endowed with the virtue called wisdom and compassion, and the cause of the virtue of all the factors of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir / dge ba dang mchog tu ge ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dge ba dang mchog tu ge ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “endowed with the virtues of goodness and supreme goodness.”

original: de la dang po'i rnam pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po'i rnam pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: Among them, the first aspect is goodness.

original: gnyis pa ni mchog tu dge bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mchog tu dge bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The second should be understood as supreme goodness.

original: dge ba nyid kyis na bzang ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba nyid kyis na bzang ba ste /
translated: Because of goodness, it is good.

original: gar dang glu la mkhas pa'i gar mkhan bzhin no //
analyzed: gar dang glu la mkhas pa'i gar mkhan bzhin no //
translated: Like an actor skilled in dance and song.

original: rang gi don sgrub par byed pas na yang bzang ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi don sgrub par byed pas na yang bzang ba'o //
translated: Because it accomplishes one’s own aim, it is also good.

original: gzhan gyi don yang dag par sgrub par byed pas na mchog tu bzang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yang dag par sgrub par byed pas na mchog tu bzang ba'o //
translated: Because it accomplishes the aim of others, it is supremely good.

original: rang gi don la mi blu zhing phrad par byed pa'i phyir legs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don la mi blu zhing phrad par byed pa'i phyir legs pa'o //
translated: Because it does not deceive and brings benefit to one’s own aim, it is excellent.

original: gzhan gyi don la mi blu ba dang / de lta bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pas mchog tu legs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la mi blu ba dang / de lta bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pas mchog tu legs pa'o //
translated: It is supremely good because it is of that nature.

original: de ltar re zhig dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su mthun pa la 'jug pa'i khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su mthun pa la 'jug pa'i khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the distinctive engagement in accordance with all virtuous qualities,

original: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad dang 'gal ba nyid du 'jug pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad dang 'gal ba nyid du 'jug pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the engagement in opposition to all nonvirtuous qualities,

original: sems can thams cad la brten pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la brten pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he says, “based on all sentient beings,” and so on.

original: sems can thams cad la brten pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la brten pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Based on all sentient beings” means in the continuum of all sentient beings.

original: de dag dang mi mthun pa ni de dag dang mi mthun par gyur pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: de dag dang mi mthun pa ni de dag dang mi mthun par gyur pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa /
translated: Those who are incompatible with them are those who are incompatible with them, who are included in the three vehicles of the śrāvaka and so on.

original: 'khor ba'i mi mthun par gyur pa dge ba'i chos la rab tu 'god par rig par @19b bya'o ;
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mi mthun par gyur pa dge ba'i chos la rab tu 'god par rig par @19b bya'o ;
translated: They should be known as those who are established in virtuous qualities that are incompatible with saṃsāra.

original: / smon lam dge ba de dag thams cad kyi nang na smon lam gyi mchog bla na med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa /🔽dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: / smon lam dge ba de dag thams cad kyi nang na smon lam gyi mchog bla na med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa / dpag tu med pa /
translated: It is immeasurable,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: incalculable, and inconceivable.

original: de'i phyir zab pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zab pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called profound.

original: mthar thug par nges par bstan pas zab pa nyid bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar thug par nges par bstan pas zab pa nyid bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By teaching the definitive conclusion, the profundity itself is taught.

original: yang sems bskyed pa de'i khyad par rnam pa lnga po de dag nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yang sems bskyed pa de'i khyad par rnam pa lnga po de dag nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, those very five aspects of the generation of the thought should be taught.

original: sems de bskyed ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sems de bskyed ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed pa ni /
translated: The teacher shows them beginning with Immediately upon generating that thought.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par nas khyad par du 'phags pa'i khyad par gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par nas khyad par du 'phags pa'i khyad par gyi bar du'o //
translated: From the distinctive nature up to the distinctive superiority.

original: yang sems bskyed pa de'i gnas skabs dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa'i rgyu dang ; kun nas slong ba dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa'i khyad par yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa bzhir bstan par rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: yang sems bskyed pa de'i gnas skabs dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa'i rgyu dang ; kun nas slong ba dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa'i khyad par yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa bzhir bstan par rigs par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the generation of the resolve should be understood as fourfold in order to demonstrate its special states, causes of complete maturation of the mental continuum, motivation, and natural outcome.

original: sems de bskyed ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems de bskyed ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Immediately upon the generation of that thought, etc.

original: rigs dang / 'jug pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i ming can gyis gsum ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang yin no //
analyzed: rigs dang / 'jug pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i ming can gyis gsum ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang yin no //
translated: The three, namely, lineage, entry, and departure, are also for the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pas bsdus pas ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pas bsdus pas ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, entry is taught as a special state by way of its inclusion.

original: rigs yod du zin kyang sems ma bskyed pa'i dus su zhugs pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: rigs yod du zin kyang sems ma bskyed pa'i dus su zhugs pa ma yin pas /
translated: Even though one has the lineage, one is not entered as long as the resolve has not been generated.

original: sems bskyed pa ni zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The generation of the resolve is called entry

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has entered the path of the bodhisattva.

original: brda dang tha snyad kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni ming du btags pa'i tha snyad kyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brda dang tha snyad kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni ming du btags pa'i tha snyad kyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase in terms of conventional expressions and designations means that the term bodhisattva is a conventional designation that is a nominal designation.

original: brda las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: brda las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The phrase arises from a conventional designation means that the spiritual intent that is developed is conventional.

original: bla med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu don dam pa zag pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa ni sa dang po rab tu rtogs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: bla med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu don dam pa zag pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa ni sa dang po rab tu rtogs pa'i dus so //
translated: The phrase the ultimate spiritual intent that is developed for unexcelled, authentic, and complete enlightenment refers to the time when the first pleasurable state, that of the joyful, is attained.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase one enters into the certainty of the bodhisattva state means that one enters into the certainty of the bodhisattva stage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no //
translated: The phrase one is born into the family of the tathāgatas means that one is born into the family of the bodhisattvas.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase one is called a bodhisattva in the ultimate sense means that one is called a bodhisattva in the ultimate sense.

original: sems bskyed pas ni rim gyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags shing bskyed pa dang ldan pas rgyud yongs su smin pa'i khyad par thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems bskyed pas ni rim gyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags shing bskyed pa dang ldan pas rgyud yongs su smin pa'i khyad par thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The phrase one gradually accumulates and develops the stores of merit and wisdom means that one acquires a special form of spiritual lineage that is fully matured by possessing the stores of merit and wisdom that are accumulated and developed.

original: sems ma bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems ma bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase not one who has not developed the mind of enlightenment means that this is not the case for one who has not developed the mind of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu'i gtso bo ni sems bskyed pa de yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu'i gtso bo ni sems bskyed pa de yin no //
translated: Therefore, the generation of the Thought is the principal cause of the supreme enlightenment.

original: mdor na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: mdor na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni //
translated: In brief, the Bodhisattvas

original: brtse ba zad dang brtse ba 'phel bya ste //
analyzed: brtse ba zad dang brtse ba 'phel bya ste //
translated: exhaust the affection and increase the affection,

original: @20a * // rang gi bya ba la ni chags zad bya //
analyzed: @20a * // rang gi bya ba la ni chags zad bya //
translated: exhaust the attachment to their own duties,

original: gzhan gyi bya ba la ni chags 'phel bya //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba la ni chags 'phel bya //
translated: and increase the attachment to the duties of others.

original: shes rab snying rje de zad 'phel pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: shes rab snying rje de zad 'phel pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of the exhaustion and increase of wisdom and compassion,

original: de phyir byang chub tsa ba gnyis zhes gsungs //
analyzed: de phyir byang chub tsa ba gnyis zhes gsungs //
translated: therefore, is said to be the two causes of enlightenment.

original: zhes khya bas nges par shes rab dang snying rje gnyis ni byang chub kyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin no //🔽de dag las kyang ci byang chub kyi sems de shes rab las 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: zhes khya bas nges par shes rab dang snying rje gnyis ni byang chub kyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin no // de dag las kyang ci byang chub kyi sems de shes rab las 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Thus, by the above, one should understand that wisdom and compassion are the principal causes of enlightenment.

original: 'on te snying rje las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snying rje las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And from among those two, does the Thought of Enlightenment arise from wisdom or from compassion?

original: de lta bas na sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, “for the sake of suffering sentient beings” and so on.

original: shes rab las kun du 'byung ba yin na ni byang chub thob pa gtso bor 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: shes rab las kun du 'byung ba yin na ni byang chub thob pa gtso bor 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it were to arise from wisdom, then the attainment of enlightenment would be primary,

original: de'i dbang gis byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not arise by the power of that.

original: de'i phyir snying rje las kun du byung ba yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje las kun du byung ba yin pas /
translated: Therefore, it arises from compassion.

original: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the generation of the thought of enlightenment is the natural outcome of compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sngar sems can yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pa brtan po mi g-yo ba bskyed nas ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sngar sems can yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pa brtan po mi g-yo ba bskyed nas ;
translated: The bodhisattva first generates the firm, unshakable intention to protect all sentient beings.

original: de'i rjes la yongs su bskyab pa'i thabs kyi lam tshol bar byed pa na /
analyzed: de'i rjes la yongs su bskyab pa'i thabs kyi lam tshol bar byed pa na /
translated: Then, when he seeks the means to protect them,

original: sangs rgyas nyid las gzhan mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid las gzhan mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed bar byed do //
translated: he sees that there is no other means than buddhahood, and he generates the thought of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: de lta bas na sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams yongs su bskyab pa ni snying rje yin no zhes 'di'i don rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams yongs su bskyab pa ni snying rje yin no zhes 'di'i don rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning of this verse should be understood as follows: Compassion is the protection of suffering sentient beings.

original: 'dir khron pa'i nang du bu lhung ba'i ma dper bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir khron pa'i nang du bu lhung ba'i ma dper bya'o //
translated: Here, the mother whose child has fallen into a well is the example.

original: sems bskyed pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The application to the generosity, etc. which is generated by the generation of the thought is the attainment of the name of the perfections.

original: de'i phyir / sems bskyed pa de la brten cing gnas nas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems bskyed pa de la brten cing gnas nas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “having generated the thought, he applies himself to the factors of enlightenment, relying on and abiding in it.”

original: sems bskyed pa rnams ni nus pa ji ltab bzhin du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed kyi /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa rnams ni nus pa ji ltab bzhin du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed kyi /
translated: The generation of the thought ripens sentient beings according to their ability,

original: sems ma bskyed pa rnam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems ma bskyed pa rnam ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the non-generation of the thought.

original: de'i phyir / sems can gyi don bya ba dag la sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems can gyi don bya ba dag la sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “he applies himself to the performance of the aims of sentient beings.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kun du 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba nyid na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kun du 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba nyid na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa yin no //
translated: The training of the bodhisattva is the increase of the qualities of the Buddha and the ripening of sentient beings.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams kyi rten yin te zhes smras so //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams kyi rten yin te zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is the basis of the bodhisattva's training.

original: de ltar rten du gyur pa las rgyu mthun pa'i khyad par yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rten du gyur pa las rgyu mthun pa'i khyad par yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the excellence of the natural outcome of being a basis has been taught.

original: thams cad @20b kyi sems bskyed pa'i rnam pa gcig pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i rnam pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad @20b kyi sems bskyed pa'i rnam pa gcig pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i rnam pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the aspects of generating the Thought are not the same for all, and in order to show the aspects of generating the Thought which have such excellent qualities,

original: nges par 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba la lan cig sems bskyed nas nges par 'byin cing bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba la lan cig sems bskyed nas nges par 'byin cing bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he says, the deliverance, etc. Having generated the Thought once, one is delivered and will go to unexcelled enlightenment.

original: thob par 'gyur bas na nges par 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur bas na nges par 'byin pa'o //
translated: Deliverance is because one will attain it.

original: de las bzlog pa ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is non-deliverance.

original: gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa dang / brtan pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / phyir ldog pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam grangs so ;
analyzed: gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa dang / brtan pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / phyir ldog pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam grangs so ;
translated: “permanent” and “impermanent,” “stable” and “unstable,” “irreversible” and “reversible” are synonyms for it.

original: / de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: / de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gang skyes na gtan du 'jug la phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang skyes na gtan du 'jug la phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “When it arises, it is irreversible and does not turn back.”

original: rgyu rnam pa bzhis sems de ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa bzhis sems de ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind turns back due to four causes:

original: rigs kyi yon tan med pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su gzung ba dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chud ba dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rigs kyi yon tan med pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su gzung ba dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chud ba dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa nyid do //
translated: lack of the virtues of the spiritual gene, being held by bad friends, lack of compassion for sentient beings, and fear of the suffering of the life-cycle.

original: de dag las bzlog pa'i rgyu bzhis ni mi ldog par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa'i rgyu bzhis ni mi ldog par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It does not turn back due to the four causes that are the opposites of those.

original: skye ba'i rgyu'i bye brag gis sems bskyed pa'i bye brag tu 'gyur zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu'i bye brag gis sems bskyed pa'i bye brag tu 'gyur zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the differences in the generation of the Thought are due to the differences in the causes of its generation,

original: sems bskyed pa de yang rkyen bzhis zhes smras te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de yang rkyen bzhis zhes smras te /
translated: it is said: “And that generation of the Thought is due to four conditions.”

original: ji ltar rkyen rnams dang / rgyu rnams dang // stobs rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rkyen rnams dang / rgyu rnams dang // stobs rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it established in terms of conditions, causes, and powers?

original: rigs kyi stobs brtan par gyur nas rkyen dang po las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi stobs brtan par gyur nas rkyen dang po las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the power of the spiritual gene is stabilized, the thought of awakening arises from the first condition.

original: rigs kyi stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis /
analyzed: rigs kyi stobs dang ldan pa zhig gis /
translated: For one who possesses the power of the spiritual gene,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu mthong ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu mthong ba'am /
translated: having seen or heard of the power of the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: thos nas rgya che ba la mos pa rnams kyi sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos nas rgya che ba la mos pa rnams kyi sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the thought of awakening arises in those who aspire to the vast.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung bdag gis byang chub sems dpa'i lung gi chos thos nas dbang po rnon po rnams sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung bdag gis byang chub sems dpa'i lung gi chos thos nas dbang po rnon po rnams sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having heard the scriptural Dharma of the bodhisattvas from a spiritual friend, the thought of awakening arises in those of sharp faculties.

original: snying rje'i stobs nye bar brtan pa thob nas byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa'i chos la bsgrub pa dang ldan pa bdag por gyur ba las sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje'i stobs nye bar brtan pa thob nas byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa'i chos la bsgrub pa dang ldan pa bdag por gyur ba las sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained the stability of the power of compassion, the thought of awakening arises from the practice of the bodhisattva's realized Dharma, which is dominant.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la 'jigs pa med cing sems can rnams kyi rgud pa'i gnas skabs mthong ba bdag bor gyur pas stobs brtan pa thob par gyur pa las sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la 'jigs pa med cing sems can rnams kyi rgud pa'i gnas skabs mthong ba bdag bor gyur pas stobs brtan pa thob par gyur pa las sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The thought arises from the stability of strength, which is due to the absence of fear of the sufferings of cyclic existence and to the sight of the misfortune of sentient beings.🔽The first cause is twofold

original: dang po'i rgyu gnyis nyid @21a * //🔽stobs gnyis yin zhing /
analyzed: dang po'i rgyu gnyis nyid @21a * // stobs gnyis yin zhing /
translated: and the first condition is also twofold.

original: dang po'i rkyen gnyis kyang stobs gnyis yin no //🔽rigs kyi stobs can rgya chen po la mos pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mthong ngam thos pa bdag por gyur pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po'i rkyen gnyis kyang stobs gnyis yin no // rigs kyi stobs can rgya chen po la mos pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mthong ngam thos pa bdag por gyur pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The first cause is twofold: the power of lineage and the power of roots.🔽The power of lineage is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is not a beginner, because the bodhisattva who is a beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa thams cad ni zab cing rgya che ba'i phyir mthu zhes bya'o //🔽de dag las gsum ni mngon par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa thams cad ni zab cing rgya che ba'i phyir mthu zhes bya'o // de dag las gsum ni mngon par shes pa yin la /
translated: The power of roots is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of lineage is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is not a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of roots is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of lineage is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is not a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of roots is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of lineage is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is not a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of roots is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.

original: gsum ni cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: gsum ni cho 'phrul yin no //
translated: The power of lineage is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is not a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of roots is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.

original: zab pa nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: zab pa nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: The power of lineage is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is not a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of roots is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of lineage is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is not a beginner, because the beginner has not yet acquired the power of lineage.🔽The power of roots is the cause of the thought of the bodhisattva who is a

original: rgya che ba nyid kyis rmad du byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba nyid kyis rmad du byung ba'o //
translated: It is marvelous because of its greatness.

original: yid brtan pa las zhes bya ba ni dad par bya ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid brtan pa las zhes bya ba ni dad par bya ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the trustworthy, means from the trustworthy ones.

original: gang la gnas par gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang la gnas par gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have gone, means the Tathagatas.

original: zhugs par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zhugs par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those who have entered, means the Bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub chen por mos shing zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po la mngon par mos par gyur pa'o //🔽sems skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir sems de la bstod cing skul bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub chen por mos shing zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po la mngon par mos par gyur pa'o // sems skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir sems de la bstod cing skul bar byed pa ste /
translated: Aspiring to great enlightenment, means having a strong aspiration for great enlightenment.🔽They generate the thought, means they praise and encourage that thought in order to attain it.

original: smon lam 'debs shing mngon par 'du byed pas sems skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smon lam 'debs shing mngon par 'du byed pas sems skyed par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: They generate the thought by making aspirations and by their performance.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung zhing dbang po rnon po rnams kyis zab cing rgya che ba shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde'i don thos nas rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su gzung zhing dbang po rnon po rnams kyis zab cing rgya che ba shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde'i don thos nas rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are held by spiritual friends and have sharp faculties, when they hear the meaning of the extensive sutras that are profound and vast, they become very joyful.

original: sems rab tu dga' bar gyur pas dam pa'i chos thos pa de nyid bdag por byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la mos par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems rab tu dga' bar gyur pas dam pa'i chos thos pa de nyid bdag por byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la mos par 'gyur zhing /
translated: With their minds filled with joy, they make the hearing of the holy Dharma their main practice and aspire to the wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir sems skyed par byed do //
translated: They generate the mind that is intent on attaining the wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje'i stobs brtan pa thob par gyur pas /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje'i stobs brtan pa thob par gyur pas /
translated: Having attained the power of firm compassion for sentient beings,

original: dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur ba'i dus kyi tshe 'di ltar sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur ba'i dus kyi tshe 'di ltar sems skyed par byed do //
translated: at the time when the holy Dharma is being destroyed, they generate the mind in this way:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos gnas par 'gyur bas sems can tshad med pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba dang / bde ba yang dag par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos gnas par 'gyur bas sems can tshad med pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba dang / bde ba yang dag par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the bodhisattva path and the bodhisattva Dharma will endure, the sufferings of countless sentient beings will be pacified and their happiness will increase.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mang po rnams ni spang bar bya ba dang / dge ba'i chos mang po rnams ni 'phel zhing rgyas par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed do//
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mang po rnams ni spang bar bya ba dang / dge ba'i chos mang po rnams ni 'phel zhing rgyas par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed do//
translated: Because the Bodhisattva path and the Bodhisattva Dharma will endure, he practices in order to eliminate the many non-virtuous dharmas and to increase and expand the many virtuous dharmas in order to pacify the suffering of immeasurable sentient beings and to increase their happiness.

original: @21b 'di lta bu'i dam pa'i chos kyi tshul 'jig par 'gyur ba dang nye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: @21b 'di lta bu'i dam pa'i chos kyi tshul 'jig par 'gyur ba dang nye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: He generates the thought, The way of the true Dharma is about to perish and disappear.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis re zhig dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya zhing sems bskyed la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis re zhig dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya zhing sems bskyed la /
translated: Therefore, I will first practice in order to make the true Dharma endure for a long time and generate the thought,

original: sems can 'di dag gi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o zhes rtags pa'i chos la nan tan bya ba'i phyir sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o zhes rtags pa'i chos la nan tan bya ba'i phyir sems skyed par byed do //
translated: and I will eliminate the suffering of these sentient beings. He generates the thought in order to practice the Dharma.

original: dus kyi tha ma dus kyi mjug tu bab pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i dus kyi tshe'o //🔽dus ngan pa ste phongs par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dus kyi tha ma dus kyi mjug tu bab pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i dus kyi tshe'o // dus ngan pa ste phongs par gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: At the end of time, at the end of the eon, means at the time of the five degenerations.

original: snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pas sems can rnams rnam pa bzhis phongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pas sems can rnams rnam pa bzhis phongs par 'gyur te /
translated: At the time of the five degenerations, beings are impoverished in four ways.

original: tshe'i snyigs ma ni tshe rgud pa ste tshe thung ba nyid do //🔽sems can gyi snyigs ma ni bdag gi dngos po rgud pa ste /
analyzed: tshe'i snyigs ma ni tshe rgud pa ste tshe thung ba nyid do // sems can gyi snyigs ma ni bdag gi dngos po rgud pa ste /
translated: The degeneration of life is the decline of life, i.e., the shortness of life.

original: yan lag dang nying lag gi tshad chung ba dang ma tshang bar gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag gi tshad chung ba dang ma tshang bar gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The degeneration of beings is the decline of the body, i.e., the smallness and incompleteness of the major and minor body parts.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma ni dge ba'i chos kyis phongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma ni dge ba'i chos kyis phongs pa ste /
translated: The degeneration of afflictions and views is the impoverishment of virtue,

original: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la'o //🔽/ bskal pa'i snyigs ma ni nye bar mkho bas phongs pa ste /
analyzed: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la'o // / bskal pa'i snyigs ma ni nye bar mkho bas phongs pa ste /
translated: in the householder and monastic groups.🔽The degeneration of the eon is the impoverishment of necessities,

original: ro brgya dang ldan pa la sogs pa rnams nub par gyur pas de nyid kyis rgud par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ro brgya dang ldan pa la sogs pa rnams nub par gyur pas de nyid kyis rgud par gyur pa'o //
translated: because the foods such as nectar have disappeared, and because of the decline of the eon.

original: tha ma'i dus kyi sems can rnams nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bcu lhag par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha ma'i dus kyi sems can rnams nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bcu lhag par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that sentient beings in the final age have an abundance of ten secondary mental afflictions, he says:

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'di lta ste zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'di lta ste zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: These are the ten secondary mental afflictions.🔽The ten secondary mental afflictions are presented in the Commentary as follows: “The ten secondary mental afflictions are due to the power of secondary mental afflictions that obstruct engagement, that make engagement difficult, and that obstruct the practice of engagement.”

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu'i rnam par gzhag pa ni 'jug pa la bar chad du gyur pa dang / 'jug par dka' ba nyid dang / 'jug pa la nan tan byed pa'i bar chad du gyur pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa las rgyu gsum gyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu'i rnam par gzhag pa ni 'jug pa la bar chad du gyur pa dang / 'jug par dka' ba nyid dang / 'jug pa la nan tan byed pa'i bar chad du gyur pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa las rgyu gsum gyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: There are three causes of engagement:

original: shes rab bdag por gyur pas sam /
analyzed: shes rab bdag por gyur pas sam /
translated: one is engaged through the power of wisdom;

original: bdag nyid kha na ma tho bas 'jigs pas sam /
analyzed: bdag nyid kha na ma tho bas 'jigs pas sam /
translated: one is engaged through fear of the misdeed;

original: snying rjes sems can la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: snying rjes sems can la ltos pa'o //
translated: one is engaged through compassion for sentient beings.

original: gsum po 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum ste /
translated: The three secondary mental afflictions are the opposites of these three.

original: gti mug shas che ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa shas che ba dang / phrag dog dang ser sna shas che ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug shas che ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa shas che ba dang / phrag dog dang ser sna shas che ba'o //
translated: Those with a predominance of delusion, those with a predominance of shamelessness and lack of abashment, and those with a predominance of envy and avarice.

original: 'jug par dka' ba nyid dang / gnyi ga'i sgrib pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jug par dka' ba nyid dang / gnyi ga'i sgrib pa ni gsum ste /
translated: The difficulty of engaging is threefold:

original: sdug bsngal shas che ba smos pa ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shas che ba smos pa ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The predominance of suffering is the karmic obstruction.

original: gnas ngan len shas che ba dang / nyon mongs pa shas che ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib ba'o//
analyzed: gnas ngan len shas che ba dang / nyon mongs pa shas che ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib ba'o//
translated: The predominance of demerit and the predominance of affliction are the affliction obstruction.

original: @22a * // nyes par spyod pa shas che ba ni las kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: @22a * // nyes par spyod pa shas che ba ni las kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: The predominance of misdeeds is the karmic obstruction.

original: yang na sdug bsngal ba dang / gnas ngan len shas che ba ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal ba dang / gnas ngan len shas che ba ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the predominance of suffering and the predominance of demerit are the karmic obstruction.

original: de la ngan 'gro ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngan 'gro ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Among those, the lower realms are the karmic obstruction.

original: sdug bsngal shas che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shas che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the predominance of suffering.

original: bde 'gro'i rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni gnas ngan len shas che ba nyid do zhes bya ba nas so //
analyzed: bde 'gro'i rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni gnas ngan len shas che ba nyid do zhes bya ba nas so //
translated: The obstruction to the karmic maturation of the higher realms is the predominance of demerit.🔽The obstruction to the cause is threefold:

original: bag med pa shas che ba dang / le lo shas che ba dang / ma dad pa shas che ba rnams kyis sgrub pa'i bar du gcod par byed de /
analyzed: bag med pa shas che ba dang / le lo shas che ba dang / ma dad pa shas che ba rnams kyis sgrub pa'i bar du gcod par byed de /
translated: The four faults are: excessive carelessness, excessive laziness, excessive lack of faith, and excessive fear.

original: bya ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / bar ma dor 'jog pa dang / thob par bya ba thob pa'i thabs la dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / bar ma dor 'jog pa dang / thob par bya ba thob pa'i thabs la dad pa med pa'o //
translated: They are, respectively, attachment to bad actions, giving up in the middle, and lack of faith in the means of attaining what is to be attained.

original: bag med pas ni sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pas ni sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Because of excessive carelessness, one does not practice.

original: le los ni sgrub pa la zhugs kyang bar du 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: le los ni sgrub pa la zhugs kyang bar du 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of excessive laziness, one gives up in the middle, even though one has begun to practice.🔽Because of excessive lack of faith, one is not firm in practice.

original: ma dad pa shas che bas ni sgrub pa la mi brtan par 'gyur ro zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni gzhan gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma dad pa shas che bas ni sgrub pa la mi brtan par 'gyur ro zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni gzhan gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This presentation is taught following the system of others.

original: yang 'di ltar ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: But this is the correct explanation.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu'i rnam par gzhag pa ni mngon par mtho ba'i lam gyi bar chad du gyur pa dang / nges par legs pa'i lam gyi bar chad du gyur pa dang / lam gnyi ga'i bar chad du gyur pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //🔽de la mngon par mtho ba ni bde 'gro'i bdag gi dngos po phun sum tshogs pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu'i rnam par gzhag pa ni mngon par mtho ba'i lam gyi bar chad du gyur pa dang / nges par legs pa'i lam gyi bar chad du gyur pa dang / lam gnyi ga'i bar chad du gyur pa'i dbang du byas pa'o // de la mngon par mtho ba ni bde 'gro'i bdag gi dngos po phun sum tshogs pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is the path of the bodhisattva.

original: bdag gi dngos po phun sum tshogs pa'i lam ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po phun sum tshogs pa'i lam ni tshul khrims so //
translated: The path of direct-comprehension is the path of the noble ones.
