original: gzhan gyi 'byor pa mi bzod pa dang / longs spyod la zhen pa che ba las sbyin pa las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'byor pa mi bzod pa dang / longs spyod la zhen pa che ba las sbyin pa las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The path of direct-comprehension is the path of the noble ones.

original: de ltar nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum po 'di dag ni mngon par mtho ba'i bar du gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum po 'di dag ni mngon par mtho ba'i bar du gcod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these three secondary mental afflictions are obstacles to the higher realms.

original: de la nges par legs pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba ni lam bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nges par legs pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba ni lam bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of meditative development should be understood as the practice of the path that leads to liberation.

original: de'i bar du gcod pa ni sngar bstan pa'i sgrib pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i bar du gcod pa ni sngar bstan pa'i sgrib pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four types of secondary mental afflictions that were previously described as being included within the three obstructions are obstacles to that path.

original: de dag gis bsgribs pas shin tu skal ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bsgribs pas shin tu skal ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are obscured by these four, one becomes extremely unfortunate.

original: bag med @22b par gyur na le lo shas che bar 'gyur bas lam de dag gnyi ga la sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag med @22b par gyur na le lo shas che bar 'gyur bas lam de dag gnyi ga la sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one becomes heedless, one will be overcome by laziness and will not apply oneself to either of these two paths.

original: dad pa med pa yang sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pa med pa yang sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one lacks faith, one will not apply oneself.

original: de lta bu'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'di dag gis mngon par mtho ba'i lam dang / nges par legs pa'i lam la sems can rnams nyams par byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'di dag gis mngon par mtho ba'i lam dang / nges par legs pa'i lam la sems can rnams nyams par byed pas na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These ten secondary mental afflictions are called “secondary mental afflictions” because they cause sentient beings to be deprived of the path that leads to the higher realms and the path that leads to liberation.

original: gcig tu ngan song du gzhol bar 'gyur bas na rgud par gnas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu ngan song du gzhol bar 'gyur bas na rgud par gnas pa yang yin no //
translated: They are also in a state of decline, since they are exclusively inclined toward the miserable realms.

original: de ltar snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i dus su nyan thos kyi theg pa la nan tan byed pa yang shin tu rnyed par dka' ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i dus su nyan thos kyi theg pa la nan tan byed pa yang shin tu rnyed par dka' ba yin la /
translated: Thus, in this time of the five degenerations, it is very difficult to find someone who is intent on the Disciple Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po la nan tan byed pa ni de bas kyang ches shin tu rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la nan tan byed pa ni de bas kyang ches shin tu rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
translated: It is even more difficult to find someone who is intent on the Great Vehicle.

original: gang rnyed sla ba de ni thams cad kyis bya bar nus / pa yin la /
analyzed: gang rnyed sla ba de ni thams cad kyis bya bar nus / pa yin la /
translated: Whatever is easy to find can be done by everyone.🔽But whatever is difficult to find is for a few special beings.

original: gang rnyed par dka' ba de ni sems can khyad par can 'ga' zhig gis yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang rnyed par dka' ba de ni sems can khyad par can 'ga' zhig gis yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, the verse states:

original: sems bskyed par dka' ba dang / theg pa chen po sgrub par byed pa rnyed par dka' ba bdag por byas nas /
analyzed: sems bskyed par dka' ba dang / theg pa chen po sgrub par byed pa rnyed par dka' ba bdag por byas nas /
translated: Having made it difficult to generate the mind and difficult to find the practice of the Great Vehicle,

original: byang chub chen por sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub chen por sems skyed par byed do //
translated: one generates the mind for great enlightenment.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The suffering of cyclic existence is birth and so forth.

original: 'jigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Fear should be understood as twofold:

original: dman pa ni nyan thos kyi lam la nan tan byed pa na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba'i tshe zil gyis mnan zhing mya ngan byed /
analyzed: dman pa ni nyan thos kyi lam la nan tan byed pa na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba'i tshe zil gyis mnan zhing mya ngan byed /
translated: When the inferior ones are practicing the Śrāvaka path and experiencing the sufferings of cyclic existence, they are overwhelmed and lament.

original: ngu bar byed /🔽smre sngags 'don par byed /
analyzed: ngu bar byed / smre sngags 'don par byed /
translated: They cry.🔽They moan.

original: brang rdung bar byed /
analyzed: brang rdung bar byed /
translated: They beat their chests.

original: kun du rmongs par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: kun du rmongs par 'gyur ro /
translated: They become confused.

original: 'bring po ni kun du zhum par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'bring po ni kun du zhum par 'gyur bas /
translated: The middling ones become discouraged.

original: 'bring po rnams kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba na shin tu sgyid lug par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'bring po rnams kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba na shin tu sgyid lug par gyur nas /
translated: When the middling ones experience the sufferings of cyclic existence, they become very lazy.

original: dka' ba spyod pas 'jigs shing skrag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pas 'jigs shing skrag par 'gyur na /
translated: If they are afraid and terrified of engaging in austerities,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba spyad pa ni thos par yang nus pa ma yin na spyad pa ma yin na spyad pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽gnyi ga'i sdug bsngal yang so sor rnam pa bzhi bzhir bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba spyad pa ni thos par yang nus pa ma yin na spyad pa ma yin na spyad pa lta smos kyang ci dgos / gnyi ga'i sdug bsngal yang so sor rnam pa bzhi bzhir bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: how could they possibly practice the austerities of the bodhisattvas, which they are not even able to hear about?🔽In order to show that the sufferings of both are each of four types,

original: rnam pa bzhis sdug bsngal khyad par can lhag par 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis sdug bsngal khyad par can lhag par 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: the sufferings of the bodhisattvas are superior due to four aspects.

original: dus kyi khyad par ni gang yun ring ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par ni gang yun ring ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The difference in time is that it is long-lasting,

original: dus mang por 'gor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mang por 'gor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it endures for a long time.

original: gzhi'i khyad par na rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi'i khyad par na rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in basis is that it is entered into in various ways.

original: dbye ba'i khyad par ni chen po las kyang chen por gyur bas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: dbye ba'i khyad par ni chen po las kyang chen por gyur bas 'jug pa ste /
translated: The difference in function is that it is engaged in as greater than great,

original: gang drag pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽rgyun gyi @23a * //
analyzed: gang drag pa zhes bya ba'o // rgyun gyi @23a * //
translated: that is, as intense.

original: khyad par ni bar mchad cing mtshams med par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni bar mchad cing mtshams med par sbyor ba ste /
translated: The difference in continuity is that it is applied without interruption,

original: gang yang bar chad med pas zhes bya ba'o //🔽mdor bstan pa rgyas par bstan pas rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang bar chad med pas zhes bya ba'o // mdor bstan pa rgyas par bstan pas rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: that is, without a break.

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to teach the analysis of the brief introduction and the extensive explanation, he says🔽The perfection of lineage is

original: rigs ni chos nyid kyis thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rigs ni chos nyid kyis thob pa yin gyi /
translated: The lineage is obtained naturally,

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not through the actualization of causes and conditions.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gcig nyid yin gyi de la dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gcig nyid yin gyi de la dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is of one kind only and is not divided.

original: gang yang bsgrubs pa las byung ba de yang rgyu dang rkyen gyis mngon par 'dus byas pa yin yang dbye ba med de /
analyzed: gang yang bsgrubs pa las byung ba de yang rgyu dang rkyen gyis mngon par 'dus byas pa yin yang dbye ba med de /
translated: And that which arises from practice is also manifestly produced by causes and conditions, but it is not differentiated.

original: de'i rkyen ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir 'bras bu la yang dbye ba med do //
analyzed: de'i rkyen ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir 'bras bu la yang dbye ba med do //
translated: Because its conditions are of one nature, there is no differentiation in the result.

original: de'i phyir 'di las gzhan pa'i rgyu gsum gyis dbye ba ni yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di las gzhan pa'i rgyu gsum gyis dbye ba ni yod do //
translated: Therefore, there is differentiation by the other three causes.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni bshes gnyen ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni bshes gnyen ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva's spiritual teacher should be understood as fourfold. The perfection of the spiritual teacher is to be understood as the antidote to the four kinds of bad spiritual teachers.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bshes gnyen ngan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bshes gnyen ngan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The bad spiritual teacher of the bodhisattva is fourfold.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa don nyung zhing bya ba nyung ba dang / 'jig rten skyed par byed pa sngags dang spobs pa sna tshogs la zhugs pa dang / gang la brten pas 'jig rten gyi zang zing sdud par 'gyur gyi chos sdud par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa don nyung zhing bya ba nyung ba dang / 'jig rten skyed par byed pa sngags dang spobs pa sna tshogs la zhugs pa dang / gang la brten pas 'jig rten gyi zang zing sdud par 'gyur gyi chos sdud par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The śrāvaka vehicle is for those who are engaged in benefiting themselves, the pratyekabuddha vehicle is for those who have few concerns and do little, and the vehicle of the world creators is for those who are engaged in various mantras and eloquence.

original: de la 'jig rten skyed par byed pa ni bshes gnyen ngan pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten skyed par byed pa ni bshes gnyen ngan pa'o //
translated: The world creators are bad friends.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
translated: The antidote is the excellent friend.

original: bshes gnyen ngan pa de yang lta bar lhung ba dang / lta ba log par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bshes gnyen ngan pa de yang lta bar lhung ba dang / lta ba log par gyur pa'o //
translated: The bad friend is one who has fallen into a view and one who has a wrong view.

original: de las bzlog pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni shes rab lhag par gyur pa shes rab gsal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni shes rab lhag par gyur pa shes rab gsal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The spiritual friend who is the opposite of that is one who has superior wisdom and clear wisdom.

original: blun po ma yin zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: blun po ma yin zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “not a fool,” and so on.

original: blun po ma yin pa dang / yid rtul ba ma yin pa dang / mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi ni byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa rnams las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: blun po ma yin pa dang / yid rtul ba ma yin pa dang / mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bzhi ni byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa rnams las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The four terms “not foolish,” “not dull-witted,” “wise,” and “intelligent” should be understood as the opposites of “childish,” “confused,” “unclear,” and “unwise.”

original: byis pa ma yin pas na ma rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa ma yin pas na ma rmongs pa ste /
translated: “Not foolish” means “not confused.”

original: rig pa'i gnas thams cad la rjes su 'jug @23b pa dang mthun pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas thams cad la rjes su 'jug @23b pa dang mthun pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is endowed with innate wisdom that is engaged in and in accord with all the branches of learning.

original: ma rmongs pa ni mang du thos pa'i rigs can te /
analyzed: ma rmongs pa ni mang du thos pa'i rigs can te /
translated: “Not confused” means “well-read.”

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab can no //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab can no //
translated: He is endowed with the wisdom that comes from listening.

original: mkhas pa ni gsal ba ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni gsal ba ste /
translated: “Wise” means “clear.”

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab can no //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab can no //
translated: He is endowed with the wisdom that comes from reflection.

original: mdzangs pa ni kun la rigs pa can no //
analyzed: mdzangs pa ni kun la rigs pa can no //
translated: “Intelligent” means “skilled in all matters.”

original: de dag las sngar smos pa'i bshes gnyen ngan pa ni shin tu ngan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag las sngar smos pa'i bshes gnyen ngan pa ni shin tu ngan pa yin no //
translated: Among these, the previously mentioned bad friends are the worst.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi yan lag ni gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi yan lag ni gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the limbs that are the counteragents to those are the principal ones.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The excellence of the spiritual teacher should be understood as being presented in two ways.

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid kyis phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i thabs shes pa'i rnam pa dang pos phun sum tshogs pa dang po yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid kyis phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i thabs shes pa'i rnam pa dang pos phun sum tshogs pa dang po yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: The first excellence is fully revealed by the first aspect, which is the knowledge of the means of accomplishing the benefit and happiness of others through the wisdom that was explained earlier.

original: gnas ma yin pa la mi sbyor ba'i gnas ma yin pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la mi sbyor ba'i gnas ma yin pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of improper objects:

original: lung du ma bstan pa la gnas pa dang ; dge ba ma yin pa la gnas pa dang / dman pa'i dge ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa la gnas pa dang ; dge ba ma yin pa la gnas pa dang / dman pa'i dge ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: those that are indeterminate, those that are nonvirtuous, and those that are virtuous but inferior.

original: de la dang po'i gnas ma yin pa la sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de la dang po'i gnas ma yin pa la sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to the first, it is said:

original: bag med pa la yang de 'jug par mi byed la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bag med pa la yang de 'jug par mi byed la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He does not cause them to engage in heedlessness.

original: de la bag med pa'i bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la bag med pa'i bya ba ni /
translated: The activity of heedlessness is as follows.

original: dge ba'i chos mi bsgom pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos mi bsgom pa nyid do //
translated: not cultivating virtue.

original: bag med pa'i gnas ni bya ba'i gnas kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnas ni bya ba'i gnas kyi dngos po'o //
translated: The basis of heedlessness is the state of being engaged in action.

original: de bzhin du nyes par spyod pa dang / de'i gnas kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyes par spyod pa dang / de'i gnas kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand the basis of misdeeds.🔽In this regard, the four summaries should be understood as two pairs:

original: de la mdo bzhi pa bshes gnyen ngan pa rnam pa gnyis su byas nas 'di'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste ;🔽gang la brten par gyur na kha na mtho ba dang bcas kyang rung /🔽kha na ma tho ba med kyang rung /
analyzed: de la mdo bzhi pa bshes gnyen ngan pa rnam pa gnyis su byas nas 'di'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste ; gang la brten par gyur na kha na mtho ba dang bcas kyang rung / kha na ma tho ba med kyang rung /
translated: the first pair is the pair of bad and good spiritual teachers,

original: 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba tsam 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba tsam 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and the second pair is the pair of the happiness of this world and the highest spiritual good.

original: de la dang po dang gnyis pa'i bshes gnyen gcig tu byas nas de las bzlog pa ni phun sum tshogs pa bzhi par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po dang gnyis pa'i bshes gnyen gcig tu byas nas de las bzlog pa ni phun sum tshogs pa bzhi par rig par bya'o //
translated: The first and second summaries are the first pair, and the third and fourth summaries are the second pair.🔽The first pair is the basis for the occurrence of the happiness of this world, whether or not it is accompanied by the reproach of one's conscience.🔽The second pair is the basis for the occurrence of the highest spiritual good, whether or not it is accompanied by the reproach of one's conscience.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa la gzhag pa dang / ches dman pa la gzhag pa ni mdor bsdu na theg pa la ltos pa dang / dngos po la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa la gzhag pa dang / ches dman pa la gzhag pa ni mdor bsdu na theg pa la ltos pa dang / dngos po la ltos pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the disciple in a spiritual teacher who is superior and the establishment of the disciple in a spiritual teacher who is inferior are, in brief, with reference to the vehicle and with reference to the person.

original: de la theg pa chen po ni ches khyad par du 'phags par 'jug pa yin la /🔽nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni ches dman pa'o //
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po ni ches khyad par du 'phags par 'jug pa yin la / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni ches dman pa'o //
translated: The Mahayana is the superior vehicle,
while the vehicles of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas are inferior.

original: la dad pa ni thob par bya ba'i dngos po thob par byed pa'i thabs nyid ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: la dad pa ni thob par bya ba'i dngos po thob par byed pa'i thabs nyid ni dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is the means of attaining the object to be attained.

original: yang de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold:

original: yod pa nyid la yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang / bsgrub par nus pa la ma mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa nyid dang / yon tan dang ldan pa rab tu dang ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid la yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang / bsgrub par nus pa la ma mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa nyid dang / yon tan dang ldan pa rab tu dang ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: the aspect of conviction in existence, the aspect of manifest desire for what can be accomplished, and the aspect of clear faith in the qualities.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa la 'dun pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bstan to //
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa la 'dun pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bstan to //
translated: After faith, aspiration for virtue is taught, since aspiration arises for one who has faith.

original: 'dun pa skyes nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir sems kyis smon par byed cing mngon par 'du byed skyed par byed pas de'i rjes la yang dag par blang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa skyes nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir sems kyis smon par byed cing mngon par 'du byed skyed par byed pas de'i rjes la yang dag par blang ba'o //
translated: After aspiration, correct adoption is taught, since one generates the mental aspiration and manifest effort to attain it.

original: de ltar sems bskyed cing smon lam gdab pa byas pa ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed cing smon lam gdab pa byas pa ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: After that, one should make an effort at the striving.🔽And that striving, if it is taken hold of by means of the method and is properly accomplished, will bring about the desired result.

original: brtson 'grus de yang thabs kyis yongs su gzung zhing tshul bzhin du bsgrubs na 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la thabs bstan to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus de yang thabs kyis yongs su gzung zhing tshul bzhin du bsgrubs na 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la thabs bstan to //
translated: After that, the method is taught.

original: 'di dag ni yon tan te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni yon tan te /
translated: These are the virtues,

original: skyon rnams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon rnams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the antidotes to the faults.

original: de la theg pa'i dbang du byas nas ches khyad par du 'phags pa dang / ches dman pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la theg pa'i dbang du byas nas ches khyad par du 'phags pa dang / ches dman pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therein, in terms of the vehicle, in order to teach the state of being very superior and the state of being very inferior,

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said, “It is like this.”

original: dngos po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of things:

original: ye shes kyi dngos po dang / bsod nams kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dngos po dang / bsod nams kyi dngos po'o //
translated: the thing of wisdom and the thing of merit.

original: ye shes kyi dngos po la ltos nas bsgoms pa las byung ba la sogs pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dngos po la ltos nas bsgoms pa las byung ba la sogs pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: and it is not superior.

original: dge slong gi bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dge slong gi bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the activities of a bhikṣu,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa dang / 'bring po dang / dman pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa dang / 'bring po dang / dman pa'o //
translated: it is superior, middling, and inferior.

original: de la dge slong gi bya ba'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan dang / sgom pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong gi bya ba'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan dang / sgom pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Among them, the principal activity of a bhikṣu is to apply himself to meditative concentration and cultivation.

original: 'bring po ni klog pa dang / nyan pa dang / sems pas bsdus pa bsam gtan ma yin pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'bring po ni klog pa dang / nyan pa dang / sems pas bsdus pa bsam gtan ma yin pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The middling is to apply himself to that which is not meditative concentration, which is included in recitation, listening, and reflection.

original: gnyi ga yang thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyor bar mi nus na /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyor bar mi nus na /
translated: If he is not able to apply himself to either of these,

original: dad pas byin pa longs spyod pa 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dad pas byin pa longs spyod pa 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: then in order to enjoy the gifts of the faithful with their fruit,

original: zhal ta ba'i las la sbyor bar gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: zhal ta ba'i las la sbyor bar gnang ba yin no //
translated: he is permitted to apply himself to the activity of service.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And that is of two kinds:

original: dge 'dun gyi zas la sko bar byed cing res la sogs pa'i sko ba'i zhal ta byed pa dang / @24b bla ma la gus shing rim gror byed pas bla ma'i yongs su spyod pas g-yog byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zas la sko bar byed cing res la sogs pa'i sko ba'i zhal ta byed pa dang / @24b bla ma la gus shing rim gror byed pas bla ma'i yongs su spyod pas g-yog byed pa'o //
translated: He is a servant of the guru, because he is devoted to the guru and serves him.

original: bsod nams kyi dngos po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi dngos po'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the point of view of the bases of meritorious action,

original: tshul khrims las byung ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he is one who has arisen from morality, etc.

original: rgyu bzhis snying rje brtan cing bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu bzhis snying rje brtan cing bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that compassion is firm and explained by four causes.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skyes pa'i sems can las dang po pa rnams la snying rje skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skyes pa'i sems can las dang po pa rnams la snying rje skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Compassion arises for sentient beings who are born in defiled world-realms and are beginners,🔽but not for those who are not defiled.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sdug bsngal med pa de lta bu dag kyang yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sdug bsngal med pa de lta bu dag kyang yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There are also world-realms where there is no suffering.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The non-defiled has two types:

original: rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa'o //
translated: pure and impure.

original: de la rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni bud med la sogs pa'i ming yang shes par mi 'gyur na skye ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni bud med la sogs pa'i ming yang shes par mi 'gyur na skye ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: In the pure world-realms, the names of women, etc. are not even known, much less birth.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Only Buddhas and Bodhisattvas who have attained great power are born there.

original: de na theg pa chen po gcig gi dbang du byas nas chos ston par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de na theg pa chen po gcig gi dbang du byas nas chos ston par byed pa nyid do //
translated: There, the Dharma is taught only in terms of the one Great Vehicle.

original: des na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ming yang shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ming yang shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even the names of Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are not known there.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pas bsdus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pas bsdus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In those world-realms, there is no suffering or origination truth,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba las nges par byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba las nges par byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from extremely pure supramundane virtue.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams yin la //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams yin la //
translated: They are impure world systems.

original: snyigs ma lnga dang bral ba de dag na thams cad kyi thams cad du sems can rnams rgud par 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga dang bral ba de dag na thams cad kyi thams cad du sems can rnams rgud par 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: In those systems, which are free from the five degenerations, there is no complete degeneration of sentient beings.

original: mdor na sdug bsngal ni rnam par gsum ste /
analyzed: mdor na sdug bsngal ni rnam par gsum ste /
translated: In brief, there are three kinds of suffering:

original: gzhan gyis byas pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'o //
translated: that which is caused by others, that which is innate, and that which arises from transformation.

original: de dag las bzlog par gyur pa ni sdug bsngal med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog par gyur pa ni sdug bsngal med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of suffering should be understood as the opposite of those.

original: gang na snyigs ma lnga dang / sems can rnams kyi rgud pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa der skyes pa rnams la mdor na sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis la bltas nas snying rje skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa dang / rang gi rgyud la bab pa'o //
analyzed: gang na snyigs ma lnga dang / sems can rnams kyi rgud pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa der skyes pa rnams la mdor na sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis la bltas nas snying rje skye bar 'gyur ro // gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa dang / rang gi rgyud la bab pa'o //
translated: In brief, compassion arises when one sees the two kinds of suffering of those who are born in those systems where the five degenerations and the three kinds of suffering of sentient beings exist.

The suffering that is caused by others and that which arises from transformation are the suffering that is external to the mind.🔽The suffering that is innate is the suffering that is internal to the mind.

original: gnyis ka la yang snying rje'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang snying rje'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: In both cases, there are two kinds of causes of compassion.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to the suffering that is in the life-stream of another, it is said:

original: gzhan yang sdug bsngal ci yang rung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sdug bsngal ci yang rung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Moreover, whatever suffering there is,

original: thebs shing zhes bya ba ni dang por ro //
analyzed: thebs shing zhes bya ba ni dang por ro //
translated: In the beginning, it is “struck” by the suffering.

original: gnod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni bar du'o //
analyzed: gnod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni bar du'o //
translated: In the middle, it is “afflicted” by the cause of suffering.

original: non pa zhes bya ba tha mar ro //🔽yang na lhan cig skyes pas thebs shing yongs su gyur pa las byung bas gnod par gyur te /
analyzed: non pa zhes bya ba tha mar ro // yang na lhan cig skyes pas thebs shing yongs su gyur pa las byung bas gnod par gyur te /
translated: In the end, it is “oppressed” by the result of suffering.

original: gzhan gyis byas pas non pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pas non pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is “struck” by the suffering that arises from the transformation of the fundamental materiality of the body. It is “afflicted” by the suffering that arises from the transformation of the secondary materiality. It is “oppressed” by the suffering that arises from the transformation of the life-stream.

original: rgyu gnyis pa rang gi rgyud la bab pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis pa rang gi rgyud la bab pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to the second cause, the suffering that is in one’s own life-stream, it is said:

original: bdag kyang sdug bsngal ci yang rung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang sdug bsngal ci yang rung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever suffering there is,

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa'i sdug bsngal chung ngu'i rnam pa gnyis kyi rgyu bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa'i sdug bsngal chung ngu'i rnam pa gnyis kyi rgyu bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the causes of the two kinds of lesser suffering that occur in one's own and others' mind-streams,

original: bdag dang gzhan du gtogs pa'i rgyu gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du gtogs pa'i rgyu gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the two causes that pertain to oneself and others,

original: gzhan nam bdag gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: gzhan nam bdag gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: he says, whether in oneself or in others, and so on.

original: gnyi ga yang rung zhes bya ba la dus gcig tu bsngal myong ba'i dbang du byas na bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rung zhes bya ba la dus gcig tu bsngal myong ba'i dbang du byas na bstan pa ni /
translated: Either one refers to the teaching of the greatness of suffering in terms of the experience of suffering at one time.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhis chen por bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhis chen por bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is taught as being great in four ways:

original: dus chen po nyid dang / sgo du ma nyid dang / chen po'i rnam pa nyid dang / rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dus chen po nyid dang / sgo du ma nyid dang / chen po'i rnam pa nyid dang / rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa nyid kyis so //
translated: greatness of time, greatness of doors, greatness of aspects, and greatness of continuity.

original: yang gzhan dag gi rgyu gzhan rnam pa bzhir 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag gi rgyu gzhan rnam pa bzhir 'chad par byed de /
translated: Moreover, others explain the four kinds of causes of suffering as follows:

original: gang na sdug bsngal ba dang / gang dag sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa gang yin pa la nye bar dmigs nas snying rje chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang na sdug bsngal ba dang / gang dag sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa gang yin pa la nye bar dmigs nas snying rje chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: great compassion arises when one focuses on the place of suffering, the beings who are suffering, the aspects of suffering, and the cause of suffering.

original: gang na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skyes pa'o //
translated: Where there is suffering means in a world system where beings are born with suffering.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan rnams so //
translated: Who means oneself and others.

original: rnam pa gang yin pa ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rnam pa rnams kyis so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yin pa ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rnam pa rnams kyis so zhes zer ro //
translated: What kind means the small, medium, and great kinds.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i 'di la skyon 'di yod de /🔽sdug bsngal chung ngu nyid la bdag dang gzhan gyi dbye ba byas pas rgyu gnyis bstan la /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i 'di la skyon 'di yod de / sdug bsngal chung ngu nyid la bdag dang gzhan gyi dbye ba byas pas rgyu gnyis bstan la /
translated: This classification is faulty,

original: chen po la ma yin pa'i rgyu ci yin de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa snga ma nyid kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po la ma yin pa'i rgyu ci yin de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa snga ma nyid kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: because the small degree of suffering is divided into two, that of oneself and that of others, and the great degree is not. What is the reason? Therefore, the former classification is faultless.

original: rgyu de dag gi phyir rigs phun sum tshogs pa nyid las snying rje nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rgyu de dag gi phyir rigs phun sum tshogs pa nyid las snying rje nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that compassion arises from the perfection of the spiritual gene for these reasons, it is said:

original: rang gi rigs la brten cing @25b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi rigs la brten cing @25b zhes bya ba la /
translated: Based on one's own spiritual gene,

original: 'dir rigs dang ldan pa las snying stobs kyi khyad par du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir rigs dang ldan pa las snying stobs kyi khyad par du 'gyur la /
translated: Here, the difference in courage is due to the difference in the spiritual gene.

original: snying stobs kyi khyad par nyid las ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba nyid du 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: snying stobs kyi khyad par nyid las ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba nyid du 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: And the difference in courage itself should be understood as the difference in natural virtue.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam grangs nyid rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam grangs nyid rten zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “basis” is a synonym for “object.”

original: de la gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa'i sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni snying rje chung ngu nyid do //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa'i sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni snying rje chung ngu nyid do //
translated: In this regard, there is a lesser compassion toward the lesser suffering that is present in the life-stream of another.

original: de nyid bdag gi rgyud la bab pa la ni 'bring po'o //
analyzed: de nyid bdag gi rgyud la bab pa la ni 'bring po'o //
translated: There is a middling compassion toward the middling suffering that is present in one’s own life-stream.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bab par gyur pa chen po la ni chen po'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bab par gyur pa chen po la ni chen po'o //
translated: There is a great compassion toward the great suffering that is present in the life-streams of both oneself and others.

original: rnam par gzhag pa gnyis pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skyes pa la ni chung ngu'o //🔽bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa la ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa gnyis pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skyes pa la ni chung ngu'o // bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bab pa la ni 'bring ngo //
translated: Following the second formulation, there is a lesser compassion toward those who are born in a world that is full of suffering.🔽There is a middling compassion toward those who are born in a world that is full of suffering and who are also present in one’s own life-stream.

original: de dag nyid chen po la ni chen po'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid chen po la ni chen po'o //
translated: There is a great compassion toward those who are born in a world that is full of suffering and who are also present in the life-streams of both oneself and others.

original: goms pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni goms pa med par ro //
analyzed: goms pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni goms pa med par ro //
translated: And also without cultivation means without cultivation.

original: rgyu rnam pa bzhis de ltar snying rje skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa bzhis de ltar snying rje skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that compassion arises in this way through four causes.

original: goms pa'i sbyor bas ni thams cad du chen po nyid du gyur ro //
analyzed: goms pa'i sbyor bas ni thams cad du chen po nyid du gyur ro //
translated: Through the application of cultivation, it becomes great in all respects.

original: snying rje'i dbang gis sdug bsngal la 'jigs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gis sdug bsngal la 'jigs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Through the power of compassion, one is not afraid of suffering,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: but not otherwise. In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: sems can rnams la snying rje yang dag par sngon du btang nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje yang dag par sngon du btang nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having fully taken up compassion for sentient beings...

original: mi 'jags shing mi skrag na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'jags shing mi skrag na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one is not frightened and does not tremble...

original: mi 'jigs zhes bya ba ni mya ngan med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs zhes bya ba ni mya ngan med pa'o //
translated: Not frightened means not having sorrow.

original: mi skrag pa ni 'gyod cing gdung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi skrag pa ni 'gyod cing gdung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Not trembling means not having regret and remorse.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gang zag rnam pa bzhi la bya ba rnam pa bzhi sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gang zag rnam pa bzhi la bya ba rnam pa bzhi sgrub par byed do //
translated: One who has generated compassion in his continuum accomplishes four activities for four types of persons who are suffering.

original: de la shin tu dman pa ni dga' ba skye bar byed do //
analyzed: de la shin tu dman pa ni dga' ba skye bar byed do //
translated: Among them, one who is very lowly generates joy.

original: de la khyad par du 'phags pa ni mya ngan skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la khyad par du 'phags pa ni mya ngan skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The superior one is the arising of grief.

original: de bas kyang khyad par du 'phags pa ni gdung ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas kyang khyad par du 'phags pa ni gdung ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The even more superior one is the arising of distress.

original: de bas kyang shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa ni snying rje skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas kyang shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa ni snying rje skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The even more superior one is the arising of compassion.

original: de'i phyir bstod pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstod pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the Praise in One Hundred and Fifty Verses, it is said:

original: dman pa gzhan gyis sdug bsngal mthong na dga' 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: dman pa gzhan gyis sdug bsngal mthong na dga' 'gyur zhing //
translated: The inferior one rejoices when seeing the suffering of others.

original: 'bring po rnams ni rmongs pas mya ngan skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bring po rnams ni rmongs pas mya ngan skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The middling one, due to delusion, gives rise to grief.

original: rab 'og rnams ni gdung ba skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rab 'og rnams ni gdung ba skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The superior one gives rise to distress.

original: sems can mchog khyod snying rje brnyes par gyur //
analyzed: sems can mchog khyod snying rje brnyes par gyur //
translated: You, O supreme being, have attained compassion.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: sdug bsngal gyis mi 'jigs pa'i rgyu bzhi mdor rnam par gzhag pa ni lus kyi stobs dang / sems kyi stobs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //🔽de @26a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis mi 'jigs pa'i rgyu bzhi mdor rnam par gzhag pa ni lus kyi stobs dang / sems kyi stobs kyi dbang du byas pa'o // de @26a * //
translated: The four reasons for fearlessness in the face of suffering are presented in brief in terms of the power of the body and the power of the mind.

original: la rgyu dang bcas pa'i lus kyi stobs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: la rgyu dang bcas pa'i lus kyi stobs bstan pa ni /
translated: Therein, the teaching on the power of the body with its causes is as follows:

original: snying stobs che zhing brtan pa dang ldan pas stobs dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying stobs che zhing brtan pa dang ldan pas stobs dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is powerful because he is courageous and steadfast.

original: snying stobs che ba dang / dpa' ba dang / rtul phod pa dang / sems stobs can zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: snying stobs che ba dang / dpa' ba dang / rtul phod pa dang / sems stobs can zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Courage, heroism, valor, and fortitude are synonyms.

original: kha cig ni brtson 'grus kyi khyad par la snying stobs zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni brtson 'grus kyi khyad par la snying stobs zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that courage is a special kind of effort.

original: yang de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is of two kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: defiled and undefiled.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi sbyor ba ni g-yul dor dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi sbyor ba ni g-yul dor dpa' ba'o //
translated: The defiled kind is the courage of one who engages in battle.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sbyor ba ni sbyin pa la dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sbyor ba ni sbyin pa la dpa' ba'o //
translated: The undefiled kind is the courage of one who engages in generosity.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / sems can nyid la sbyin zhing de dang g-yul sprad pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems can nyid la sbyin zhing de dang g-yul sprad pa //
translated: He gives to sentient beings and engages in battle with them.

original: snying stobs lhag par gyur pas bya dang bya min shes //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: snying stobs lhag par gyur pas bya dang bya min shes // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He is courageous and knows what should and should not be done.

original: brtan pa ni dang dal ba ste /
analyzed: brtan pa ni dang dal ba ste /
translated: Steadfastness is firmness.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par ro //
translated: It is a special quality of the great elements.

original: gzhan dag ni shes rab kyi khyad par du 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni shes rab kyi khyad par du 'dod do //
translated: The others are considered to be varieties of wisdom.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: de'i dbye ba ni tha dad du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ni tha dad du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are explained as being different varieties of the power of wisdom.

original: gang la 'di dag gnyis ka yod pa de la nges par rang bzhin gyis lus kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya par stobs dang ldan pa yin te zhes smras so //
analyzed: gang la 'di dag gnyis ka yod pa de la nges par rang bzhin gyis lus kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya par stobs dang ldan pa yin te zhes smras so //
translated: One who possesses both of these is said to be endowed with the power of nature.

original: yid kyi stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yid kyi stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The power of mind is threefold:

original: shes rab kyi stobs dang / lhag par mos pa'i stobs dang / snying rje'i stobs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs dang / lhag par mos pa'i stobs dang / snying rje'i stobs so //
translated: the power of wisdom, the power of superior attitude, and the power of compassion.

original: stobs dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the first power,

original: yang dag par sems pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag par sems pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la /
translated: he says, “They are of a nature to reflect thoroughly.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i skyon dang yon tan yongs su rtog pa la nges par sems pa'i dang tshul can no //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i skyon dang yon tan yongs su rtog pa la nges par sems pa'i dang tshul can no //
translated: ” They are of a nature to reflect thoroughly on the faults and virtues of the past and future.

original: 'di ltar brtags nas kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtags nas kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Having investigated in this way, they are not frightened by the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: gzhan gyi bud med la ni zhugs pa dang // rgan por gyur kyang ba lang ri dags lug / gyur tshe don med sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med la ni zhugs pa dang // rgan por gyur kyang ba lang ri dags lug / gyur tshe don med sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong //
translated: He has entered into the wives of others, and even when he has become an old man, he has experienced various meaningless sufferings, having become a bull, a deer, a ram.

original: zhes bstan pas 'khor ba dpag tu med pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rigs nyams su myong bar gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pas 'khor ba dpag tu med pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rigs nyams su myong bar gyur te /
translated: Thus, he has experienced the sufferings of the various kinds of samsara.

original: dgos pa med pa'i bya ba ma yin pa'i las byas ba'i rgyus de ltar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i bya ba ma yin pa'i las byas ba'i rgyus de ltar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he has done so through the cause of having done actions that are not without purpose.

original: de ni gzhan la phan pa'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin pas dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur pa yang bsngags par 'os pa yin no zhes nges par sems par byed do //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la phan pa'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin pas dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur pa yang bsngags par 'os pa yin no zhes nges par sems par byed do //
translated: Since he has entered into the practice for the sake of benefiting others, he has experienced the sufferings of the hells, which are worthy of praise.

original: don 'di nyid /
analyzed: don 'di nyid /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: srid gsum dag la phan brtson blo mnga' @26b ngan 'gro'i gnas na'ang bsngags par 'os //
analyzed: srid gsum dag la phan brtson blo mnga' @26b ngan 'gro'i gnas na'ang bsngags par 'os //
translated: He has a mind that strives to benefit the three worlds, and is worthy of praise even when dwelling in the lower realms.

original: zhes bya ba'i bstod pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bstod pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in accordance with the praise.

original: de ltar nges par bsams nas sems can rnams phyin ci log tu grub cing sdug bsngal ster bar byed kyang sems cad 'di dag ni rang dbang med pa /
analyzed: de ltar nges par bsams nas sems can rnams phyin ci log tu grub cing sdug bsngal ster bar byed kyang sems cad 'di dag ni rang dbang med pa /
translated: Having reflected in this way, one should ascertain that although sentient beings are established in error and cause suffering, these sentient beings are without control.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba /
translated: They are impelled by the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pas 'di lta bu'i bya ba ma yin pa byed kyis /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdon gyis zin pas 'di lta bu'i bya ba ma yin pa byed kyis /
translated: Seized by the demon of the afflictions, they do what should not be done.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag nyon mongs pa'i gdon las thar bar bya'o zhes nges par brtag pa yang /🔽ji ltar dman pa gdon gyis zin la gdon rnams bsal bar bgyi slad du //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag nyon mongs pa'i gdon las thar bar bya'o zhes nges par brtag pa yang / ji ltar dman pa gdon gyis zin la gdon rnams bsal bar bgyi slad du //
translated: Therefore, one should ascertain that “I will liberate these from the demon of the afflictions.”

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in accordance with the verse:🔽Just as one would remove a demon from a weak person,🔽in order to remove the demon.

original: de ltar nges par brtag pa ni dka' ba spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar nges par brtag pa ni dka' ba spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Having ascertained this, one will not be afraid of the suffering of difficult activity.

original: mir gyur pa nyid las 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang ldan nas las de lta bu byas shing goms pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mir gyur pa nyid las 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang ldan nas las de lta bu byas shing goms pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having become a human being, and having the will, the effort, the thought, and the discernment, one becomes a Buddha by gradually performing and cultivating that action.

original: bdag gis kyang goms par ma byas pa 'ba' zhig gis dka' ba'i spyod par snang bar zad pas /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang goms par ma byas pa 'ba' zhig gis dka' ba'i spyod par snang bar zad pas /
translated: It is only because I have not cultivated it that the practice seems difficult.🔽Therefore, I will gradually cultivate it and accomplish it.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis kyang rim gyis goms par byas la bsgrub po zhes nges par sems pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis kyang rim gyis goms par byas la bsgrub po zhes nges par sems pa ni /
translated: This is the certainty of thought.🔽And having attained it, the world is harmed.

original: gang zhig thob par gyur na'ang 'jig rten 'di la gnod pa skye 'gyur dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'di ltar nges par brtag par bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig thob par gyur na'ang 'jig rten 'di la gnod pa skye 'gyur dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'di ltar nges par brtag par bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Following this verse, it should be understood that this certainty should be investigated in this way.

original: sngar bstan pa'i bstan pa dang bcas pa'i nges par sems pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i shes rab ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i bstan pa dang bcas pa'i nges par sems pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i shes rab ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs zhes brjod do //
translated: The wisdom that has the certainty of thought as described above is called the power of discernment.

original: rigs kyi khyad par dang / bshes gnyen gyi khyad par gyis byang chub chen po 'dod pa dang / mos pa dang / bzod pa la nye bar gyur pa de ni bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis bkri bar mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par dang / bshes gnyen gyi khyad par gyis byang chub chen po 'dod pa dang / mos pa dang / bzod pa la nye bar gyur pa de ni bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis bkri bar mi nus pa yin no //
translated: By the difference in lineage and by the difference in spiritual benefactors, one who is intent on great enlightenment, who has faith in it and is patient with it, cannot be led astray by demons and adversaries.

original: des na byang chub chen po la mos pa'i stobs can ni sdug bsngal gyis mi 'jigs so //
analyzed: des na byang chub chen po la mos pa'i stobs can ni sdug bsngal gyis mi 'jigs so //
translated: Therefore, one who has the power of faith in great enlightenment has no fear of suffering.

original: bdag nyid bde ba 'dod pa dang gzhan don byed pa zung du 'jug pa yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: bdag nyid bde ba 'dod pa dang gzhan don byed pa zung du 'jug pa yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: There is no union of one’s own desire for happiness and the performance of benefit for others.

original: zhes bya bas sems can rnams la snying rje chen po dang ldan pas sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad snying rje 'phel ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya bas sems can rnams la snying rje chen po dang ldan pas sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad snying rje 'phel ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus, because of great compassion for sentient beings, whatever suffering there is, all of it becomes a cause for the increase of compassion.

original: 'di gas pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di gas pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a cause for its destruction.

original: 'di lta bu'i rgyu @27a * //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rgyu @27a * //
translated: Such is the cause.

original: yang ; 'jig rten phongs pa'i gnas skabs gyur na bdag nyid gtong bar bgyid //
analyzed: yang ; 'jig rten phongs pa'i gnas skabs gyur na bdag nyid gtong bar bgyid //
translated: And also: When the world is in a state of poverty, I will give myself.

original: ces bya ba'i bstod pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bstod pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood according to the praise.

original: rgyu dang po gnyis ni stobs brtan par gyur pa'i stobs gnyis las so //
analyzed: rgyu dang po gnyis ni stobs brtan par gyur pa'i stobs gnyis las so //
translated: The first two causes are from the two powers of firm strength.

original: de bzhin du stobs rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par gzhag pa dang / mdor bsdus nas rnam par gzhag pa ni stobs bzhi bsdus na stobs gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du stobs rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par gzhag pa dang / mdor bsdus nas rnam par gzhag pa ni stobs bzhi bsdus na stobs gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, the nature of the powers is established, and when summarized, the four powers are included in two powers:

original: bdag gi stobs dang / gzhan gyi stobs so //
analyzed: bdag gi stobs dang / gzhan gyi stobs so //
translated: one's own power and the power of others.

original: de la bdag gi stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la bdag gi stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Among them, one's own power is threefold:

original: skye ba gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pa'i sa bon gyis stobs bskyed pa dang ldan pa nyid dang / skye ba gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba goms par byas pa dang ldan pa nyid dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pa'i sa bon gyis stobs bskyed pa dang ldan pa nyid dang / skye ba gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba goms par byas pa dang ldan pa nyid dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: Possessing the power generated by the seed that has come from one birth to another, possessing the practice of the roots of virtue in another birth, and possessing the virtuous dharmas of the present life.

original: rang gi mthus zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi mthus zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By one's own strength means:

original: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nus pas rang dbang du 'dod pa dang / bzod pa dang / mos pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //🔽rang nyid kyi khyad par gyis byang chub chen por mos par 'gyur ba ni bdag gi stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nus pas rang dbang du 'dod pa dang / bzod pa dang / mos pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so // rang nyid kyi khyad par gyis byang chub chen por mos par 'gyur ba ni bdag gi stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of oneself is the wish, the acceptance, and the aspiration that are considered to be autonomous due to the potential that is included in one's own mental continuum.🔽The power of others is that which is generated through the power of others.

original: gzhan gyi mthus bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan la brten nas bskyed pa ste /🔽dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mthus nges par bstan par byas pa las byung ba'i 'dod pa dang / bzod pa dang / mos pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mthus bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan la brten nas bskyed pa ste / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mthus nges par bstan par byas pa las byung ba'i 'dod pa dang / bzod pa dang / mos pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The power of others is that which is generated through the power of others.🔽The power of others is that which is generated through the power of others.🔽The power of others is that which is generated through the power of others.🔽The power of others is that which is generated through the power of others.🔽The power of others is that which is generated through the power of others.

original: sngon byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ji skad bstan pa'i rgyu'i byed pa dang / sngon goms pa'i dbang gis sam /🔽da ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba tsam mam /
analyzed: sngon byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ji skad bstan pa'i rgyu'i byed pa dang / sngon goms pa'i dbang gis sam / da ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba tsam mam /

original: de dag gi yon tan thos pa tsam gyis myur du sems skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dag gi yon tan thos pa tsam gyis myur du sems skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: The power of others is that which is generated through the power of others.🔽The power of others is that which is

original: khyad par can gyi dam bcas pa'i chos thos pa'am /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi dam bcas pa'i chos thos pa'am /
translated: What need is there to speak of hearing the Dharma of the special commitments,

original: mthu mthong bas lta ci smos te /
analyzed: mthu mthong bas lta ci smos te /
translated: or of seeing the power?

original: de lta bas na sngon gyi dus su theg pa chen po la rab tu zhugs pa dang / dge ba la goms pa ni rgyu'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sngon gyi dus su theg pa chen po la rab tu zhugs pa dang / dge ba la goms pa ni rgyu'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the power of cause is the prior engagement in the Great Vehicle and the cultivation of virtue.

original: da ltar gyi tshe 'di nyid la dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod mnyan pa dang / bsams pa la sogs pa dus yun ring du goms par byas pas dge ba'i chos la goms pa ni sbyor ba'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi tshe 'di nyid la dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod mnyan pa dang / bsams pa la sogs pa dus yun ring du goms par byas pas dge ba'i chos la goms pa ni sbyor ba'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of application is the cultivation of virtue through the service of spiritual friends in this very life, through listening to the Bodhisattva Canon, and through the cultivation of reflection, etc., for a long time.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa'i dbye ba'i rgyu bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa'i dbye ba'i rgyu bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the causes of the classification of the generation of the will,🔽he teaches the four conditions, in order to include the classification of the certain and uncertain deliverance taught above.

original: sngar bstan @27b pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i dbye ba bsdus pa'i phyir rkyen bzhi po las 'ga' zhig gis sam /
analyzed: sngar bstan @27b pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i dbye ba bsdus pa'i phyir rkyen bzhi po las 'ga' zhig gis sam /
translated: It is by one or another of the four conditions,

original: tshogs pas kyang rung ba'am /
analyzed: tshogs pas kyang rung ba'am /
translated: or by the collection of all of them.

original: rgyu bzhi las 'ga' zhig gis sam /
analyzed: rgyu bzhi las 'ga' zhig gis sam /
translated: It is by one or another of the four causes,

original: tshogs pa la brten nas nang gi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs 'di gnyis tshogs pa'am /
analyzed: tshogs pa la brten nas nang gi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs 'di gnyis tshogs pa'am /
translated: The internal power is based on the assembly, and the causal power is based on the assembly or individually.

original: so so las sems de skyed na ni brtan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: so so las sems de skyed na ni brtan par 'gyur te /
translated: If one generates that thought, it becomes stable.🔽Because it is unshakable by bad friends, as stated in the verse:

original: nyon mongs chu bo 'khrug dang ngan 'gro'i kha dag rtag tu gdangs pa dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas mi dge ba'i grogs pos mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs chu bo 'khrug dang ngan 'gro'i kha dag rtag tu gdangs pa dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas mi dge ba'i grogs pos mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The river of afflictions, the gaping mouth of the lower realms, is always open.

original: snying por gyur pa ni snying rje dman par gyur pas ldog pa med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying por gyur pa ni snying rje dman par gyur pas ldog pa med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It becomes the essence because it is irreversible due to the weakness of compassion.

original: mi g-yo bar gyur pa ni sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs shing g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo bar gyur pa ni sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs shing g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It becomes unshakable because it is not frightened or shaken by suffering.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis mi ldog pas na brtan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis mi ldog pas na brtan pa'o //
translated: Another enumeration: It is stable because it is not turned back by the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: sems can gnod pa byed pas ldog par mi 'gyur bas na snying por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gnod pa byed pas ldog par mi 'gyur bas na snying por gyur pa'o //
translated: It becomes the essence because it is not turned back by sentient beings who do harm.

original: dka' ba spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mi ldog pas na mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mi ldog pas na mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes unshakable because it is not turned back by the suffering of difficult conduct.

original: 'di dag las gzhan pa'i stobs las bskyed pa ni brtan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag las gzhan pa'i stobs las bskyed pa ni brtan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The generation of the Thought by other than these powers is not firm.

original: de ltar rgyu dang / rkyen gyi stobs kyis sems bskyed pa'i dbye bas nges par 'byung ba dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang / rkyen gyi stobs kyis sems bskyed pa'i dbye bas nges par 'byung ba dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the escape and non-escape by way of the classification of the generation of the Thought by the power of cause and condition,

original: da ni ldog pa dang / mi ldog pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ldog pa dang / mi ldog pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the cause of turning back and not turning back,🔽he says, “The cause of turning back of the Thought is fourfold.

original: sems ldog pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba'o //🔽de la mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni theg pa chen po la mos pa 'dor du 'jug cing /
analyzed: sems ldog pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba'o // de la mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni theg pa chen po la mos pa 'dor du 'jug cing /
translated: The causes of turning away from the mind are fourfold.🔽Therein, the nonvirtuous spiritual friend causes one to abandon the aspiration for the universal vehicle.🔽

original: theg pa gzhan la smon pa byed du 'dzud pa'am /
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la smon pa byed du 'dzud pa'am /
translated: Therein, the non-virtuous spiritual friend causes one to abandon the aspiration for the Great Vehicle and to take up the aspiration for another vehicle,

original: thar pa'i lam la sbyor bar byed pa 'dor bar byed cing brtson pa 'dor bar sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: thar pa'i lam la sbyor bar byed pa 'dor bar byed cing brtson pa 'dor bar sbyor ba ste /
translated: or causes one to abandon the application to the path of liberation and to take up the application to the abandonment of striving.

original: de ltar na de'i sems ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i sems ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the Thought turns back.

original: snying rje chung bas sems can la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje chung bas sems can la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of small compassion, one becomes indifferent to sentient beings.

original: de ltar na sems can gyi don gtso bor byas nas byang chub la dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na sems can gyi don gtso bor byas nas byang chub la dmigs pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if one focuses on enlightenment with the aim of benefiting sentient beings,

original: sems can rnams la ltos pa med pas byang chub las sems ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la ltos pa med pas byang chub las sems ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: one turns away from enlightenment because one is not concerned with sentient beings.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rigs bzhi'i 'jigs pa mthong nas drag cing gdung ba'i yid la byed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rigs bzhi'i 'jigs pa mthong nas drag cing gdung ba'i yid la byed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One sees the fear of the four types of suffering of conditioned existence and one generates the mental activity of intense and fervent sorrow.

original: des na myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod cing /
analyzed: des na myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod cing /
translated: Thus, one wishes to attain complete nirvana quickly.

original: sems bskyed pa de ldog par 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu gsum po @28a * //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de ldog par 'gyur ro // rgyu gsum po @28a * //
translated: One turns away from generating the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'di dag gis ldog pa ni gtan ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ldog pa ni gtan ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: One turns away from these three causes, but not permanently.

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa ni gtan ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa ni gtan ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: One turns away permanently from the absence of the perfect spiritual gene.

original: sems skye ba'i rgyu las bzlog pa las ldog pa'i rgyur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems skye ba'i rgyu las bzlog pa las ldog pa'i rgyur rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the cause of turning away from the generation of the thought of enlightenment is the opposite of the cause of its generation.

original: dkar po'i phyogs dang / nag po'i phyogs kyi dbye ba dang / tshang ba dang / ma tshang ba'i dbye bas kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs dang / nag po'i phyogs kyi dbye ba dang / tshang ba dang / ma tshang ba'i dbye bas kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the cause of turning away is the opposite of the cause of generation, according to the distinctions of the bright side and the dark side and according to the distinctions of completeness and incompleteness.

original: dkar po'i phyogs dang tshang ba ni 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs dang tshang ba ni 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The bright side and completeness are the causes of engagement.

original: nag po'i phyogs dang / ma tshang ba ni ldog pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs dang / ma tshang ba ni ldog pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The dark side and incompleteness are the causes of disengagement.

original: de'i phyir sems ldog par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bzhi po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems ldog par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bzhi po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The four causes of the reversal of mind, etc.”

original: de ltar re zhig byang chub kyi sems la rmongs pa rnams la rang gi mtshan nyid dang / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbye ba dang / 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i dbye bas byang chub kyi sems rnam pa lnga bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig byang chub kyi sems la rmongs pa rnams la rang gi mtshan nyid dang / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbye ba dang / 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i dbye bas byang chub kyi sems rnam pa lnga bstan nas /
translated: Thus, for those who are confused about the thought of enlightenment, the thought of enlightenment is taught in five aspects: the character of its own-nature, the character of its special qualities, the character of its divisions, the division of its causes and conditions, and the division of its engagement and disengagement.

original: yang rigs ma nges pa theg pa gzhan la zhugs pa rnams byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon thos nas de dag la mos pa bor nas 'dir 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dang / rigs ma nges pa sangs rgyas nyid la zhugs pha mi brtan pa rnams nges par gzung ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: yang rigs ma nges pa theg pa gzhan la zhugs pa rnams byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon thos nas de dag la mos pa bor nas 'dir 'jug par bya ba'i phyir dang / rigs ma nges pa sangs rgyas nyid la zhugs pha mi brtan pa rnams nges par gzung ba'i phyir dang /
translated: to cause those of unfixed potential who have entered the path to buddhahood to be firmly held and

original: rigs nges pa bag med pa dang / zhum pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams go rims bzhin du byang chub kyi sems la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs nges pa bag med pa dang / zhum pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams go rims bzhin du byang chub kyi sems la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: to cause those of fixed potential who are careless, those who are discouraged and those who are correctly engaged to be respectively encouraged to give rise to bodhichitta, to be uplifted and to be delighted.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is in order to teach the marvelous and wonderful Dharma of bodhichitta.

original: 'di gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa brtan pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i nang gi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs kyis phyir mi ldog cing nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa brtan pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i nang gi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs kyis phyir mi ldog cing nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: These two are the bodhisattvas who have generated the firm thought of enlightenment. The meaning of irreversible and certain emergence is by the power of the inner and the power of the cause as taught.

original: 'jig rten dang thun mong ma yin pa ni da ltar gyi dus la nyi bar ltos nas gzhan dag la thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang thun mong ma yin pa ni da ltar gyi dus la nyi bar ltos nas gzhan dag la thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Uncommon to the world means that in the present time, it does not exist for others in any way.

original: ngo mtshar ni 'das pa'i dus na yang ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar ni 'das pa'i dus na yang ma byung ba'o //
translated: Marvelous means it did not occur in the past.🔽Wondrous means it will not occur in the future.

original: rmad du byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang mi 'byung ba'o zhes byas nas ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rim pa rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang mi 'byung ba'o zhes byas nas ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rim pa rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the stages of marvelous and wondrous qualities should be understood in this way.
