original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa yongs su bzung ba @28b rnams mtha' yod pa dang / yongs su chad pa yod pa yin la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nam mkha'i khams kya mthas gtugs pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad chud ma'i tshul du yongs su 'dzin pa ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa yongs su bzung ba @28b rnams mtha' yod pa dang / yongs su chad pa yod pa yin la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nam mkha'i khams kya mthas gtugs pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad chud ma'i tshul du yongs su 'dzin pa ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so //
translated: For worldly people, those who are taken as wives and sons and so on are limited and finite. But for the bodhisattvas, it is an amazing and marvelous thing that they take as wives all the realms of sentient beings, which are infinite like the realm of space.

original: sems can thams cad chung ma'i tshul du 'dzin na yang des nyon mongs pa yang mi skye ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad chung ma'i tshul du 'dzin na yang des nyon mongs pa yang mi skye ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Even though they take all sentient beings as wives, no defilement arises for them. This is the second.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of being without defilement, they have perfect intention and perfect application.

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams nye bar sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams nye bar sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They have perfect intention and application, and they accumulate virtuous qualities.

original: de'i phyir de'i dge ba'i chos rnams skye zhing 'phel bar 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dge ba'i chos rnams skye zhing 'phel bar 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, his virtuous qualities are born and increase, and so he has a special cause and effect.

original: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu khyad par can dang ldan pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dang yang dag par ldan pas mthong ba'i chos dang / 'jig rten gzhan du byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon 'di dag thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu khyad par can dang ldan pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dang yang dag par ldan pas mthong ba'i chos dang / 'jig rten gzhan du byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon 'di dag thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who has a special cause and effect, who is endowed with the accumulation of merit, obtains these qualities and benefits of generating the Thought of Enlightenment in this life and in other worlds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems de bskyed ma thag tu sems can thams cad kyi gcig tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems de bskyed ma thag tu sems can thams cad kyi gcig tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'gyur te /
translated: As soon as the Bodhisattva generates that Thought, he becomes a spiritual friend who is completely virtuous for all sentient beings.

original: mi phan pa las zlog par byed cing phan pa la sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phan pa las zlog par byed cing phan pa la sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he turns them away from what is not beneficial and joins them to what is beneficial.

original: de'i phyir sems can gyi khams thams cad chung ma'i tshul du gzung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gyi khams thams cad chung ma'i tshul du gzung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, he takes hold of the whole realm of sentient beings as his wife.

original: de'i phyir bstod pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstod pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the Praise in One Hundred and Fifty Verses, it says:

original: khyod ni ma bcol legs mdzad pa //
analyzed: khyod ni ma bcol legs mdzad pa //
translated: You are a good worker without being asked.

original: khyod ni rgyu med bzhin du byams //🔽khyod ni ma 'dris mdza' bshes te //
analyzed: khyod ni rgyu med bzhin du byams // khyod ni ma 'dris mdza' bshes te //
translated: You are loving without any reason.🔽You are a friend without any acquaintance.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i gnyen 'dun lags //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i gnyen 'dun lags //
translated: You are a relative without any connection.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no ;🔽/ chung mar 'dzin pa ni 'byor pa dang rgud pa'i tsho phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa la mthun pa dang mi mthun pa ste /🔽bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no ; / chung mar 'dzin pa ni 'byor pa dang rgud pa'i tsho phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa la mthun pa dang mi mthun pa ste / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.

original: dga' ba dang mi dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don te /🔽yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can la phan pa dang gnod pa las sems can gyi ngor de ltar 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mi dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don te / yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can la phan pa dang gnod pa las sems can gyi ngor de ltar 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi ngor 'dod chags dang / brtse ba dang nges par 'dzin pas bu dang bu mo la sogs pa la brtse ba ni nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi ngor 'dod chags dang / brtse ba dang nges par 'dzin pas bu dang bu mo la sogs pa la brtse ba ni nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.

original: 'gal ba byed pa'i sems can la kho ba la sogs pas sems can la @29a * //
analyzed: 'gal ba byed pa'i sems can la kho ba la sogs pas sems can la @29a * //
translated: The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.🔽The verse shows that.

original: brdeg pa dang / gsod pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la med do //
analyzed: brdeg pa dang / gsod pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la med do //
translated: The bodhisattva has no afflictions such as beating and killing.

original: sems can gcig tsam la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar gyur na yang rang gi don yang bya bar mi nus na /
analyzed: sems can gcig tsam la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar gyur na yang rang gi don yang bya bar mi nus na /
translated: If one cannot accomplish even one’s own aim when one is attached to or averse to even one sentient being,

original: sems can thams cad la de dag gis nyon mongs pa can du gyur na gzhan gyi don bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la de dag gis nyon mongs pa can du gyur na gzhan gyi don bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to mention accomplishing the aims of others when one is afflicted with regard to all sentient beings?

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i sbyor bas byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang ldan pas sems can la snying brtse ba 'phel bar byed cing snying rje dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa med kyang gzhan gyi ngor byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i sbyor bas byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang ldan pas sems can la snying brtse ba 'phel bar byed cing snying rje dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa med kyang gzhan gyi ngor byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva, who is compassionate and has no afflictions, increases his love for sentient beings through the practice of concordant and discordant actions. The compassionate one, though free of afflictions, acts in accordance with the views of others.🔽Therefore, the praise says,

original: de'i phyir / ye shes nyi ma'i me 'bar yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ye shes nyi ma'i me 'bar yang //
translated: Though the sun of wisdom blazes,

original: gang gi sred pa 'phel 'gyur mtshar //🔽zhes bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi sred pa 'phel 'gyur mtshar //🔽zhes bstod pa yin no //
translated: it is amazing that craving increases.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi mthun pa ni sems can log par spyod pa rnams la thabs gzhan med pas dus de srid du rgyab kyis phyogs par byed do//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi mthun pa ni sems can log par spyod pa rnams la thabs gzhan med pas dus de srid du rgyab kyis phyogs par byed do//
translated: The opposite of the absence of defilement is turning one's back on sentient beings for that long, because there is no other means to deal with those who behave wrongly.

original: des na bdag ni byis pa'i skye bo thos dang mthong mi 'dod //
analyzed: des na bdag ni byis pa'i skye bo thos dang mthong mi 'dod //
translated: Therefore, the verse says, I do not want to see or hear the childish.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in accordance with the verse.🔽The verse says, The engagement with good intention is also a marvelous wonder.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa bzang pos 'jug pa yang ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'o zhes bya bas 'jig rten thams cad phyogs gsum gyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa bzang pos 'jug pa yang ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'o zhes bya bas 'jig rten thams cad phyogs gsum gyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the entire world engages in three ways:

original: bshes gnyen gyi phyogs dang / dgra'i phyogs dang / tha ma la pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bshes gnyen gyi phyogs dang / dgra'i phyogs dang / tha ma la pa'i phyogs so //
translated: the side of the spiritual teacher, the side of the enemy, and the side of the ordinary person.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa'i ni sems can thams cad bshes gnyen gyi phyogs kyis yang dag par bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa'i ni sems can thams cad bshes gnyen gyi phyogs kyis yang dag par bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva includes all sentient beings in the side of the spiritual teacher.

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / bde ba bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the superior intention to bring benefit and the superior intention to bring happiness engage with respect to all sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir / 'gro bas 'gro la gnod dang phan pa yis //🔽phyogs gnyis dag la spyod dang ldan pa lags /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'gro bas 'gro la gnod dang phan pa yis // phyogs gnyis dag la spyod dang ldan pa lags /
translated: Therefore, he enters into the superior intention to bring benefit and the superior intention to bring happiness to all sentient beings.🔽Therefore, he is praised:

original: skye bo ma lus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i //
analyzed: skye bo ma lus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i //
translated: He engages in the two sides of benefiting and harming sentient beings.

original: phyogs gcig po la snying rje'i bdag nyid zhugs //
analyzed: phyogs gcig po la snying rje'i bdag nyid zhugs //
translated: He engages in the one side of benefiting all sentient beings.

original: zhes bstod pa yin no //🔽yang sems can thams cad la /
analyzed: zhes bstod pa yin no // yang sems can thams cad la /
translated: He is the embodiment of compassion.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas zhugs pa de yang ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba ste /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas zhugs pa de yang ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba ste /
translated: Moreover, the one who enters with the superior intention to bring benefit and happiness to all sentient beings is also a wonder and marvel.

original: ma dang pha dang bu gcig pa shin tu gces pa la yang de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dang pha dang bu gcig pa shin tu gces pa la yang de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because even a mother, father, or a very dear only child does not have such an intention.

original: de'i phyir na /🔽'di ltar khyod ni 'jig rten phan phyir 'jig rten la //
analyzed: de'i phyir na / 'di ltar khyod ni 'jig rten phan phyir 'jig rten la //
translated: Therefore, he is praised:🔽Thus, you have entered for a long time with an impartial mind

original: mnyam @29b pa'i sems kyis dus ring zhugs pa ltar //
analyzed: mnyam @29b pa'i sems kyis dus ring zhugs pa ltar //
translated: to benefit the world and

original: rang las skyes pa'i bu la pha yi sems kyis kyang //
analyzed: rang las skyes pa'i bu la pha yi sems kyis kyang //
translated: Even a father, with his thoughts of love for his son born of himself,

original: skad cig tsam yang mnyam par 'jog mi nus //
analyzed: skad cig tsam yang mnyam par 'jog mi nus //
translated: cannot remain in meditative equipoise even for a moment.

original: zhes bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstod pa yin no //
translated: This is the praise.

original: mi dge ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa'i gnas dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / mthar mi 'dod pa'i rnam smin ster ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa'i gnas dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i gnas dang / mthar mi 'dod pa'i rnam smin ster ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The abode of nonvirtue means the abode of misdeeds, the abode of what is reprehensible, the abode of giving undesirable results in the end.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa ni dge ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa ni dge ba'i gnas te /
translated: The side that is the antidote to that is the abode of virtue.

original: de la rab tu dgod pa ni yang dag par sgrub cing /
analyzed: de la rab tu dgod pa ni yang dag par sgrub cing /
translated: To establish them in that is to accomplish them correctly.

original: de la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is to apply them to that.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams la 'jig rten pha rol tu phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni phan par bya ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams la 'jig rten pha rol tu phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni phan par bya ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the superior intention to benefit sentient beings in the next world is called the intention to help.

original: phongs pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mkho ba dang bral bas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phongs pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mkho ba dang bral bas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Destitute means suffering from the lack of what is needed.

original: mgon med pa zhes bya ba ni snyid rje'i yul du gyur pa nye bar mkho ba bsgrub par mi nus pa /
analyzed: mgon med pa zhes bya ba ni snyid rje'i yul du gyur pa nye bar mkho ba bsgrub par mi nus pa /
translated: The helpless are those who are objects of compassion, who are unable to accomplish their own needs.

original: sdug bsngal bsal bar rang gis mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsal bar rang gis mi nus pa'o //
translated: They are unable to remove their own suffering.

original: rten med pa ni 'dod pa'i rten gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: rten med pa ni 'dod pa'i rten gzhan med pa'o //
translated: Those without a protector are those who have no other protector for their desires.

original: phan pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phan pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The things that are helpful are also of two kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi bde bas sdud par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bde bas sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi bde bas sdud par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bde bas sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: those that attract through contaminated happiness and those that attract through uncontaminated happiness.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi bde bas bsdus pa ni kun du rmongs pa dang / bag med pas dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing mi dge ba'i chos rnams la 'jug cing 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi bde bas bsdus pa ni kun du rmongs pa dang / bag med pas dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing mi dge ba'i chos rnams la 'jug cing 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, those that attract through contaminated happiness cause one to degenerate from virtuous qualities through delusion and carelessness, and cause nonvirtuous qualities to increase.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bde bas bsdus pa ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams spangs nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bde bas bsdus pa ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams spangs nas /
translated: Those that attract through uncontaminated happiness cause one to abandon nonvirtuous qualities,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams yang dag par blangs nas 'phel bar byed pa'o ;
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams yang dag par blangs nas 'phel bar byed pa'o ;
translated: and to increase virtuous qualities.

original: / de'i phyir /
analyzed: / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: nyon mongs pa can spangs te phan pa'i dngos po bsgrub par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can spangs te phan pa'i dngos po bsgrub par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the desire to accomplish what is beneficial after having abandoned what is defiled.

original: nyin gcig bzhin du yang dag par spel ba'o zhes bya ba ni nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa de nyid bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du yang dag par spel ba'o zhes bya ba ni nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa de nyid bsten par bya'o //
translated: It is the proper development of that very intention to benefit and bring happiness, which is to be cultivated in three periods of the day and night.

original: bsgom par bya'o //🔽mang du bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o // mang du bya'o //
translated: It is to be cultivated.🔽It is to be practiced.🔽It is to be increased.

original: rnam par 'phel bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'phel bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be made extensive.

original: bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu ni yang dag par spel ba zhes bya'o //🔽sems can thams cad la byams pa yid la byed pa mang bas ni phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //🔽snying rje yid la byed pa mang bas ni bde ba'i lhag pa'i @30a * //
analyzed: bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu ni yang dag par spel ba zhes bya'o // sems can thams cad la byams pa yid la byed pa mang bas ni phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro // snying rje yid la byed pa mang bas ni bde ba'i lhag pa'i @30a * //
translated: This is called the proper development.🔽The superior intention to bring benefit increases through the frequent practice of attention to loving kindness for all beings.

original: bsam pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The superior intention to bring happiness increases through the frequent practice of attention to compassion.

original: chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa ni yang dag par chos la rtog par byed pa dang / chos la so sor rtog pas rab tu dben pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa ni yang dag par chos la rtog par byed pa dang / chos la so sor rtog pas rab tu dben pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Acceptance of the Dharma is the application that ripens the qualities of a Buddha, which are isolated by the discernment of the Dharma and the thorough examination of the Dharma.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu 'jug pa yang sbyor ba zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu 'jug pa yang sbyor ba zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: The application of generosity and morality is called the application of the perfections.

original: bzod pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams rjes su sdud pa yang lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams rjes su sdud pa yang lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of the superior intention is the attraction of sentient beings by means of the four social practices and patience.

original: de'i phyir phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa'i sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is the application of accomplishing benefit and happiness.

original: bsod nams rgya chen po 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pas chos chen po 'du ba'i sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams rgya chen po 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pas chos chen po 'du ba'i sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the door of entry to the great Dharma because it is the cause of the arising of great merit.

original: de ltar sems bskyed nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i las byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsdo ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i las byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsdo ba ni /
translated: Having generated the Thought in this way, and having performed the deeds endowed with the perfections of giving, etc., with body, speech, and mind, he dedicates them to the supreme enlightenment.

original: rang gi don gyi sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the application to one's own aim.

original: de nyid ni byang chub chen po yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni byang chub chen po yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: And that very [application] becomes the cause for the accomplishment of great enlightenment.

original: sdar bstan pa'i sgrub pa'i sbyor ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i las de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
analyzed: sdar bstan pa'i sgrub pa'i sbyor ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i las de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
translated: And those deeds endowed with the application of the perfections, which are the application to the accomplishment of the teaching, he makes common to all sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad kyis de'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis de'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su sngo bar byed do //
translated: and he dedicates them to the attainment of their fruit by all sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the application to the aim of others.

original: sngar bstan pa'i phan pa dang bde bas bsdus pa'i sbyor ba yang sems can rnams 'jug cing rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i phan pa dang bde bas bsdus pa'i sbyor ba yang sems can rnams 'jug cing rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir zhes byas nas so //
translated: The two practices of benefit and happiness as explained above are for the sake of engaging and liberating sentient beings.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / sdug bsngal thams cad bsal ba'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sdug bsngal thams cad bsal ba'i phyir // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: in order to remove all suffering.

original: sbyor ba 'di gnyis ni dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs chen po gnyis zhes kyang brjod de /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di gnyis ni dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs chen po gnyis zhes kyang brjod de /
translated: These two practices are also called the two great heaps of virtuous qualities,

original: bsod nams kyi phung po mi zad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi phung po mi zad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the inexhaustible heap of merit.

original: dge ba'i chos kyi phung po zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyi phung po zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: They are also called the heap of virtuous qualities,

original: bsod nams kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the essence of the heap of merit.

original: de nyid ni dpag tu med pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi phung po nye bar sogs pa la dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung nas rgyu khyad par du 'phags pa dang / 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ni dpag tu med pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi phung po nye bar sogs pa la dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung nas rgyu khyad par du 'phags pa dang / 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the first generation of the mind of enlightenment, from the beginning, is the cause of the special qualities and the special result of the bodhisattva, which is the accumulation of immeasurable virtuous qualities, the verse states:

original: de las gzhan nyan thos la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi dge ba yongs @30b su 'dzin pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: de las gzhan nyan thos la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi dge ba yongs @30b su 'dzin pa la ltos nas /
translated: Moreover, in comparison with the virtue of the disciples and so on,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsod nams bsags pa ni bla na med pa yang dad par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsod nams bsags pa ni bla na med pa yang dad par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur zhing /
translated: the accumulation of merit is superior, because it becomes the cause of the supreme enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: dge ba yongs su 'dzin pa gzhan ni ma yin pa 'di ni rgyu'i khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba yongs su 'dzin pa gzhan ni ma yin pa 'di ni rgyu'i khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The other virtues are not like that. This is the superiority of the cause.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa ni 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa ni 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: Its result is the supreme enlightenment of the Buddhas, and not anything else. This is the superiority of the result.

original: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i chos gang yongs su 'dzin pa de ni rgyu nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid kyis rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i chos gang yongs su 'dzin pa de ni rgyu nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid kyis rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the virtue which the bodhisattva who has generated the thought of enlightenment appropriates is superior by way of cause and result.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad kyi dge ba yongs su 'dzin pa la yang thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad kyi dge ba yongs su 'dzin pa la yang thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yin no //
translated: And they do not exist at all for the śrāvakas, etc.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa ni 'jig rten thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa ni 'jig rten thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
translated: The generation of the Thought endowed with such virtues is the one that is completely beyond all worlds.

original: phan yon dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan yon dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that together with its benefits,

original: sems bskyed ma thag nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: sems bskyed ma thag nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: it is said, “From the very first moment of generating the Thought, etc.”

original: sems can thams cad kyi yon gnas su gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis mchod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang / bla mar gyur pa dang / slob dpon dang / mkhan po dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yon gnas su gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis mchod pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir dang / bla mar gyur pa dang / slob dpon dang / mkhan po dang /
translated: “Having become a field of merit for all sentient beings” is because of being worshipped by all worlds, because of being superior to all worlds, because of being a guru, a master, a preceptor,

original: pha mar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha mar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because of being considered a father and mother.

original: de'i phyir ; gang tshe dang po byang chub tu //
analyzed: de'i phyir ; gang tshe dang po byang chub tu //
translated: Therefore,

original: khyod kyis thugs ni bskyed gyur pa //
analyzed: khyod kyis thugs ni bskyed gyur pa //
translated: when you first generated the Thought🔽of enlightenment,

original: de nas bzung nas khyod nyid ni //
analyzed: de nas bzung nas khyod nyid ni //
translated: from then on you yourself

original: 'jig rten mchod gnas gong mar gnas //
analyzed: 'jig rten mchod gnas gong mar gnas //
translated: He is the highest object of worship in the world.

original: zhes bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstod pa yin no //
translated: This is the praise.

original: yon gnas dang bla mar gyur pa'i phyir de nyid 'gro ba'i bsod nams kyi zhing yin pas de la phan pa'i bya ba byas nas 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags shing /
analyzed: yon gnas dang bla mar gyur pa'i phyir de nyid 'gro ba'i bsod nams kyi zhing yin pas de la phan pa'i bya ba byas nas 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags shing /
translated: Because he is the object of worship and the guru, he is the field of merit for the world. Therefore, when one performs beneficial actions toward him, one obtains a special result.

original: 'dod par bya ba'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / myur zhing dge ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / myur zhing dge ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One obtains a desirable result quickly and virtuously.

original: lta bu'i bsod nams dang yang dag par ldan pa'i tshe 'di dang gzhan la bdag nyid la gnod pa med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lta bu'i bsod nams dang yang dag par ldan pa'i tshe 'di dang gzhan la bdag nyid la gnod pa med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: When one is endowed with such merit, one’s own welfare in this life and the next is not harmed.

original: gnod pa med pa'i bsod nams des bskyed pa'i bdag gi dngos pos gzhan gyi gnod pa rab tu zhi bar byed nus par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bsod nams des bskyed pa'i bdag gi dngos pos gzhan gyi gnod pa rab tu zhi bar byed nus par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: And by the merit that is not harmful, one is able to pacify the harm of others by the power of one’s own person.

original: gnod pa med pa'i bsod nams ni gang dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bsod nams ni gang dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The merit that is not harmful is that of the bodhisattva. Its arrangement is fivefold.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba dang ldan pas gzhan gyis gnod par mi nus pa yin @31a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba dang ldan pas gzhan gyis gnod par mi nus pa yin @31a * //
translated: Since he is endowed with happiness in this life, others are unable to harm him.

original: te ; 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ltar rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsrung bas bsrungs pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' de'i bdag gi dngos po ni sangs rgyas kyi ljon shing gi myu gu'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ltar rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsrung bas bsrungs pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' de'i bdag gi dngos po ni sangs rgyas kyi ljon shing gi myu gu'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is protected by a very special protection, like a universal monarch, and because the entity of that bodhisattva is the basis of the sprout of the tree of awakening.

original: de'i phyir / lha dang / mi dang / klu dang ; gnod sbyin la sogs pa thams cad kyis gnod pa med pa'i sbyor bas bsrung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /🔽gnas skabs thams cad du gnod pa bya bar mi nus pa yin no zhes bya bar gnyid log gam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir / lha dang / mi dang / klu dang ; gnod sbyin la sogs pa thams cad kyis gnod pa med pa'i sbyor bas bsrung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir / gnas skabs thams cad du gnod pa bya bar mi nus pa yin no zhes bya bar gnyid log gam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therefore, since he is protected by all gods, humans, nagas, yakshas, and so on, who are unable to harm him,🔽he is unable to be harmed in any situation.

original: brtse bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: brtse bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: This is stated from “he sleeps” up to “he is unable to be harmed.”

original: skye ba gzhan la yang phyi ma'i tshe yang bdag gi dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ba ni yang tshe brjes pa'i 'og tu ste tshe phyi ma la yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par nus pa'i bdag gi dngos po rab🔽tu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan la yang phyi ma'i tshe yang bdag gi dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ba ni yang tshe brjes pa'i 'og tu ste tshe phyi ma la yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par nus pa'i bdag gi dngos po rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: that is, in the future, after he has changed lives, he attains a body that is capable of benefiting himself and others.

original: lus kyis chos ston pa yang byang chub sems dpa' gang la gzhan yang dag par dgod par 'dod pa de la bdag nyid yang dag par zhugs nas rtag tu gus pa dang bcas pas sbyor bar byed pa na /
analyzed: lus kyis chos ston pa yang byang chub sems dpa' gang la gzhan yang dag par dgod par 'dod pa de la bdag nyid yang dag par zhugs nas rtag tu gus pa dang bcas pas sbyor bar byed pa na /
translated: He also teaches the Dharma with his body. When a bodhisattva wishes to establish others in something, he himself practices it with constant respect.

original: gzhan de'i rjes su slob par 'dod pa rnams kyang de bzhin du slob par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan de'i rjes su slob par 'dod pa rnams kyang de bzhin du slob par byed de /
translated: Those who wish to follow him train accordingly.

original: de lta bu ni de'i lus kyis chos ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni de'i lus kyis chos ston pa yin no //
translated: This is how he teaches the Dharma with his body.

original: rten khyad par can thob par gyur pa las kyang sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skye ba de nyid la shin tu sbyangs pa'i rten 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rten khyad par can thob par gyur pa las kyang sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skye ba de nyid la shin tu sbyangs pa'i rten 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva who has generated the Thought and has obtained a special support has obtained a support of pliancy in that very birth.

original: gnas ngan len gyi rten ni ma yin pas gnas ngan len shin tu chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rten ni ma yin pas gnas ngan len shin tu chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not a support of the negative reflex actions, the negative reflex actions are very slight.

original: ngag gi khyad par thob par gyur pa las kyang gzhan gyis ma grub pa'i sngags la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba ni bsod nams khyad par can gyis yongs su gzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag gi khyad par thob par gyur pa las kyang gzhan gyis ma grub pa'i sngags la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba ni bsod nams khyad par can gyis yongs su gzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Also, from obtaining a special voice, one obtains the accomplishment of the mantra, etc., which is not accomplished by others, because it is held by the special merit.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par thob par gyur pa las kyang yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par thob par gyur pa las kyang yin te /
translated: Also, from obtaining a special thought,

original: bzod pa dang / des pa rab tu thob pa'i phyir dang / khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dang / des pa rab tu thob pa'i phyir dang / khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has obtained patience and gentleness, and because one is free from the secondary defilements of anger, etc.

original: bzod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the characteristics of patience,

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: he says, “patience with regard to harm done by others.”

original: gang dang lhan cig gnas pa de dag gis gnod pa byas par gyur na yang /
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig gnas pa de dag gis gnod pa byas par gyur na yang /
translated: Even when they are harmed by those with whom they live,

original: de dag gis gnod pa byas pa de dag bzod cing 'gyur bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis gnod pa byas pa de dag bzod cing 'gyur bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: they do not retaliate for the harm they have received.

original: des pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i @31b phyir gzhan la yang gnod pa mi byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i @31b phyir gzhan la yang gnod pa mi byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: To show the characteristics of the patient one, the verse states,

original: gzhan gnod pa byed dam ste /
analyzed: gzhan gnod pa byed dam ste /
translated: He does not harm others.

original: nye bar 'tshe bar byed cing khro zhing 'khrug na yang bdag nyid thams cad du mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe bar byed cing khro zhing 'khrug na yang bdag nyid thams cad du mi byed pa ste /
translated: Even when others harm him, injure him, or get angry with him, he does not retaliate in any way.

original: de ltar na nges pa mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na nges pa mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he becomes very patient.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan dag la gnong pa byed pa mthong ngam thos na yang snying rje khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir /🔽shin tu mi dga' bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan dag la gnong pa byed pa mthong ngam thos na yang snying rje khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir / shin tu mi dga' bar 'gyur na /
translated: When he sees or hears that others are harming others, he feels great compassion for them.

original: ji ltar na gzhan la de gnod pa byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhan la de gnod pa byed par 'gyur /
translated: How could he possibly harm others?

original: sems can rnams la rjes su brtse ba mang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams la rjes su brtse ba mang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he has great love for sentient beings,

original: khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the secondary defilements such as anger do not increase.

original: res 'ga' skyes par gyur na yang myur du bcom zhing nyam dmad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' skyes par gyur na yang myur du bcom zhing nyam dmad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And even when they do arise, they are quickly destroyed and do not persist.

original: nyam dmad pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyam dmad pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate their weakness,🔽he says:

original: myur du 'bral bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽brgya la spyod par gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dus thams cad du mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: myur du 'bral bar 'gyur ba'o // brgya la spyod par gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dus thams cad du mi spyod pa'o //
translated: they are quickly abandoned.

original: skyes par gyur na yang myur du 'bral bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skyes par gyur na yang myur du 'bral bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even when they do occur, they are quickly abandoned.

original: rgyun 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o ;
analyzed: rgyun 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o ;
translated: They do not persist.

original: / chung ba'i rnam pas skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: / chung ba'i rnam pas skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: They arise in a weak form,

original: chen pos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chen pos ni ma yin no //
translated: not in a strong form.

original: de ltar na skye ba dman pa nyid dang / gnas pa dman pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dman pa nyid kyis nyam chung ba nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na skye ba dman pa nyid dang / gnas pa dman pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dman pa nyid kyis nyam chung ba nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, they arise as weak due to the weakness of their origination, due to the weakness of their persistence, and due to the weakness of their intrinsic nature.

original: ngan song du skyes pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa lnga ni sngar rigs kyi rtags su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ngan song du skyes pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa lnga ni sngar rigs kyi rtags su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The five special kinds of rebirth in the lower realms should be understood as the five signs of the family explained above.

original: sems bskyed pa'i le'u'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i le'u'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the chapter on the generation of the spirit of enlightenment, the third chapter of the Bodhisattvabhumi.🔽What is the bodhisattva practice of the bodhisattvas who have generated the spirit of enlightenment?

original: // / de ltar sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni mdor bstan pa'i chos bcu po de dag las chos dang po bzhi'i chos ji lta ba bzhin rnam par phye ba'i rigs
analyzed: // / de ltar sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni mdor bstan pa'i chos bcu po de dag las chos dang po bzhi'i chos ji lta ba bzhin rnam par phye ba'i rigs
translated: The commentary on this is as follows: From among the ten topics indicated above, the first four topics are the nature of the bodhisattva, the generation of the spirit of enlightenment, the practice of the bodhisattva, and the result of the practice.

original: dang / sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba zhes bya ba de dag las gnyis bshad nas /
analyzed: dang / sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba zhes bya ba de dag las gnyis bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the first two,

original: sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang zhe na zhes dris pa'o ;
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang zhe na zhes dris pa'o ;
translated: the text asks, What is the bodhisattva practice of the bodhisattvas who have generated the spirit of enlightenment?

original: / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva practice is the bodhisattva training.🔽And that should be understood as threefold.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: gang la slob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang la slob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “where one trains,” and so on.

original: 'di dag gis ni bslab pa'i gnas dang bslab pa'i gzhi dang / bslab pa'i tshig la @32a * //🔽slob par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni bslab pa'i gnas dang bslab pa'i gzhi dang / bslab pa'i tshig la @32a * // slob par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, he teaches the basis of training, the foundation of training, and the words of training.

original: ji ltar slob pa dang zhes bya bas ni bslab pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar slob pa dang zhes bya bas ni bslab pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su gsal bar byed do //
translated: “How one trains” clarifies the nature of the training.

original: gang dag slob pa zhes bya bas ni bslab pa'i rten gang yin pa de la bslab pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag slob pa zhes bya bas ni bslab pa'i rten gang yin pa de la bslab pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Those who train” indicates that the basis of training is called “training.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gnas thams cad bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gnas thams cad bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that all the bases of the bodhisattva training are included in the seven bases of training, he says,

original: gnas bdun la slob ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas bdun la slob ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One trains in seven bases.”

original: go 'phang dang / gzhi dang / tshig ces bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: go 'phang dang / gzhi dang / tshig ces bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: The terms stage, basis, and word are synonyms.

original: ji ltar slob ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar slob ce na /
translated: How does one train?

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: By means of the unobscured skillful means, one trains in the actions of body, speech, and mind, as will be explained.

original: gang dag slob ce na /
analyzed: gang dag slob ce na /
translated: Who trains?

original: ngo tsha dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' slob par 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' slob par 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with a sense of shame trains, as will be explained.

original: gnas de dag ni don zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas de dag ni don zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that those bases are also called the meaning,

original: don gyi sgo nas nges par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas nges par bstan pa ni /
translated: the definitive teaching from the perspective of the meaning is stated:

original: rtog par 'os pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rtog par 'os pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of worthy of conception is

original: ji ltar 'os par thob par bya ba mngon du thob par byas pa dang / shes par bya ba mngon du shes pa nye bar bzung nas thob par gyur pa dang / shes par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'os par thob par bya ba mngon du thob par byas pa dang / shes par bya ba mngon du shes pa nye bar bzung nas thob par gyur pa dang / shes par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that which is to be attained as appropriate, having actualized what is to be attained, and having taken up what is to be known, having actualized the knowledge, is the meaning of that which has been attained and known.

original: don rnam pa bdun gyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: don rnam pa bdun gyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The order of the seven topics is established as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang por byang chub nyid la dmigs nas rang gi don la slob pa'i phyir dang / sems can la dmigs nas ni gzhan gyi don la slob par byed do zhes bya bas dang por rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi gnas bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang por byang chub nyid la dmigs nas rang gi don la slob pa'i phyir dang / sems can la dmigs nas ni gzhan gyi don la slob par byed do zhes bya bas dang por rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi gnas bstan to //
translated: The bodhisattva first focuses on enlightenment itself in order to train in one's own aim and focuses on sentient beings in order to train in the aim of others. Thus the first topic is the presentation of one's own and others' aims.

original: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyis slob par byed kyi /
analyzed: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyis slob par byed kyi /
translated: One trains in one's own and others' aims by being free of defilement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pas ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not train in them while being defiled.

original: nyon mongs pa chen por spyod pas bdag la phan pa bya ba'ang nus ma yin zhes bstod pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chen por spyod pas bdag la phan pa bya ba'ang nus ma yin zhes bstod pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The words of praise state that one who engages in great defilement is not even able to benefit oneself.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas ni de kho na nyid kyi don la slob nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas ni de kho na nyid kyi don la slob nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one who is free of defilement is able to train in the meaning of thatness,

original: de'i 'og tu de kho na'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de kho na'i gnas bstan to //
translated: the topic of thatness is presented immediately after the topic of training.

original: de bzhin du rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi don la slob par byed pa na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs kyis slob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi don la slob par byed pa na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs kyis slob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, when training in one's own aim and in the aim of others, one trains by means of the method of non-affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa yang nus pa med pa ni slob pa ma yin pas mthu'i gnas bstan te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa yang nus pa med pa ni slob pa ma yin pas mthu'i gnas bstan te /
translated: And since one who is not afflicted is not powerless, the basis of power is taught.

original: de bzhin du mi ngal @32b ba'i thabs kyis slob par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi ngal @32b ba'i thabs kyis slob par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: Likewise, one trains by means of the method of non-fatigue.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing mthu dang ldan par theg pa gsum la ci rigs par sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la slob pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing mthu dang ldan par theg pa gsum la ci rigs par sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la slob pa'o //
translated: Thus, one trains in ripening sentient beings in the three vehicles, being neither afflicted nor powerless.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: One ripens one's own qualities of a Buddha.

original: de dag gnyi ga yongs su smin par gyur pa na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la slob po zhes bya bas de'i rjes la rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gnas bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga yongs su smin par gyur pa na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la slob po zhes bya bas de'i rjes la rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gnas bstan te /
translated: And when both are ripened, one trains in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. Thus, the basis of perfect enlightenment is taught immediately after that.

original: 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thog ma dang bar dang / tha ma'i slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa yongs su gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thog ma dang bar dang / tha ma'i slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa yongs su gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: These passages clearly show the bodhisattvas’ training in the beginning, middle, and end to be complete.

original: de la rang dang gzhan gyi don gyis dbye na rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rang dang gzhan gyi don gyis dbye na rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that it is divided into ten aspects in terms of benefit for oneself and others,🔽it is said:

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as being of ten kinds.

original: rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is divided into ten.

original: don bcu rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyud du gtogs pa ni gnyis so //🔽rdzas kyi dbye ba ni gnyis so //
analyzed: don bcu rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyud du gtogs pa ni gnyis so // rdzas kyi dbye ba ni gnyis so //
translated: The ten topics are as follows: The two that are included in the continuum,🔽the two that are substantial entities,

original: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba ni gnyis so //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba ni gnyis so //
translated: the two that are states,

original: skye ba'i dbye ba ni gnyis so //
analyzed: skye ba'i dbye ba ni gnyis so //
translated: the two that are births,

original: 'chi 'pho ba'i dbye ba ni gnyis so //🔽de la 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i dbye ba ni gnyis so // de la 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres par gyur pa ste /
translated: and the two that are deaths and transitions.🔽Here, “alone” means unmixed.

original: gzhan dang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not mixed with others.

original: gzhan gyi don dang yang ma 'brel la rang gi don dang yang ma 'brel pa ni 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don dang yang ma 'brel la rang gi don dang yang ma 'brel pa ni 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The “solitary” is neither related to the benefit of others nor to one’s own benefit.

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa ni gzhan dang rab tu 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa ni gzhan dang rab tu 'brel pa ste /
translated: The “related” is related to others.

original: 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is mixed.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: gzhan gyi don dang 'brel pa'i rang gi don dang / rang gi don dang 'brel pa'i gzhan gyi don to //🔽phyi nas rang dang gzhan gyi don de dag gi bde ba'i rnam par smin pa nyid ni phan pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don dang 'brel pa'i rang gi don dang / rang gi don dang 'brel pa'i gzhan gyi don to // phyi nas rang dang gzhan gyi don de dag gi bde ba'i rnam par smin pa nyid ni phan pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: the benefit of others related to one’s own benefit, and one’s own benefit related to the benefit of others.🔽The cause of benefit is the ripening of happiness in both of these, one’s own and others’, benefits, in this life and in future lives.

original: mthong ba'i chos nyid la rjes su sdud par byed pa'i phyir ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la rjes su sdud par byed pa'i phyir ni bde ba'o //
translated: The cause of pleasure is the attraction of others through one’s own benefit in this life.

original: rtsom pa'i dus na ni rgyus bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa'i dus na ni rgyus bsdus pa'o //
translated: The cause of undertaking is the cause of one’s own benefit at the time of the practice.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i dus na ni 'bras bus bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i dus na ni 'bras bus bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: The cause of completion is the result of one’s own benefit at the time of completion.

original: tshe 'di nyid la thob pa ni tshe 'di pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la thob pa ni tshe 'di pa'o //
translated: The cause of attainment in this life is one’s own benefit in this life.

original: gzhan dag tu thob pa ni tshe rabs gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu thob pa ni tshe rabs gzhan pa'o //
translated: The cause of attainment in other lives is one’s own benefit in other lives.

original: don dag mi nyams pa ni gtan du ba'o //
analyzed: don dag mi nyams pa ni gtan du ba'o //
translated: The non-perishing is the permanent.

original: nyams par 'gyur ba ni gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba ni gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The perishing is the impermanent.

original: de la yongs su shes par byas la spang bar bya'o zhes pa ni so sor brtags shing nges par yang dag par brtags @33a * //
analyzed: de la yongs su shes par byas la spang bar bya'o zhes pa ni so sor brtags shing nges par yang dag par brtags @33a * //
translated: Of these, that which is to be understood and abandoned is that which is to be relinquished and rejected after being examined and ascertained.

original: nas yongs su btang zhing yongs su spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nas yongs su btang zhing yongs su spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is to be understood and not abandoned is that which is to be understood and not rejected.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gcig bu'i don ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gcig bu'i don ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The benefit of others is not to be abandoned by the bodhisattva,

original: gnyi ga'i don gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i don gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the benefit of both is primary.🔽That which is only one's own benefit is to be understood and abandoned by the bodhisattva,

original: rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba las shin tu 'das shing 'tsham pa ma yin pas yongs su shes par byas la spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba las shin tu 'das shing 'tsham pa ma yin pas yongs su shes par byas la spang bar bya'o //
translated: because it is far removed from the activity of the bodhisattva and is not suitable.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can la phan pa bskyed par bya'i /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can la phan pa bskyed par bya'i /
translated: The bodhisattva should generate benefit for sentient beings,

original: bdag la phan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: not benefit for himself,

original: mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i sman bzhin no //
analyzed: mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i sman bzhin no //
translated: like a powerful medicine.

original: de lta bas na gzhan gyi bya ba gang yin pa de nyid bdag gi bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan gyi bya ba gang yin pa de nyid bdag gi bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, whatever is the activity of others is also the activity of the bodhisattva.

original: gzhan gyi don gang yin pa de nyid bdag gi don yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gang yin pa de nyid bdag gi don yin no //
translated: Whatever is the aim of others is also the aim of the bodhisattva.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid can nyid 'gro la phan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid can nyid 'gro la phan pa'i phyir //
translated: the compassionate one, for the sake of helping beings,

original: srid par skye ba len yang srid la chags ma yin //
analyzed: srid par skye ba len yang srid la chags ma yin //
translated: takes birth in cyclic existence, but is not attached to existence.🔽Like the appearance of medicines

original: nad kun sel bar byed pa'i mthu ldan pa'i //🔽'gro la phan pa'i sman rnams 'byung ba bzhin ;
analyzed: nad kun sel bar byed pa'i mthu ldan pa'i // 'gro la phan pa'i sman rnams 'byung ba bzhin ;
translated: that have the power to cure all diseases🔽for the benefit of beings,

original: / zhes bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: / zhes bstod pa yin no //
translated: so is the appearance of the compassionate one.

original: de'i phyir rang gi don 'ba' zhig ni byang chub sems dpa'i don las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi don 'ba' zhig ni byang chub sems dpa'i don las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aim of only oneself is completely beyond the aim of the bodhisattva.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de spang bar bya zhing mi bslab po //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' de spang bar bya zhing mi bslab po //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should abandon that and not train in it.

original: 'tsham pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽byang chub thob pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'tsham pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni / byang chub thob pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not appropriate means🔽because there is no quality of attaining enlightenment,

original: byang chub thob pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub thob pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is incompatible with attaining enlightenment.

original: gang gzhan byang chub kyi tshogs la 'jog par mi nus pa'i gzhan gyi don de yang spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gzhan byang chub kyi tshogs la 'jog par mi nus pa'i gzhan gyi don de yang spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The benefit of others that cannot be established in the other's accumulation of enlightenment is also to be abandoned,

original: de la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not necessary for that.

original: rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa rnam par gzhag pa ni longs spyod tshol zhing yongs su spyod pa dang / chos tshol zhing nges par 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa rnam par gzhag pa ni longs spyod tshol zhing yongs su spyod pa dang / chos tshol zhing nges par 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi sbyor ba dang /
translated: The establishment of one's own benefit is to be known as the pursuit and enjoyment of wealth, the pursuit and retention of the Dharma, the application of morality, effort, meditation, and wisdom,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bla ma la mchod pa dang / 'tsho ba log pa la sbyor ba dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la zang zing la spyod pa dang / khyim pa'i phyogs la gzhan gyi byed pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bla ma la mchod pa dang / 'tsho ba log pa la sbyor ba dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la zang zing la spyod pa dang / khyim pa'i phyogs la gzhan gyi byed pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: the worship of the guru who is completely emancipated, the application to wrong livelihood, the enjoyment of material things in the faction of the ordained, and the dependence on the activity of others in the faction of the laity.

original: longs spyod la chags pa dang / 'jig tshogs la chags pas bdag nyid lus tshim par bya ba'i phyir longs spyod tshol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod la chags pa dang / 'jig tshogs la chags pas bdag nyid lus tshim par bya ba'i phyir longs spyod tshol bar byed pa ste /
translated: One seeks enjoyments in order to satisfy oneself with enjoyments, through attachment to enjoyments and through attachment to the perishable aggregates.

original: de longs spyod tshol ba de yang rang gi @33b don 'ba' zhig pa nyid de /
analyzed: de longs spyod tshol ba de yang rang gi @33b don 'ba' zhig pa nyid de /
translated: That seeking of enjoyments is only for one's own benefit,

original: bde ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu 'ba' zhig gis bsdus pa tshe 'di pa dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu 'ba' zhig gis bsdus pa tshe 'di pa dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: and is included only in the cause of happiness, in this life, and is not eternal.

original: de bzhin du yongs su btsal ba la longs spyod pa'i dus na yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yongs su btsal ba la longs spyod pa'i dus na yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Similarly, when one enjoys what has been sought, it is the same.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi longs spyod tshol ba ni khyim bdag rin po che lta bu yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi longs spyod tshol ba ni khyim bdag rin po che lta bu yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas' seeking of enjoyments is like the precious householder,

original: gzhan gyi dgos pa gtsor byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dgos pa gtsor byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the chief requirement for others.

original: longs spyod pa ni bu la nu zho ldud pa'i ma bzhin no //
analyzed: longs spyod pa ni bu la nu zho ldud pa'i ma bzhin no //
translated: Enjoyment is like a mother giving milk to her child.

original: de lta bu'i chos la thal zhing 'das pas rang gi don nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos la thal zhing 'das pas rang gi don nyid yin no //
translated: Since one transgresses and goes beyond such a teaching, it is for one's own benefit.

original: bdag nyid la yod pa'i mang du thos pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan bcos su gtogs pa rnams bdag las gzhan la yod par ma gyur cig ces bsams nas ston par mi byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid la yod pa'i mang du thos pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan bcos su gtogs pa rnams bdag las gzhan la yod par ma gyur cig ces bsams nas ston par mi byed /
translated: One should not teach the excellence of one's own learning and the excellence of one's own wisdom which is included in the treatises, thinking, May this not exist in others but only in me!

original: 'chad par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'chad par mi byed de /
translated: One should not teach, thinking, May this not exist in others!

original: de'i bsam pas kyang chos btsal zhing gzung nas 'di dang gzhan du dang gtan du ma yin pa ni rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bsam pas kyang chos btsal zhing gzung nas 'di dang gzhan du dang gtan du ma yin pa ni rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mere benefit for oneself is the search for and retention of the Dharma by such a thought, and it is not for this life, the next life, or permanently.

original: mtho ris 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the sake of desire for heaven means:

original: smon lam ngan pas yongs su gzung ba'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims de phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i sbyor bas bsdus pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gzugs dang gzugs med par skye bar 'dod pa'i bsam gtan dang / de'i don gyi shes rab yang dag par blangs nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam ngan pas yongs su gzung ba'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims de phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i sbyor bas bsdus pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gzugs dang gzugs med par skye bar 'dod pa'i bsam gtan dang / de'i don gyi shes rab yang dag par blangs nas gnas pa'o //
translated: the morality which is held by a bad aspiration, the effort which is included in the application for perfecting that morality, the meditation which is the desire for birth in the form and formless realms, and the wisdom which is the understanding of their meaning.

original: de yang sems can gzhan rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhugs pa ma yin pas zhes bya bas rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sems can gzhan rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhugs pa ma yin pas zhes bya bas rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: It is not undertaken for the sake of caring for other sentient beings, so it is only for one's own aim.

original: phan pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / rgyus bsdus pa dang / 'jig rten gzhan pa dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: phan pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / rgyus bsdus pa dang / 'jig rten gzhan pa dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o ;
translated: It is not beneficial, not in accord with the Dharma, not a collection of causes, not for the sake of another, and not permanent.

original: / gang yang tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin zhing /
analyzed: / gang yang tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, the undertaking of morality is established as the giving of fearlessness.

original: sems can la bsam pa dge ba yin na yang /
analyzed: sems can la bsam pa dge ba yin na yang /
translated: Even though it is a virtuous attitude toward sentient beings,

original: de'i sgo nas gzhan rjes su gzung ba med pa'i phyir rang gi don nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas gzhan rjes su gzung ba med pa'i phyir rang gi don nyid yin no //
translated: it is only for one's own aim because it does not care for others.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'o ;
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'o ;
translated: Worldly material things are gain.

original: /'dod pa'i yon tan ni longs spyod do //
analyzed: /'dod pa'i yon tan ni longs spyod do //
translated: The pleasures of the senses are enjoyments.

original: ro myong ba chung la ste /
analyzed: ro myong ba chung la ste /
translated: It is of little relish.

original: ji skad du mdo sde las /🔽so so'i skye bo gang chags pa'i //
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde las / so so'i skye bo gang chags pa'i //
translated: As a sūtra teaches,🔽The world is frightened by the attachment

original: 'jig rten zang zing 'jigs pa yin //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten zang zing 'jigs pa yin //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: of the person who is an ordinary being.

original: de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa ni gzhan du longs spyod chen po 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa ni gzhan du longs spyod chen po 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The result of that is the desire for great enjoyment in another world.

original: @34a * // 'jig rten gyi zang zing thob pa'i rgyur zhes bya ba ni byas pa shes pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bla ma'i mchod pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: @34a * // 'jig rten gyi zang zing thob pa'i rgyur zhes bya ba ni byas pa shes pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bla ma'i mchod pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: The cause for obtaining worldly goods is the cause for the worship of the guru who is in nirvana.

original: byas pa shes pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: byas pa shes pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa ma yin /
translated: One who knows the benefit does not worship a stupa of the Tathagata

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bla ma mchod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bla ma mchod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: nor does one worship the guru who is in nirvana.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing 'ba' zhig gi rgyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing 'ba' zhig gi rgyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One does it only for the sake of worldly goods.

original: de lta na yang bde ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i bde ba'i rgyus bsdus pa dang / 'jig rten gzhan pa dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa ni rang gi don te //
analyzed: de lta na yang bde ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i bde ba'i rgyus bsdus pa dang / 'jig rten gzhan pa dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa ni rang gi don te //
translated: Even so, the benefit that is consistent with happiness is included in the cause of happiness, and it is one's own aim, not the aim of another, and it is not permanent.

original: de dag la gzhan rjes su gzung ba med pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag la gzhan rjes su gzung ba med pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is only one's own aim, because it does not include the aim of another.

original: rnyed pa 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho ba tshol zhing /
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i 'tsho ba tshol zhing /
translated: “Desire for gain” is the pursuit of a wrong livelihood.

original: rnyed pa'i rgyu dang zhes bya bas dgos pa med pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i rgyu dang zhes bya bas dgos pa med pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Cause of gain” shows the absence of purpose.

original: rnyed pa 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed par nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed par nges pa nyid do //
translated: “Gain” is the certainty of obtaining.

original: don med pa ni bre mo'i gtam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa ni bre mo'i gtam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Meaningless” is included in idle chatter.

original: spro ba bskyed pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid bde bas spro zhing ba spu ldang ba'o //
analyzed: spro ba bskyed pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid bde bas spro zhing ba spu ldang ba'o //
translated: “Excitement” is the delight of the afflicted mental satisfaction, with the hairs of the body standing on end.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan sna tshogs ni sna tshogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i yon tan rjod par byed pa'i kha gsag gi gtam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan sna tshogs ni sna tshogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i yon tan rjod par byed pa'i kha gsag gi gtam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa nyid de /
translated: “Falsely professing various qualities” is the flattery of speech that professes qualities that are not really there.

original: bde ba'i rjes su mthun pa 'di pa tsam dang gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi don to //
analyzed: bde ba'i rjes su mthun pa 'di pa tsam dang gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi don to //
translated: “One’s own aim” is the mere temporary and non-ultimate concordance with happiness.

original: de ltar gzhan dag yang dag par dga' ba skyed par byed kyang gzhan dag khyad par du 'phags pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la 'dzud par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya bas kha gsag 'ba' zhig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag yang dag par dga' ba skyed par byed kyang gzhan dag khyad par du 'phags pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la 'dzud par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya bas kha gsag 'ba' zhig ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, even though one may cause others to generate true joy, one is not causing others to enter into the virtuous side of excellence.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni gzhan gyi don ltar snang ba'i rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni gzhan gyi don ltar snang ba'i rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, these are said to be for one's own sake alone, appearing as if they were for the sake of others.

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir bya bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i bsam pas las dang bya ba byed pa'i dbang du byas pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin pa'o //🔽las kyi ched du rab tu 'byin par byed /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir bya bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i bsam pas las dang bya ba byed pa'i dbang du byas pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin pa'o // las kyi ched du rab tu 'byin par byed /
translated: The phrase one who desires to appropriate the service of others refers to one who acts and causes others to act under the influence of such a desire, not to anyone else.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par byed gnas sbyin par byed kyang yang de ni rigs pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi tshogs sdud par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par byed gnas sbyin par byed kyang yang de ni rigs pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi tshogs sdud par byed pa yin te /
translated: One who gives ordination and the higher ordination for the sake of one's work, and who gives refuge for the sake of one's work, is one who accumulates an illegitimate group of followers.

original: las kyi don du slob ma'ang 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: las kyi don du slob ma'ang 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The phrase one who accepts disciples for the sake of one's work refers to one who accepts disciples for the sake of one's work.

original: de yang bde ba'i rjes su mthun pa yin na yang 'di pa nyid dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa nyid yin pas bdag gi don 'ba' zhig pa nyid yin @34b no ;
analyzed: de yang bde ba'i rjes su mthun pa yin na yang 'di pa nyid dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa nyid yin pas bdag gi don 'ba' zhig pa nyid yin @34b no ;
translated: Moreover, if it is in accordance with happiness, it is still one’s own aim, because it is not permanent.

original: / de lta bur yongs su gzung ba'i tshogs de dag la yang rang la phan pa ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: / de lta bur yongs su gzung ba'i tshogs de dag la yang rang la phan pa ni med pa nyid do //
translated: And even if one were to acquire such a collection, it would not benefit oneself at all.

original: gzhan gyi stobs kyis bran du byas pa'i sems can rnams bdag gi mthus de dag bran las thar bar byas nas bdag nyid kyi bran gyi dngos por byas nas 'khol bar byed na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi stobs kyis bran du byas pa'i sems can rnams bdag gi mthus de dag bran las thar bar byas nas bdag nyid kyi bran gyi dngos por byas nas 'khol bar byed na /
translated: If one were to free sentient beings who are enslaved by others through one’s own power, and then make them one’s own slaves,

original: de yang rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: that would also be one’s own aim.

original: de bzhin du sems can bcing bas bcings pa rnams bdag gi don bsgrub par bya ba'i ched du bcings pa las thar bar byed pa dang / chad pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can bcing bas bcings pa rnams bdag gi don bsgrub par bya ba'i ched du bcings pa las thar bar byed pa dang / chad pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Similarly, if one were to free sentient beings who are bound in prison in order to accomplish one’s own aim, and if one were to free those who are frightened by the threat of punishment, etc.,

original: sogs pa'i sgras 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa rnams rang gi chad pa la sogs pa las bya ba'i phyir thar bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa rnams rang gi chad pa la sogs pa las bya ba'i phyir thar bar byed pa ste /
