translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates that they liberate those who are frightened by the fear of not being able to make a living, so that they can engage in their work and so on.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa ste /
translated: All of these are for one’s own sake alone,

original: de dag la phan pa dang / yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la phan pa dang / yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not benefit others and they do not take care of others.

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don yang ji ltar rigs pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don yang ji ltar rigs pas rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “and so on” should be understood as appropriate.

original: sngar ni skye ba thob pa'i rgyu'i bsam gtan bstan nas /
analyzed: sngar ni skye ba thob pa'i rgyu'i bsam gtan bstan nas /
translated: The above passage explains the meditative development of the meditative absorption that is the cause for attaining rebirth in the celestial realms.

original: de ni gnas pa'i rgyu'i bsam gtan snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba bstan te /
analyzed: de ni gnas pa'i rgyu'i bsam gtan snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba bstan te /
translated: Now, the meditative development of the meditative absorption that is the cause for abiding in those celestial realms is explained.

original: de dag la ni thams cad du sems can gyi don med pas rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni thams cad du sems can gyi don med pas rang gi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: Since there is no benefit for sentient beings in any of these, they are for one’s own sake alone.

original: sems can gzhan dag la sbyin pas nye bar longs spyod pa 'di pas bsdus pa gzhan dag gi don du ji lta ba de lta bur byin pas gnyi ga'i don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag la sbyin pas nye bar longs spyod pa 'di pas bsdus pa gzhan dag gi don du ji lta ba de lta bur byin pas gnyi ga'i don du 'gyur ro //
translated: The benefit for both oneself and others is the giving of gifts to other sentient beings that is included in the latter part of this verse.

original: nus bzhin du gzhan gnod pa byed pa la lan ma byas pas gnyis ka'i don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus bzhin du gzhan gnod pa byed pa la lan ma byas pas gnyis ka'i don du 'gyur ro //
translated: and not retaliating against others who harm you while you are able to do so, you will benefit both yourself and others.

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du longs spyod tshol ba la sogs pa thams cad ji ltar rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du longs spyod tshol ba la sogs pa thams cad ji ltar rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that all the other forms of working for the welfare of others, such as seeking enjoyments for the sake of others, are included in these three forms of working for the welfare of others and are to be practiced as appropriate.

original: gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa ni rnam pa drug tu rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa ni rnam pa drug tu rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that working for the sole welfare of others is presented in six aspects.🔽The first is the application of teaching the Dharma to those who are not ready to receive it, due to their wrong views, such as the view that the gift, giver, and recipient are real.🔽The second is the application of teaching the Dharma to those who are ready to receive it, due to their right views, such as the view that the gift, giver, and recipient are not real.🔽The third is the application of teaching the Dharma to those who are not ready to receive it, due to their wrong views, such as the view that the gift, giver, and recipient are real.

original: lta ba phyin ci log gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la sbyor ba dang / tshul khrims nyams kyang sgrub par byed pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la gzhan la chos bstan ba'i sbyor ba dang / shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba las der gtogs pa'i dge ba'i chos nye bar sgrub pa'i sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la sbyor ba dang / tshul khrims nyams kyang sgrub par byed pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la gzhan la chos bstan ba'i sbyor ba dang / shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba las der gtogs pa'i dge ba'i chos nye bar sgrub pa'i sbyor ba dang /
translated: The fourth is the application of teaching the Dharma to those who are ready to receive it, due to their right views, such as the view that the gift, giver, and recipient are not real.🔽The fifth is the application of establishing those who are not ready to receive the teachings in virtue, such as generosity, in order to make them ready to receive the teachings.🔽The sixth is the application of establishing those who are ready to receive the teachings in virtue, such as generosity, in order to make them ready to receive the teachings.

original: bsam gtan las ldog par nus bzhin du bsam gtan la mngon par dga' ba'i sbyor ba dang / dbang thob par gyur pas sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi @35a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan las ldog par nus bzhin du bsam gtan la mngon par dga' ba'i sbyor ba dang / dbang thob par gyur pas sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi @35a * //
translated: the application of one who, having attained mastery, engages in the aims of sentient beings through various emanations;

original: don la sbyor ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa rdzogs par gyur kyang sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: don la sbyor ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa rdzogs par gyur kyang sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'o //
translated: and the application of one who, even though the deeds of the Tathāgatas are completed, engages in the aims of sentient beings.

original: 'dir 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don gyi gtso bo'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don gyi gtso bo'i tshig go //
translated: Here, the word “only” is a word that indicates the principal meaning.

original: lta ba log par zhugs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni phyi ma phyi mas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: lta ba log par zhugs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni phyi ma phyi mas bshad pa yin te /
translated: The three phrases beginning with “engaging in false views” are explained by the following phrases.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni lta ba log par zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni lta ba log par zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Engaging in false views is the view that denies cause and effect.

original: des de'i gnyen po'i phyogs 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba nyams par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des de'i gnyen po'i phyogs 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba nyams par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it destroys the mundane correct view that is the antidote to that.

original: des sbyin pa btang ba'i 'bras bu 'byung bar ma mthong ba ni 'ong ba ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: des sbyin pa btang ba'i 'bras bu 'byung bar ma mthong ba ni 'ong ba ma mthong ba'o //
translated: Not seeing the result of giving is not seeing the coming.

original: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par byed pa ni 'bras bu ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par byed pa ni 'bras bu ma mthong ba'o //
translated: Determining that there is no result is not seeing the result.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang lta ba log pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang lta ba log pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Another explanation: Wrong view is a word that summarizes.

original: sbyin pa dang de'i 'bras bu la gzhan gyi stobs kyis mngon par yid ches pa'i dad pa med pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang de'i 'bras bu la gzhan gyi stobs kyis mngon par yid ches pa'i dad pa med pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: It is the application of not having faith in giving and its result through the power of others.

original: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rgyas par gyur pas 'ong ba ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rgyas par gyur pas 'ong ba ma mthong ba'o //
translated: Not seeing the coming is due to the expansion of nonfaith, which is the adversary of faith.

original: rang gi stobs kyis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni med do zhes yang dag pa'i lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa logs par lta ba ni 'bras bu ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi stobs kyis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni med do zhes yang dag pa'i lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa logs par lta ba ni 'bras bu ma mthong ba'o //
translated: Not seeing the result is the wrong view that is adverse to right view, thinking, There is no result of giving through one's own power.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan ni skye ba mang po'i 'og tu sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i 'bras bu myong bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu mi 'dod pa ni lta ba log pa'o //
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan ni skye ba mang po'i 'og tu sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i 'bras bu myong bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu mi 'dod pa ni lta ba log pa'o //
translated: Another way of explaining the wrong view is that it is the denial of the result of the meritorious work consisting of giving, which is to be experienced after many births.

original: 'di nas 'chi 'phos ma thag pa'i skye bar nges par myong ba ma yin na skye ba mang pos chod pa'i 'bras bus ci zhig bya zhes zer ba ni 'ong ba ma mthong ba dang / 'bras bu ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nas 'chi 'phos ma thag pa'i skye bar nges par myong ba ma yin na skye ba mang pos chod pa'i 'bras bus ci zhig bya zhes zer ba ni 'ong ba ma mthong ba dang / 'bras bu ma mthong ba'o //
translated: If one does not experience the result immediately after death, what is the use of the result after many births have intervened? This is the wrong view that does not see the future and does not see the result.

original: de lta bu'i lta bas sbyin pa byin pa ni rang gi rgyud la 'bras bu ci yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i lta bas sbyin pa byin pa ni rang gi rgyud la 'bras bu ci yang med pa nyid do //
translated: Giving given with such a view has no result at all in the continuum of the giver.

original: sbyin pa de byin pa ni len pa po dang / rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po nyid yin pas gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa de byin pa ni len pa po dang / rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po nyid yin pas gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa nyid yin no //
translated: But that giving is given as a thing that is suitable for the receiver, and so it is only for the benefit of others.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims las ldog par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims las ldog par gyur pa ste /
translated: The phrase “corrupted morality” means that one turns away from morality.

original: gang tshul khrims ngan par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang tshul khrims ngan par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: one who has bad morality.

original: sgrub pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nan tan byad par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nan tan byad par mi nus pa ste /
translated: Lacking practice means being unable to practice.

original: sgrub pa'i snod du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i snod du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: not being a vessel for practice.

original: yang de dag gzhan ngan par spyod pa las bzlog pa'i phyir gzhan dag la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang de dag gzhan ngan par spyod pa las bzlog pa'i phyir gzhan dag la chos ston par byed do //
translated: Moreover, they teach the Dharma to others in order to turn them away from other bad conduct.

original: des gzhan dag la chos ston pas nyes par spyod @35b pa'i gnas nas bslangs nas legs par spyod pa'i gnas la 'god par byed de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: des gzhan dag la chos ston pas nyes par spyod @35b pa'i gnas nas bslangs nas legs par spyod pa'i gnas la 'god par byed de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: By teaching the Dharma to others, they lift them out of the basis of bad conduct and establish them in the basis of good conduct. This is for the sake of others.

original: mthong ba'i chos 'di nyid la ston par byed pa'i tshe tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na shes rab rgyas par bya ba'i rgyu yang med pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos 'di nyid la ston par byed pa'i tshe tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na shes rab rgyas par bya ba'i rgyu yang med pa ste /
translated: In this very life, when they are teaching, they have pure morality and they do not have the cause for the growth of wisdom in the future.

original: rang gi rgyud nyams par byas pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud nyams par byas pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: They are alone, because they have damaged their own continuum.

original: sa 'og ma las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas dgra bcom pa'am /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba la gnas nas mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba la sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa ste /
analyzed: sa 'og ma las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas dgra bcom pa'am / phyir mi 'ong ba la gnas nas mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba la sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa ste /
translated: The phrase who have transcended the lower stage means that they are either arhats or nonreturners who are free from attachment to the desire realm.🔽They apply themselves to the practice of generosity and so on in terms of the results of karma that will be experienced in this life.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa'i sa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag rjes su gzung ba ni de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa'i sa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag rjes su gzung ba ni de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is solely for the benefit of others, because they have completely transcended the stage of karmic maturation and because they are occupied with caring for others.

original: bsam gtan la dbang thob pa'i sbyor bas bsam gtan bsgyur ba la mkhas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan la dbang thob pa'i sbyor bas bsam gtan bsgyur ba la mkhas par 'gyur te /
translated: Through their application in obtaining mastery of meditative concentration, they become skilled in transforming meditative concentration.

original: las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba la dbang thob pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba la dbang thob pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: This is because they have obtained mastery over karma, affliction and birth.

original: gzhan gyi don du bsam gtan bsgrubs nas de dag tu snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye bas thob par bsgyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du bsam gtan bsgrubs nas de dag tu snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye bas thob par bsgyur te /
translated: Having accomplished meditative concentration for the benefit of others, they transform it into meditative attainment and birth.

original: de las nyams pa yang med bzhin du de'i dbang gis skye ba mi len gyi /
analyzed: de las nyams pa yang med bzhin du de'i dbang gis skye ba mi len gyi /
translated: And even though they do not degenerate, they do not take birth by the power of that concentration.

original: gzhan gyi don mang du bya ba gtsor gyur par mthong ba'i 'dod pa'i khams gang du 'dod pa der skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don mang du bya ba gtsor gyur par mthong ba'i 'dod pa'i khams gang du 'dod pa der skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are born in the desire realm where they see that they can benefit many other beings.

original: bsam gtan de la rang gi rgyud la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la nye bar phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan de la rang gi rgyud la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la nye bar phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That concentration has no karmic maturation in its own stream and no function of abiding in comfort in this life,

original: gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa yin no //
translated: but it does benefit others.

original: sa brgyad pa nas nyes bar bzung nas dbang thob pas dbang bcu'i sbyor bas mthu chen po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyis stong pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su sems can rnams kyi don du dga' ldan na bzhugs pa nas brtsams nas ji
analyzed: sa brgyad pa nas nyes bar bzung nas dbang thob pas dbang bcu'i sbyor bas mthu chen po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyis stong pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su sems can rnams kyi don du dga' ldan na bzhugs pa nas brtsams nas ji
translated: From the eighth level up to the tenth level, bodhisattvas who have attained power through the ten powers of the tenth level and who have acquired great might through the ten masteries, in worlds devoid of buddhas, benefit beings by means of emanations, from the time they are in the Tuṣita heaven until

original: srid mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar gyi mdzad pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: srid mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar gyi mdzad pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: He displays the deeds from the attainment of enlightenment to the great nirvana.

original: de ltan yang de nyid kyi don yod pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de ltan yang de nyid kyi don yod pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: And yet, since the meaning of that is not existent, it is solely for the benefit of others.

original: rang gi don mdzad zin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mdzad pa rnams mdzad pas yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa @36a * //
analyzed: rang gi don mdzad zin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mdzad pa rnams mdzad pas yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa @36a * //
translated: Having completed one's own aim refers to the tathāgatas who have completed their own deeds.

original: rnams la brten nas sems can gyi don mdzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnams la brten nas sems can gyi don mdzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: They engage in various kinds of benefit for sentient beings in dependence on the powers and so on, the unshared qualities of a buddha.

original: de dag gi mdzad pa ni de dag nyid ci dgos pa ci yang yod pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mdzad pa ni de dag nyid ci dgos pa ci yang yod pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: Since their deeds are not for their own sake, they are solely for the benefit of others.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i snga ma gnyis ni zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyams pa ni gzhan gyi don sbyin pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i snga ma gnyis ni zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyams pa ni gzhan gyi don sbyin pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The first two degenerations as described are: the degeneration of view, through the door of giving for the sake of others;

original: tshul khrims nyams pa ni ston pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa ni ston pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: and the degeneration of morality, through the door of teaching.

original: yongs su shes par byas la gcig tu spang bar bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par byas la gcig tu spang bar bya ba kho na'o //
translated: Having fully understood, one should abandon them exclusively.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la lta ba nyams pas sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims nyams pas gzhan tshul khrims pa 'god pa med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la lta ba nyams pas sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims nyams pas gzhan tshul khrims pa 'god pa med de /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give gifts with a degenerate view, nor does he establish others in morality with a degenerate morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has completely transcended the dharmas of the bodhisattva.

original: de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bsgyur ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bsgyur ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The other is the transformation of meditation, etc.

original: gang gi phyir bsam gtan bsgyur bar byas nas gzhan gyi don yin pa des na bya ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam gtan bsgyur bar byas nas gzhan gyi don yin pa des na bya ba kho na ste /
translated: Because, having transformed meditation, it is for the sake of others, it is only action.

original: rang gi rgyud kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause for the full maturation of the qualities of a Buddha in one's own mental continuum and because it is the cause for the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: sprul pa'i sems can rnams kyi don gyi bya ba la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems can rnams kyi don gyi bya ba la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in the activity for the sake of emanations.

original: khyad par du yang sems can rnams smin cing dgrol ba'i bya ba la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du yang sems can rnams smin cing dgrol ba'i bya ba la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in the activity for the sake of sentient beings, in order to bring them to full maturity and liberation.

original: de dag las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba phun sum tshogs pas sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba phun sum tshogs pas sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas chos ston pa'o //
translated: The opposite of these is as follows: One gives gifts with perfect view and one teaches the Dharma with perfect morality.🔽The five causes of benefit for oneself and others should be summarized as three.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phan pa'i rgyu rnam pa lnga ni mdor bsdu na gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phan pa'i rgyu rnam pa lnga ni mdor bsdu na gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: They are established as three:🔽by substance,

original: rdzas kyis dang / dus kyis dang / khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: rdzas kyis dang / dus kyis dang / khyad par gyis so //
translated: by time, and by distinction.

original: rdzas kyis ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rdzas kyis ni gnyis te /
translated: By substance, they are two:

original: nyes par spyod pa las bslangs nas legs par spyod pa la 'god cing sbyor bar byed pa dang / mthong ba'i chos nyid la kha na ma tho ba med pa rjes su mthun pa'i rdzas su mthun pa'i rdzas nye bar sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa las bslangs nas legs par spyod pa la 'god cing sbyor bar byed pa dang / mthong ba'i chos nyid la kha na ma tho ba med pa rjes su mthun pa'i rdzas su mthun pa'i rdzas nye bar sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
translated: It is the means of turning people away from evil and establishing them in good conduct. It is the means of providing, in this very life, with material things that are irreproachable and in conformity with the Dharma.

original: dus kyang gnyis te /
analyzed: dus kyang gnyis te /
translated: Time is twofold:

original: khyad par can dang / cig shos nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par can dang / cig shos nyid do //
translated: special and ordinary.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang ngo bo nyid dang / thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang ngo bo nyid dang / thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'o //
translated: Another twofold classification is intrinsic, initial, intermediate, and final.

original: ngo bo nyid kyang gnyis te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang gnyis te /
translated: Intrinsic is twofold:

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / rjes su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / rjes su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: that which has the characteristic of being irreproachable and that which has the characteristic of being helpful.

original: thog ma ni tshe 'di pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma ni tshe 'di pa'o //
translated: Initial is that of this life.

original: bar @36b ma ni tshe rabs gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: bar @36b ma ni tshe rabs gzhan pa'o //
translated: Intermediate is that of other lives.

original: tha ma ni nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Final is that which brings about complete nirvana.

original: de la chung du ni shes pa'i rdzas sam /
analyzed: de la chung du ni shes pa'i rdzas sam /
translated: Among these, the small is to be known as the means of providing material things for knowledge,

original: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i rdzas sam /
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i rdzas sam /
translated: the means of providing material things for meritorious works,

original: khams sam rnam par smin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams sam rnam par smin par rig par bya'o //
translated: or the means of providing for the elements and for karmic maturation.

original: de dag las bzlogs pas ni dge ba stsogs pa che bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlogs pas ni dge ba stsogs pa che bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the opposite of these is the greatness of virtue, etc.

original: dge ba ma thob pa rnams dang por bskyed pas thob pa ni dge ba yongs su gzung pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ma thob pa rnams dang por bskyed pas thob pa ni dge ba yongs su gzung pa'o //
translated: The acquisition of virtue that has not been obtained is the taking up of virtue.

original: thob pa rnams yang dang yang mngon du bsgom par sbyor ba ni dge ba stsogs pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa rnams yang dang yang mngon du bsgom par sbyor ba ni dge ba stsogs pa'o //
translated: The application to the repeated realization of that which has been obtained is the accumulation of virtue.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni gang bdag gis byas pa'i dge ba de la nges par gzhan dag yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni gang bdag gis byas pa'i dge ba de la nges par gzhan dag yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa yin no ;
translated: Moreover, means that one should certainly apply oneself to the virtue that has been accomplished by others.

original: / gzhan du na bdag nyid 'gyod pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: / gzhan du na bdag nyid 'gyod pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi /
translated: Otherwise, one would be a cause of regret for others,

original: dga' ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //🔽de'i phyir / gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan gyis //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro // de'i phyir / gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan gyis //
translated: but not a cause of joy.🔽Therefore,

original: yon tan med rnams gdung bar 'gyur //🔽khyod ni nyid kyi yon tan rnams //
analyzed: yon tan med rnams gdung bar 'gyur // khyod ni nyid kyi yon tan rnams //
translated: those who are without virtue are tormented by the virtues of others.🔽You are just like them

original: gzhan la med pas de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan la med pas de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: because you do not have the virtues of others.

original: zhes bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstod pa yin no //
translated: This is praise.

original: 'dzin du 'jug pa ni 'di ltar gyis shig ces yang dag par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'dzin du 'jug pa ni 'di ltar gyis shig ces yang dag par sbyor ba ste /
translated: Application is the correct application to virtue by saying, “Do it this way.”

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa nyid yang dag par sbyor ba yin no //🔽'dul bar byed ces bya ba ni dbang du gyur pa bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa nyid yang dag par sbyor ba yin no // 'dul bar byed ces bya ba ni dbang du gyur pa bsgrub pa'am /
translated: The correct application is the correct engagement.🔽The taming is the establishment of the subjugation.

original: bar chad sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the removal of the obstacles.

original: 'dzud par byed ces bya ba ni bsgrub pa la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzud par byed ces bya ba ni bsgrub pa la 'god pa'o //
translated: The introduction is the establishment in the practice.

original: 'jog par byed ces bya ba ni mi g-yo par gyur pa dang / gzhan gyis bsgyur du mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jog par byed ces bya ba ni mi g-yo par gyur pa dang / gzhan gyis bsgyur du mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: The establishment is the non-wavering and the non-alterability by others.🔽The non-remorse is the characteristic of the non-regret.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / yongs su gyur pa'i dus su bde ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / yongs su gyur pa'i dus su bde ba'i phyir te /
translated: The happiness is the transformation at the time of the end.

original: mthar thug pa'i dus su rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i dus su rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The suitability is the suitability at the time of the end.

original: gang bdag nyid nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub par byed pa dang / nges par gzhan dag la yang dag par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gang bdag nyid nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub par byed pa dang / nges par gzhan dag la yang dag par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The one who is not defiled by the suffering of others should establish the happiness of others.

original: gzhan du na 'dod pa'i bde ba la spyod pa nyid dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'dod pa'i bde ba la spyod pa nyid dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be like the enjoyment of the happiness of the desire realm.

original: yo byad kyi bde ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na kun du spyod pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sgo nas bde ba rgya chen po nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yo byad kyi bde ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na kun du spyod pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sgo nas bde ba rgya chen po nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The pleasure of material things is the great pleasure that definitely arises through the various kinds of enjoyment in the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan la gnas pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la gnas pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni chen por gyur pa dang tshad med pa'o //
translated: The pleasure of abiding in the absorptions is the great and immeasurable pleasure.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The characteristic of benefit is🔽the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of benefit.🔽The characteristic of happiness is

original: de ma thag tu lus dang sems kyi bde bskyed par byed pas rjes su @37a * //
analyzed: de ma thag tu lus dang sems kyi bde bskyed par byed pas rjes su @37a * //
translated: the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of happiness.🔽The characteristic of liberation is🔽the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of liberation.

original: 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of the cause of benefit is🔽the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of the cause of benefit.🔽The characteristic of the cause of happiness is🔽the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of the cause of happiness.🔽The characteristic of the cause of liberation is

original: nyon mongs pa can spangs pa'i phyir dang / phan 'degs pas phye ba'i phyir phan pa'i rgyus bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can spangs pa'i phyir dang / phan 'degs pas phye ba'i phyir phan pa'i rgyus bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of the cause of liberation.🔽The characteristic of the cause of the knowledge of liberation is🔽the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of the cause of the knowledge of liberation.🔽The characteristic of the cause of the knowledge of the attainment of liberation is🔽the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of the cause of the knowledge of the attainment of liberation.🔽The characteristic of the cause of the knowledge of the path that leads to liberation is🔽the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of the cause of the knowledge of the path that leads to liberation.🔽The characteristic of the cause of the knowledge of the path that leads to the attainment of liberation is

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don tshe 'di pa dang / tshe gzhan la 'chol pa'i sbyor bas bstan pa'i phyir /🔽bdag dang gzhan gyi don tshe 'di la phan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don tshe 'di pa dang / tshe gzhan la 'chol pa'i sbyor bas bstan pa'i phyir /🔽bdag dang gzhan gyi don tshe 'di la phan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of the cause of the knowledge of the path that leads to the attainment of liberation.🔽The characteristic of the cause of the knowledge of the path that leads to the knowledge of liberation is🔽the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of the cause of the knowledge of the path that leads to the knowledge of liberation.🔽The characteristic of the cause of the knowledge of the path that leads to the knowledge of the attainment of liberation is🔽the immediate generation of physical and mental pleasure, which is the reason for the designation of the cause of the knowledge of the path that leads to the knowledge of the attainment of liberation.

original: tshe 'di la phan pa ni dang po rtsom pa'i dus na 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe 'di la phan pa ni dang po rtsom pa'i dus na 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin gyi /
translated: The first is beneficial in this life, because it is the cause of happiness and well-being in this world,

original: tshe gzhan ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshe gzhan ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: but not in another life.

original: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir mi phan pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir mi phan pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is of a nature that is not beneficial, because it produces an undesirable result.

original: tsha gzhan la phan pa la 'jig rten 'dir de lta ma yin pa ni gzhan du 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa thob par bya ba'i dus na sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tsha gzhan la phan pa la 'jig rten 'dir de lta ma yin pa ni gzhan du 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa thob par bya ba'i dus na sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The second is beneficial in another life, but not in this life, because it is the cause of suffering and unhappiness when the time comes to experience the ripened result of the desire realm.

original: gsum pa ni gnyis ka la phan pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyis ka la phan pa ste /
translated: The third is beneficial in both,

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of happiness and well-being and because it is the ripened result of the desire realm.

original: gnyis ka la phan pa ma yin pa ni smras ma thag pa gnyis las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la phan pa ma yin pa ni smras ma thag pa gnyis las bzlog pa'o //
translated: That which is not beneficial in both is the opposite of the two just mentioned.

original: chos yang dag par blangs pa bzhi po dag tu go rims bzhin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par blangs pa bzhi'i sgo nas ji skad bstan pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don rnam pa bzhi go rims bzhin rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos yang dag par blangs pa bzhi po dag tu go rims bzhin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par blangs pa bzhi'i sgo nas ji skad bstan pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don rnam pa bzhi go rims bzhin rig par bya'o //
translated: The four kinds of correct embracing of the Dharma are to be understood in order as the four kinds of benefit for oneself and others as they have been explained.

original: dge ba'i chos 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa na 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu bya ba dang 'brel par zhugs pa nyid ni chos yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa na 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu bya ba dang 'brel par zhugs pa nyid ni chos yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Correct embracing is called the correct embracing of the Dharma because it causes the increase of virtuous qualities and because it causes the attainment of the desired maturation in the future.

original: legs par spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa yin no //
translated: It is good conduct.

original: sngon mi dge ba'i chos kyi sbyor ba la goms par byas pa las dan ltar nyes par spyod pa la bde ba dang yid bde bas 'jug par 'gyur ba ni dang po'o //
analyzed: sngon mi dge ba'i chos kyi sbyor ba la goms par byas pa las dan ltar nyes par spyod pa la bde ba dang yid bde bas 'jug par 'gyur ba ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the entry into bad conduct through pleasure and satisfaction, due to previous habituation to the practice of nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / sbyor ba goms par ma byas pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang bcas pa yin na yang rten gzhan gyi stobs kyis tshul khrims la sogs pa legs par spyod pa la 'jug pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / sbyor ba goms par ma byas pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang bcas pa yin na yang rten gzhan gyi stobs kyis tshul khrims la sogs pa legs par spyod pa la 'jug pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is when one engages in good conduct such as morality, etc., by the power of another, even though one has much affliction and is accompanied by pain and mental unhappiness because one has not cultivated the practice.

original: nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid dang / sngon sbyor pa goms par byas pa'i phyir dge ba'i phyogs la bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang bcas pas 'jug pa ni gsum pa'o //🔽mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan gyi stobs kyis byed bcug pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid dang / sngon sbyor pa goms par byas pa'i phyir dge ba'i phyogs la bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang bcas pas 'jug pa ni gsum pa'o // mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan gyi stobs kyis byed bcug pa'am /
translated: The third is when one engages in the good side with pleasure and mental happiness because one has little affliction and has cultivated the practice in the past.

original: sdug @37b bsngal dang yid mi bde bas nyes par spyod pa la 'jug par gyur pa ni bzhi pa'i //🔽de dag las nag po'i phyogs gnyis ni spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug @37b bsngal dang yid mi bde bas nyes par spyod pa la 'jug par gyur pa ni bzhi pa'i // de dag las nag po'i phyogs gnyis ni spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The fourth is when one engages in bad conduct, being forced by another, or being accompanied by pain and mental unhappiness, even though one does not want to.🔽Of these, the two dark sides are to be abandoned.

original: dkar po'i phyogs gnyis ni ni nges par bsten par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs gnyis ni ni nges par bsten par bya ba'o //
translated: The two bright sides are to be practiced.

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi sgo nas bdag dang gzhan gyi don tshe 'di pa dang tshe gzhan par rig par bya'i nag po'i phyogs kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi sgo nas bdag dang gzhan gyi don tshe 'di pa dang tshe gzhan par rig par bya'i nag po'i phyogs kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: One should understand the benefit for oneself and others in terms of the bright side, not in terms of the dark side.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas par nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas par nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Here, nirvana is the pacification of suffering, such as birth, etc., together with its causes.

original: de nyid ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don te /
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don te /
translated: That is the benefit for oneself and others.

original: don zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dgos pa zhes bya ba'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dgos pa zhes bya ba'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “benefit” is a synonym for “purpose.”

original: 'khor ba dang 'ga' ba'i dkar po'i chos 'jig rten pa dang las 'das pa ji ltar rigs pa'i dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi 'thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa la dgos pa'i phyir bzhi bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang 'ga' ba'i dkar po'i chos 'jig rten pa dang las 'das pa ji ltar rigs pa'i dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi 'thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa la dgos pa'i phyir bzhi bar byed pa ste /
translated: The four fruits of the spiritual life, which are the bright dharmas of samsara and nirvana, as appropriate, are the benefit for oneself and others, because they are the result of the practice of the bright side, and because they are the purpose of the pacification of suffering.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don yin no //
translated: The four fruits of the spiritual life are the benefit for oneself and others.

original: mdor bsdu na bde ba'i rnam pa bzhi dang / rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bde ba'i rnam pa bzhi dang / rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, the four kinds of pleasure and the four kinds of establishment should be understood.

original: rgyu bde ba dang / ngo bo nyid kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba dang / don dam pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu bde ba dang / ngo bo nyid kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba dang / don dam pa'o //
translated: The cause of pleasure, the nature of pleasure, the pleasure that is the antidote to suffering, and the ultimate.

original: gsum ni re re la re re go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gsum ni re re la re re go rims bzhin no //
translated: Each of the three is understood in order.

original: don dam pa'i bde ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bde ba ni gnyis te /
translated: The ultimate pleasure is twofold:

original: de'i dus pa dang / gtan du ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dus pa dang / gtan du ba'o //
translated: the pleasure of the present moment and the ultimate pleasure.

original: rgyu nyid bde ba ni rgyu bde ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid bde ba ni rgyu bde ba'o //
translated: The cause of pleasure is the cause of pleasure.

original: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The others are also like that.

original: bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas so so'am bsdus nas bde ba'i rgyur rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas so so'am bsdus nas bde ba'i rgyur rnam par gzhag go //
translated: From the perspective of the two kinds of causes of pleasure, they are established as causes of pleasure individually or collectively.

original: yul las skyes pa bdag po dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen gyis bsdus pa dbang po dang yul gyi lhan cig byed pa can ni bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul las skyes pa bdag po dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen gyis bsdus pa dbang po dang yul gyi lhan cig byed pa can ni bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The pleasure that arises from objects is included in the dominant condition and the objective condition. The co-arising of the faculties and objects is the cause of pleasure.

original: bde ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bde ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called pleasure.

original: de dag rgyu gsum gyis bde bar rnam par gzhag par byas te /
analyzed: de dag rgyu gsum gyis bde bar rnam par gzhag par byas te /
translated: They are posited as pleasure for three reasons:

original: mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa dang / bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa dang / bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are desired, because they are the cause of pleasure, and because they are the cause of the experience of pleasure.

original: gsum po 'di dag dang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag dang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These three reasons should be applied as appropriate.

original: yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang rgyu rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, causes are of two types:

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //🔽ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa'i tshor ba myong ba'i rgyu yang khams gsum du yang rnam par smin pa @38a * //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o // ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa'i tshor ba myong ba'i rgyu yang khams gsum du yang rnam par smin pa @38a * //
translated: coemergent causes and concomitant causes.🔽The cause of the experience of future pleasant feeling is virtuous karma that is to be experienced in the three realms.

original: dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i las sam /
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i las sam /
translated: Or it is the cause of the experience of pleasure in this life.🔽The cause of pleasure in this life is the cause of the experience of pleasure in this life.

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi dbye ba ni bde ba'i rgyu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi dbye ba ni bde ba'i rgyu zhes brjod do //
translated: The cause of pleasure in this life is the cause of the experience of pleasure in this life.

original: bde ba'i rgyu ni bzhi po 'di dag yin gyi /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu ni bzhi po 'di dag yin gyi /
translated: These four are the cause of pleasure.

original: 'di dag las gzhan bde ba'i rgyu ni med do zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di dag las gzhan bde ba'i rgyu ni med do zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: There is no cause of pleasure other than these.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: de la bde ba ni yong su rdzogs pa'i bde ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba ni yong su rdzogs pa'i bde ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Here, pleasure is complete pleasure and incomplete pleasure.

original: de la yongs su rdzogs pa ni sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba la ltos pa med par bde ba'i rgyu dag las skyes par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni tshor ba bde ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yongs su rdzogs pa ni sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba la ltos pa med par bde ba'i rgyu dag las skyes par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni tshor ba bde ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate that the pleasure which is born from the causes of pleasure without regard to the removal of pain is a pleasant feeling, he says:

original: sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba la mi ltos par zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba la mi ltos par zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: without regard to the pacification of pain.

original: sdug bsngal bsal ba las byung ba ma yin pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsal ba las byung ba ma yin pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that it does not arise from the removal of pain.

original: gsum po de dag nyid las zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / yul dang reg pa las bsdus pa'i bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsum po de dag nyid las zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang / yul dang reg pa las bsdus pa'i bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From those three themselves means from the causes of pleasure which are included in the sense-faculties, objects and contact.

original: lus dang sems rjes su 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems rjes su 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: It is that which maintains the body and mind.

original: bde ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of pleasure.

original: yang tshor ba bde ba de ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: yang tshor ba bde ba de ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Again, that pleasant feeling is said to be established in two aspects.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In brief, it is twofold.🔽It is also twofold, uncontaminated and contaminated.

original: zag pa med pa yang slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The uncontaminated is also twofold, classified as the learner’s and non-learner’s paths.

original: zag pa bcas pa yang khams gsum pa'i khams dang skye mched dang yang dag par dan pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa bcas pa yang khams gsum pa'i khams dang skye mched dang yang dag par dan pa'o //
translated: The contaminated is the aggregates, elements, and sense bases of the three realms.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽That is also from the six sense bases of all three realms, as appropriate.

original: de yang ci rigs par khams gsum pa thams cad kyi skye mched drug gi bye brag las mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par khams gsum pa thams cad kyi skye mched drug gi bye brag las mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The distinction of eye contact and so on.

original: de la ci rigs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la ci rigs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of as appropriate is as follows.

original: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i rnam pa drug ni lus dang yang dag par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i rnam pa drug ni lus dang yang dag par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
translated: The six types associated with the desire realm are the six consciousnesses associated with the body.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang yang dag par ldan pa ni rnam par shes pa bzhi dang yang dag par ldan pa'i rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang yang dag par ldan pa ni rnam par shes pa bzhi dang yang dag par ldan pa'i rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four types associated with the form realm are the four types associated with the four types of consciousness.

original: de dag ni sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa med pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa med pas so //
translated: They are not associated with olfactory and gustatory consciousness.

original: gzugs med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni rnam pa gcig nyid do /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni rnam pa gcig nyid do /
translated: The one type associated with the formless realm is the one type associated with mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: It is born from mental contact.

original: de na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the five collections of consciousness are absent there.

original: de ltar rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa drug go //
translated: Thus there are six types.

original: yang rnam pa @38b drug po de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa @38b drug po de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: These six types are further reduced to two types:

original: lus kyi dang / sems kyi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dang / sems kyi'o //
translated: bodily and mental.

original: de lus kyi ni rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de lus kyi ni rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Bodily feeling is of five types.

original: sems kyi ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi ni drug pa'o //
translated: Mental feeling is of six types.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rnam pa shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni lus kyi'o //
translated: Bodily feeling is associated with the five collections of consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni yid kyi'o zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa lnga dang yang dag par ldan pa'i tshor ba ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni yid kyi'o zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa lnga dang yang dag par ldan pa'i tshor ba ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi'o //
translated: The feeling that is associated with the five consciousnesses is bodily, because it is supported on the body, which is an aggregation of atoms and sense faculties.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang dag par bsten pa ni sems tsam la bsten pa'i phyir sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang dag par bsten pa ni sems tsam la bsten pa'i phyir sems las byung ba'o //

original: dus mi mnyam par gyur pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen pos zhi bar byas te /🔽log pa tsam de nyid la sdug bsngal gyi gnyen pos zhi bar byas te /
