original: log pa tsam de nyid la sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i phyogs bde bar rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: log pa tsam de nyid la sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i phyogs bde bar rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: is the feeling that is born from the pacification of suffering by means of the antidote to suffering that arises from the cessation of the suffering that arises from the disturbance of the elements, etc.,🔽is the feeling that is born from the pacification

original: tshor ba bde ba de yang yod cing tshor ba'i rgyu yang yod na sdug bsngal la gnas pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i tshor ba ldog par 'gyur bas tshor ba rgyun chad pa ni bde ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba de yang yod cing tshor ba'i rgyu yang yod na sdug bsngal la gnas pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i tshor ba ldog par 'gyur bas tshor ba rgyun chad pa ni bde ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cutting off of feeling is bliss.

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal las thar pa ni gnod pa med pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal las thar pa ni gnod pa med pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The bliss of freedom from harm is freedom from the suffering of harm.

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The suffering of harm is of four kinds:

original: khyim pa rnams kyis btsal ba dang / bsrung ba la sogs pas brel ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa la mi mkhas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pas kun du dkrugs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sgrib pa la kun du rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams kyis btsal ba dang / bsrung ba la sogs pas brel ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa la mi mkhas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pas kun du dkrugs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sgrib pa la kun du rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: the suffering of householders who are busy with the troubles of seeking and guarding their possessions, the suffering of those who are unskilled in desire, the suffering of those who are agitated by discursive thought and speculation, and the suffering of those who are confused about the obscurations.

original: de dag las nges par thar pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni gnod pa med pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba'o //🔽yang dag par dad pas zhes bya ba ni bdag dul bar bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba nas bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i don gyi bar gyi phyir rab tu byung ba ni mngon par 'byung ba'i bde ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: de dag las nges par thar pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni gnod pa med pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba'o // yang dag par dad pas zhes bya ba ni bdag dul bar bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba nas bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i don gyi bar gyi phyir rab tu byung ba ni mngon par 'byung ba'i bde ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir
translated: The four kinds of definite release from those are called the bliss of non-injury.🔽The line with right faith is explained by the line the bliss of going forth is for the purpose of taming oneself, up to the purpose of attaining complete nirvana for oneself.

original: / khyim so'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs las nges par thar pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: / khyim so'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs las nges par thar pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The line definite release from the various sufferings of householders is explained by the line the bliss of going forth is for the purpose of taming oneself, up to the purpose of attaining complete nirvana for oneself.

original: khyim so'i bya ba sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal ba ni nor med pa rnams ni tshol ba'i sgo nas sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: khyim so'i bya ba sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal ba ni nor med pa rnams ni tshol ba'i sgo nas sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The various activities of householders are suffering. Those without wealth suffer from seeking it.

original: nor dang bcas pa rnams ni bsrung ba'i sgo nas sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: nor dang bcas pa rnams ni bsrung ba'i sgo nas sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Those with wealth suffer from protecting it.

original: de dag las @39a * //
analyzed: de dag las @39a * //
translated: From those

original: nges par grol ba ni de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs mngon par 'byung ba'i bde bar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: nges par grol ba ni de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs mngon par 'byung ba'i bde bar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: definite release is the bliss of going forth, which is posited as the antidote to those.

original: khyim so las nges par 'byung ba ni gzhan la nges par yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyim so las nges par 'byung ba ni gzhan la nges par yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The happiness of going forth is not found in any other way, so it is called the happiness of going forth.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs mngon sum du byas pas 'dod pa rnams dang sdig pa ming dge ba'i chos rnams spong bas na bde ba ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs mngon sum du byas pas 'dod pa rnams dang sdig pa ming dge ba'i chos rnams spong bas na bde ba ste /
translated: The happiness of abandoning is the happiness of abandoning desires and the nonvirtuous qualities that are their cause, by means of the direct realization of the antidote.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i bde ba ni rab tu dben pa'i bde zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i bde ba ni rab tu dben pa'i bde zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The happiness of seclusion is the happiness of the first meditative absorption, because it is the seclusion from desires.🔽The happiness of tranquility is the happiness of the fourth meditative absorption, because it is the tranquility of the complete pacification of the conceptual thoughts of investigation and analysis.

original: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas ngang gis 'jug pa ni nye bar zhi ba'i bde bar rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas ngang gis 'jug pa ni nye bar zhi ba'i bde bar rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The happiness of complete pacification is the happiness of the meditative absorption of the sphere of infinite space, because it is the complete pacification of the conceptual thoughts of form.

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs mngon du gyur pas zag pa thams cad bral bar gyur pa'i sbyor bas shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs mngon du gyur pas zag pa thams cad bral bar gyur pa'i sbyor bas shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba zhes bya ste /
translated: presence of the antidote to the afflictions of the three realms.

original: spangs pa dang ye shes ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa dang ye shes ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Abandonment and knowledge are perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag gnyi ga yang bde ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga yang bde ba zhes brjod de /
translated: Both of these are called “bliss,”

original: sdug bsngal las nges par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las nges par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are definitely free from suffering.

original: bde ba rnam pa lnga rnam pa gzhag pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bde ba rnam pa lnga rnam pa gzhag pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to present the five kinds of bliss, he says:🔽The cause of bliss, the experience of bliss,🔽the bliss of nonperception,🔽the bliss of the absence of suffering,

original: de la rgyu bde ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la rgyu bde ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and the bliss of the absence of craving.🔽The four that are the cause of feeling are posited as bliss because they are

original: tshor ba'i rgyur gyur pa bzhi po yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba nyid du rnam par gzhag gi / de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rgyur gyur pa bzhi po yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba nyid du rnam par gzhag gi / de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: the cause of bliss, but not because of their own nature.

original: ji ltar mi bde zhes bya ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde ba ste //
analyzed: ji ltar mi bde zhes bya ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde ba ste //
translated: What is meant by “unhappy”?🔽The arising of a Buddha is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Just as it is said, What is suffering? and The appearance of a Buddha is happiness.

original: tshor ba bde ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the nature of pleasant feeling is to be experienced,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba zhes brjod de /
translated: it is called natural happiness.

original: rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a happiness that arises from a cause.

original: rgyu'i dngos pos kyang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos pos kyang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not even a state of being a cause, means

original: bde ba de la rgyu yod pa ma yin gyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur pa tsam yin pas de'i phyir bde ba de la rgyu yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bde ba de la rgyu yod pa ma yin gyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur pa tsam yin pas de'i phyir bde ba de la rgyu yod pa ma yin la /
translated: that this happiness does not have a cause, because it is merely the cessation of suffering. Therefore, this happiness does not have a cause.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not even natural,

original: tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the nature of feeling.

original: 'on kyang sdug bsngal rgyun chad pa'i ngo bo tsam la bde ba zhes nye bar gdags so //
analyzed: 'on kyang sdug bsngal rgyun chad pa'i ngo bo tsam la bde ba zhes nye bar gdags so //
translated: Nevertheless, the mere cessation of the continuum of suffering is designated as happiness.

original: de'i phyir / sdug bsngal zhi bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sdug bsngal zhi bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, The cessation of suffering is peace.

original: sdug bsngal zhi bar gyur pa'i don yang sdug bsngal bas zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhi bar gyur pa'i don yang sdug bsngal bas zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The meaning of “the pacification of suffering” is also “because of suffering.

original: @39b yang na thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pa yin pas zi bar gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: @39b yang na thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pa yin pas zi bar gyur pa yin la /
translated: ” Or else, since it is the abandonment of everything in every way, it is “pacified.

original: chung bar gyur pa ni bsal ba'o //
analyzed: chung bar gyur pa ni bsal ba'o //
translated: ” The word “diminished” is a synonym for “removed.

original: tshor ba rgyun chad pa'i bde ba ni sngar bstan ma thag pa'i bde ba rnam pa gsum po lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba rgyun chad pa'i bde ba ni sngar bstan ma thag pa'i bde ba rnam pa gsum po lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: ” The pleasure of the cessation of feeling is not like the three kinds of pleasure that have just been explained.

original: 'on kyang sdug bsngal dang bde ba tshor ba yang dag par na sdug bsngal zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang sdug bsngal dang bde ba tshor ba yang dag par na sdug bsngal zhes brjod de /
translated: However, the feeling of pleasure is said to be suffering in reality,

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: de dag las rnam par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid ni dus re zhig pa'i sbyor bas don dam pa'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las rnam par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid ni dus re zhig pa'i sbyor bas don dam pa'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of being liberated from them is called “ultimate pleasure” because it is the result of the practice of the path for a certain period of time.

original: de'i phyir / tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Whatever feeling . . . ” and so forth.

original: gang ci yang rung ba zhes bya bas ni tshor ba rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ba zhes bya bas ni tshor ba rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: “Whatever” indicates the three kinds of feelings.

original: de las sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / bde ba'i tshor ba yang yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin te /
analyzed: de las sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / bde ba'i tshor ba yang yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin te /
translated: The feeling of pleasure is suffering because of the suffering of change,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i sbyor bas so //
translated: because the transformation of pleasure is the cause of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i bde ba la sbyor bas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i bde ba la sbyor bas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain is suffering because of the suffering of the samskaras, because it is the cause of the origination of suffering.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, all feelings are said to be suffering.

original: tha ma rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: tha ma rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba ni don dam pa ste /
translated: The ultimate truth is the bliss of complete enlightenment,

original: sdug bsngal las gtan du nges par grol bas bde ba ma lus pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las gtan du nges par grol bas bde ba ma lus pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: because it is the ultimate bliss, since it is the permanent liberation from suffering.

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the remainder of the aggregates,

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “All the factors of the side of affliction” and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'o /
translated: The side of affliction is the affliction of the three realms.

original: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon no //
translated: The term “bad condition” refers to the seeds of affliction.

original: rten la yod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rten la yod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: “Existing in the basis” means existing in consciousness.

original: gtan med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gtan tu kun nas bcom pa ste /
analyzed: gtan med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gtan tu kun nas bcom pa ste /
translated: “Completely non-existent” means completely destroyed.

original: gang la rnam par grol ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la rnam par grol ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called “the bliss of liberation.”

original: 'di las gzhan pa gsum ni rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba la rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa'i bde ba zhes de'i ming gis brjod do //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa gsum ni rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba la rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa'i bde ba zhes de'i ming gis brjod do //
translated: The other three are called “the bliss of non-affliction” because they are in accord with the bliss of perfect enlightenment.

original: de dang mthun pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir tshig phyi ma dag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir tshig phyi ma dag bstan pa yin no //
translated: The subsequent phrases are taught in order to demonstrate that they are in accord with that.

original: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba'i rgyu yin pa phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba'i rgyu yin pa phyir /
translated: Because they are the cause of the bliss of non-affliction,

original: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba zhes bstan to //
translated: they are taught as the bliss of non-affliction.

original: de bzhin @40a * //
analyzed: de bzhin @40a * //
translated: Just so,

original: du rgyu nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / sdug bsngal rgyun chad pa nyid dang / don dam pa nyid kyis bde ba rnam pa lnga'i rnam par dbye ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du rgyu nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / sdug bsngal rgyun chad pa nyid dang / don dam pa nyid kyis bde ba rnam pa lnga'i rnam par dbye ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The five aspects of happiness are taught by way of the cause of happiness, the nature of happiness, the cessation of the continuum of suffering, and the ultimate.

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshe gzhan pa'i dbye bas bdag dang gzhan gyi don chos yang dag par blangs pa bzhi yang bstan pa yin no //🔽de la ngag po'i phyogs rnams kyis bsdus pas ni sems can rnams nye bar bsdu bar mi bya la /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshe gzhan pa'i dbye bas bdag dang gzhan gyi don chos yang dag par blangs pa bzhi yang bstan pa yin no // de la ngag po'i phyogs rnams kyis bsdus pas ni sems can rnams nye bar bsdu bar mi bya la /
translated: The four kinds of taking up what is right for the benefit of self and other by way of the divisions of time taught above are also taught.

original: bdag nyid kyang yang dag par sbyar bar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang yang dag par sbyar bar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In that regard, it is said in order to teach that one should not gather sentient beings and should not practice correctly by way of the side of the aggregates:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva, etc.

original: phan pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyi ma'i rnam par smin pa bde ba'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyi ma'i rnam par smin pa bde ba'o //
translated: The side of benefit is the pleasant future evolutionary development.

original: gnod pa'i phyogs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa'i phyogs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The side of harm is not, i.e., the unpleasant future evolutionary development.

original: rgyu cig tu nyon mongs pa can nyid du gyur pas kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu cig tu nyon mongs pa can nyid du gyur pas kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the cause is always defiled, it is reprehensible.

original: de'i 'bras bu yang mi 'dod pa nyid du gyur pas de ni gzhan yang bsgrub par mi bya la /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang mi 'dod pa nyid du gyur pas de ni gzhan yang bsgrub par mi bya la /
translated: And because its result is undesirable, it should not be cultivated.

original: mi phan pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba la 'jug par gyur na yang sems can 'di dag 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi don la zhugs pa ma yin gyi don med pa la zhugs pa yin no zhes shes rab kyis rnam par byas la /
analyzed: mi phan pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba la 'jug par gyur na yang sems can 'di dag 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi don la zhugs pa ma yin gyi don med pa la zhugs pa yin no zhes shes rab kyis rnam par byas la /
translated: When one sees that sentient beings are engaged in the pursuit of pleasure, which is a cause of harm, one should reflect with wisdom, “These sentient beings are not engaged in the pursuit of the aims of this world or the next world, but are engaged in the pursuit of what is meaningless.”

original: de la sems can rnams bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems can rnams bzlog par bya ste /
translated: And one should turn sentient beings away from that.

original: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod pa nyid dang / nyes dmigs ston pa nyid kyis de las bzlog pa'i sbyor bas nus pa yod na 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod pa nyid dang / nyes dmigs ston pa nyid kyis de las bzlog pa'i sbyor bas nus pa yod na 'bad par bya'o //
translated: If one has the ability, one should make an effort to turn them away from that by speaking unfavorably about it and by showing its disadvantages, and by engaging in the opposite of that.

original: chos yang dag par blangs pa gnyis pa gang yin pa de la ni phan pa yin na ni mi 'dod cing /
analyzed: chos yang dag par blangs pa gnyis pa gang yin pa de la ni phan pa yin na ni mi 'dod cing /
translated: As for the second precept, one should not desire what is beneficial.

original: re zhig pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba skyer zin kyang /
analyzed: re zhig pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba skyer zin kyang /
translated: Even though suffering and mental dissatisfaction have already arisen for a while,

original: thabs gang yang rung bas stobs ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: thabs gang yang rung bas stobs ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: in order to teach that they should be accomplished by sentient beings with whatever means and strength, it is said:

original: thams mkhas pa la brten nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams mkhas pa la brten nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having relied on the wise, and so on.

original: de la blangs pa dang po bsdus pa'i mi phan pa las sems can rnams bzlog pa na dus re zhig sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde par skyer zin kyang de ni nye bar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la blangs pa dang po bsdus pa'i mi phan pa las sems can rnams bzlog pa na dus re zhig sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde par skyer zin kyang de ni nye bar bslab par bya'o //
translated: There, when sentient beings are turned away from harm that has been gathered, even though suffering and mental dissatisfaction have already arisen for a while, that should be endured.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bde ba sbyin par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bde ba sbyin par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If the bodhisattvas desire to give happiness,

original: ci'i phyir da ltar gyi bde ba bsal nas sdug bsngal la sbyor bar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir da ltar gyi bde ba bsal nas sdug bsngal la sbyor bar 'dod ce na /
translated: why do they desire to eliminate present happiness and connect with suffering?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal dad bcas @40b pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa gang yin pa de dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal dad bcas @40b pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa gang yin pa de dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That which is accomplished with suffering and happiness, and so on.

original: gnag sdug bsngal dang bcas pas phan pa bsgrub pa dang / bde ba dang bcas pas mi phan pa las bzlog pa de gnyis ka yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus ring po'i bde ba sgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnag sdug bsngal dang bcas pas phan pa bsgrub pa dang / bde ba dang bcas pas mi phan pa las bzlog pa de gnyis ka yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus ring po'i bde ba sgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The two, along with suffering, are to be established in benefit, and along with happiness, are to be turned away from non-benefit. Both of these are to be established in future happiness.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag kyang bde ba sgrub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag kyang bde ba sgrub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, these are also to be known as the establishment of happiness.

original: sems can rnams la phan par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni don gyis na bde ba 'dod pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni don gyis na bde ba 'dod pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which is the desire to benefit sentient beings is to be known as the desire for their happiness in fact.

original: phan pa ni bde ba dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: phan pa ni bde ba dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Benefit is connected with happiness,

original: yongs su gyur pa'i dus su bde ba mi 'dor ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i dus su bde ba mi 'dor ba yin no //
translated: and at the time of transformation, it does not abandon happiness.

original: de lta bu'i bsam pa nyid kyis sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa nyid kyis sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With just such an intention, he speaks from the perspective of application:

original: phan pa sbyin pa gan yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyu dang yang dag par 'brel pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan pa sbyin pa gan yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyu dang yang dag par 'brel pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The giving of benefit, etc. In order to teach the result that is related to the cause, he says:

original: 'di ltar phan pa ni rgyu lta bu yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phan pa ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar phan pa ni rgyu lta bu yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phan pa ni rgyu yin la /
translated: Thus, benefit is like a cause, etc. Benefit is a cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Future happiness is a result.

original: de lta bas na gan 'ga' zhig phan pa la rjes su zhugs pa de ni 'bras bu gyur pa'i bde ba la rjes su zhugs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gan 'ga' zhig phan pa la rjes su zhugs pa de ni 'bras bu gyur pa'i bde ba la rjes su zhugs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who is engaged in benefit is known as one who is engaged in the happiness that is a transformation of the result.

original: mthong ba'i chos dang de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu dang / ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos dang de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu dang / ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The present life and the future life refer to the result in the present life and the result in the future life.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba ste /🔽tshe 'di 'am /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba ste / tshe 'di 'am /
translated: These four are to be accomplished in one way.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du gtan du pa dang / re zhig pa'i las la sogs pa gnod pa med pa rnams dpyad mi dgos par nges par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du gtan du pa dang / re zhig pa'i las la sogs pa gnod pa med pa rnams dpyad mi dgos par nges par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: Either in this life or in another life, one should accomplish without doubt the beneficial actions that are not harmful, whether they are temporary or lasting.

original: brtag mi dgos par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtag mi dgos par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not to be doubted.

original: rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause, he says:

original: phan 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase “beneficial, etc.”

original: phan 'dogs pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that it is not reprehensible because it is beneficial.

original: dbang po dang yul gyis bsdus pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gyis bsdus pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is afflicted by being included among the faculties and objects,

original: nyon mongs pa'i rten dang dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rten dang dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis and object of the passions.

original: reg pas bsdus pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: reg pas bsdus pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: It is defiled by being included among the contacts,

original: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with the passions.

original: tshor ba bde ba ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Pleasant feeling is reprehensible,

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the passions and the nature of the support of affliction.

original: mi phan pa ni bde ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phan pa ni bde ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Unbeneficial means that which is contrary to pleasure.

original: mi 'phrod pa ni @41a * //
analyzed: mi 'phrod pa ni @41a * //
translated: Unwholesome means

original: sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel ba'o //🔽yang na mi phan pa'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel ba'o // yang na mi phan pa'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: that which is associated with pain.

original: mi 'phrod pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'phrod pa ste /
translated: Or, the meaning of unbeneficial is taught as unwholesome.

original: yongs su gyur nas sdug bsngal ba'i phyir mi 'phrod pa'i sman bzhin no //
analyzed: yongs su gyur nas sdug bsngal ba'i phyir mi 'phrod pa'i sman bzhin no //
translated: because they are transformed into suffering, like unwholesome medicine.

original: de dag ni bsgrub par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bsgrub par mi bya ste /
translated: They should not be practiced

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are associated with demerit, etc.

original: de dag las bzlog pa kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: The opposite of those, which are not defiled and are not associated with defilement, should be practiced

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not associated with demerit, etc.

original: ci nus kyis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi nus pa dang rjes su mthun par ro //
analyzed: ci nus kyis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi nus pa dang rjes su mthun par ro //
translated: “To the best of one’s ability” means in accordance with one’s own strength.

original: ci lcogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems can dang rjes su mthun par ro //🔽bdag nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de la yang dag par spyod par mi byed slob par mi byed /
analyzed: ci lcogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems can dang rjes su mthun par ro // bdag nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de la yang dag par spyod par mi byed slob par mi byed /
translated: “To the best of one’s power” means in accordance with the strength of sentient beings.🔽“One should not practice” means that one should not practice that which is defiled or that which is associated with defilement.

original: nyams su myong bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: nyams su myong bar mi byed kyi /
translated: One should not train in it, nor should one experience it.

original: de dag las bzlog pa la ni yang dag par spyad pa nas nyams su myong ba'i bar du byed do //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa la ni yang dag par spyad pa nas nyams su myong ba'i bar du byed do //
translated: The opposite of these is the practice of right practice up to the experience of pleasure.

original: de la yul dang / dbang po dang / reg pas bsdus pa 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa 'byung ba'i chos rgyu bde ba la ni yang dag par spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yul dang / dbang po dang / reg pas bsdus pa 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa 'byung ba'i chos rgyu bde ba la ni yang dag par spyad par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the Dharma that is the cause of the pleasant ripening of desire, which is included in the object, sense faculty, and contact, should be practiced.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba dang / tshor ba rgyun chad pa'i bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba dang / tshor ba rgyun chad pa'i bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba ste /
translated: The pleasure that is the antidote to suffering, the pleasure that is the cessation of feeling, and the pleasure that is irreproachable.

original: de dag la ni bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in these.

original: tshor ba bde ba gang kha na ma tho ba med pa de ni nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba gang kha na ma tho ba med pa de ni nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gi dbye ba'o //
translated: The pleasant feeling that is irreproachable should be experienced. This is the classification of these.

original: rgyu yang rnam pa gsum yod la zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i nges pa las 'bras bu'i nges par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu yang rnam pa gsum yod la zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i nges pa las 'bras bu'i nges par rig par bya'o //
translated: The cause also has three types. The ascertainment of the result should be known from the ascertainment of the cause.

original: bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs nye bar sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sngon du rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs nye bar sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sngon du rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: The assembly of bodhisattvas who are established in the maturation of merit will be gathered together.

original: rnam par smin par byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin par byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of maturation is called the cause of maturation.

original: tshogs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshogs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: An assembly is also twofold:

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: the assembly of merit and the assembly of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir 'dir gnyis ka'i rgyu bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gnyis ka'i rgyu bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, here the cause of both is taught:

original: bsod nams kyi rgyu dang / ye shes kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rgyu dang / ye shes kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the cause of merit and the cause of wisdom.

original: bsod nams kyi rgyu dang / ye shes kyi rgyu zhes bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rgyu dang / ye shes kyi rgyu zhes bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The cause of merit and the cause of wisdom should be included.

original: byed pa po gang rnam par smin pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par smin pa gang la gnas par 'gyur ba de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o//
analyzed: byed pa po gang rnam par smin pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par smin pa gang la gnas par 'gyur ba de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o//
translated: The agent who is established in the maturation and the maturation in which he is established is the maturation result.

original: @41b gang bsod nams dang ldan par gyur pa de ni bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: @41b gang bsod nams dang ldan par gyur pa de ni bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: That which is endowed with merit is the result of merit.

original: ye shes kyi bya ba ni ye shes kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi bya ba ni ye shes kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The action of intuition is the result of intuition.🔽What is the result of evolution?

original: de la rnam par smin pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mdor bstan pa de bzhin du bshad par bya ba yin no zhes bya bas sngar bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mdor bstan pa de bzhin du bshad par bya ba yin no zhes bya bas sngar bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: The result of evolution should be explained in the same way that it was briefly presented above.

original: re re la yang dbye ba dpag tu med pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: re re la yang dbye ba dpag tu med pa dang ldan pas /
translated: Each of these has an infinite number of subdivisions.

original: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In brief, there are eight kinds of results.🔽The first is the result of evolution, which is the result of evolution of the action of the three doors of body, speech, and mind.🔽The second is the result of separation, which is the result of the path of the separation from the obstacle of the passions.🔽The third is the result of the human effort, which is the result of human effort.🔽The fourth is the result of dominance, which is the result of the power of the other conditions, such as the seed, water, fertilizer, etc.🔽The fifth is the result of the cause of immediate succession, which is the result of the cause of immediate succession.🔽The sixth is the result of the cause of similar lot, which is the result of the cause of similar lot.🔽The seventh is the result of the cause of universal homogeneity, which is the result of the cause of universal homogeneity.

original: de'i 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad yin pas rnam par smin pa ni brgyad do //🔽yang na bde 'gror skyes nas ring du gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par smin pa dang po'i //🔽bdag gi dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa dang / skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang / skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang / longs spyod dang 'khor khyad par du 'phags pa'i dbang du byas nas gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad yin pas rnam par smin pa ni brgyad do //🔽yang na bde 'gror skyes nas ring du gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par smin pa dang po'i //🔽bdag gi dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa dang / skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang / skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang / longs spyod dang 'khor khyad par du 'phags pa'i dbang du byas nas gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang /
translated: The eighth is the result of the cause of full accomplishment, which is the result of the cause of full accomplishment.

original: bzhi pa'o // 'jig rten pa rnams kyi tshad ma'i dbang du byas nas lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'o // 'jig rten pa rnams kyi tshad ma'i dbang du byas nas lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is from the point of view of the authority of the world.

original: tshad mar gyur pa'i grags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i dbang du byas nas ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa'i grags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i dbang du byas nas ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is from the point of view of the authority of the verses of fame.

original: yon tan thams cad kyi snod du gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas bdun pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi snod du gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is from the point of view of being a vessel of all virtues.

original: snod du gyur pas bya ba thams cad la mthu dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas nas ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: snod du gyur pas bya ba thams cad la mthu dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas nas ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is from the point of view of being a vessel, being powerful in all actions.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis tshe phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /🔽'phen pa chen po nyid dang / gnas pa chen po nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis tshe phun sum tshogs pa bstan te / 'phen pa chen po nyid dang / gnas pa chen po nyid do //
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the perfection of life.🔽Life is considered long or short according to its distinction in evolutionary action and in species.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bde 'gror skyes par gyur pa'i tshe ring bar 'phen pa'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe ni ring ba nyid dang ldan par 'gyur gyi thung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bde 'gror skyes par gyur pa'i tshe ring bar 'phen pa'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe ni ring ba nyid dang ldan par 'gyur gyi thung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: When a bodhisattva is born in a happy realm, by the evolutionary action that projects a long life, he has a long life and not a short one.

original: de ni der skyes pa'i sems can gzhan rnams las lhag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni der skyes pa'i sems can gzhan rnams las lhag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He is superior to other beings born there.

original: 'phangs pa'i tshe ring ba dang ldan par ji srid 'phangs pa de las bar du chad par mi 'gyur bar ring du gnas pa ni ring du gnas pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'phangs pa'i tshe ring ba dang ldan par ji srid 'phangs pa de las bar du chad par mi 'gyur bar ring du gnas pa ni ring du gnas pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: When projected, it is long-lasting, because it lasts for a long time without interruption for as long as it is projected.

original: de ltar 'phangs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'phangs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is long-lasting because it continues after being projected.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa'i tshe ring pa de dbye na rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa'i tshe ring pa de dbye na rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva's long life is of four types:

original: ring ba nyid dang / bar ma chad pa nyid dang / dge ba'i las dang rjes su mthun pa nyid dang / bde ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: ring ba nyid dang / bar ma chad pa nyid dang / dge ba'i las dang rjes su mthun pa nyid dang / bde ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid do //
translated: long, uninterrupted, in accord with virtuous karma, and in accord with happiness.

original: de dag thams cad ni tshe phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni tshe phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o /
translated: All of these are called the excellence of life.

original: do // de dag thams cad ni tshe phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: do // de dag thams cad ni tshe phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All of these are called the excellence of life.

original: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The excellence of color is also twofold:

original: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ni gzugs bzang pa'o//
analyzed: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ni gzugs bzang pa'o//
translated: The excellence of color is a good figure.

original: @42a * // dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa ni blta na sdug pa'o //
analyzed: @42a * // dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa ni blta na sdug pa'o //
translated: The perfection of shape is beauty.

original: gnyis ka yang mdzes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang mdzes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mdzes pa'o //
translated: Both are beautiful because they are the cause of beauty.🔽Or else, beauty is the perfection of width and height.

original: yang na chu zheng phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir mdzes pa'o zhes bya ba dang / rnam pa gsum po de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na chu zheng phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir mdzes pa'o zhes bya ba dang / rnam pa gsum po de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: This threefold perfection is fourfold:

original: kha dog dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang po ma tshang ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / chu zheng phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang po ma tshang ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / chu zheng phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of color, the perfection of shape, the perfection of faculties, and the perfection of size.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis rigs mtho zhing khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis rigs mtho zhing khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that high birth is superior in two ways:

original: ma dang pha'i phyogs nas spyod pa smad du med pa dang / longs spyod chen po nyid do //
analyzed: ma dang pha'i phyogs nas spyod pa smad du med pa dang / longs spyod chen po nyid do //
translated: one is born in a family of high rank, and one is born in a family of great wealth.

original: yang de ni rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: This high birth is fourfold:

original: ma'i phyogs nas rigs rnam par dag pa dang / pha'i phyogs nas rigs rnam par dag pa dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ma'i phyogs nas rigs rnam par dag pa dang / pha'i phyogs nas rigs rnam par dag pa dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: On the mother's side, the family is pure; on the father's side, the family is pure; one has perfect conduct; one is dear to all the world.

original: lhag par phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag por gyur pa ni gtso bo nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag par phun sum tshogs pa'i bdag por gyur pa ni gtso bo nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The lord of the best means the chief.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of best:

original: 'dus byas pa dang / sems can no //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa dang / sems can no //
translated: conditioned and sentient beings.

original: 'dus byas pa ni srid pa'i nye bar mkho bas so zhes bya bar /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa ni srid pa'i nye bar mkho bas so zhes bya bar /
translated: The conditioned is the best because of the necessities of existence.

original: longs / sems can yang phyogs su gtogs pa dang / 'khor te rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya bar /
analyzed: longs / sems can yang phyogs su gtogs pa dang / 'khor te rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya bar /
translated: Sentient beings are of two kinds: those who belong to one's own faction and those who belong to another faction.

original: longs spyod che ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: longs spyod che ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Great resources and so on.

original: longs spyod che ba yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: longs spyod che ba yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Great resources are of four kinds:

original: bzang zhing rgya che ba'i longs spyod nyid dang / gya nom pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i longs spyod nyid dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa'i longs spyod nyid dang / shin tu longs spyod pa'i longs spyod nyid de /
analyzed: bzang zhing rgya che ba'i longs spyod nyid dang / gya nom pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i longs spyod nyid dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa'i longs spyod nyid dang / shin tu longs spyod pa'i longs spyod nyid de /
translated: and the enjoyment of objects that is very refined.

original: ma'i phyogs dang / pha'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i gnyen ni phyogs su gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma'i phyogs dang / pha'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i gnyen ni phyogs su gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Friends and relatives who belong to one’s mother’s side and father’s side are called “those who belong to one’s side.”

original: de dag nyid la gnyen bshes dang / zhabs 'bring dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid la gnyen bshes dang / zhabs 'bring dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: They are also called “friends and relatives,” “servants,” and “kin.”

original: bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa'i skyes bu rnams ni 'khor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa'i skyes bu rnams ni 'khor zhes bya'o //
translated: Male and female servants and employees are called “retinue.”

original: 'khor gyi phyogs chen po yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'khor gyi phyogs chen po yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four great types of retinue:

original: mchog tu gyur pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor nyid dang / gya nom zhing 'bar ba'i phyogs kyi 'khor nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor nyid dang / rjes su chags pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor nyid do //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor nyid dang / gya nom zhing 'bar ba'i phyogs kyi 'khor nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor nyid dang / rjes su chags pa'i phyogs kyi 'khor nyid do //
translated: the retinue of the supreme direction, the retinue of the brilliant direction, the retinue of the compatible direction, and the retinue of the affectionate direction.

original: lus dang ngag gi las gang dag gis gzhan dag la bslu ba med pas yid brten du rung bas @42b de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ngag gi las la yid ches pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las gang dag gis gzhan dag la bslu ba med pas yid brten du rung bas @42b de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ngag gi las la yid ches pa yin te /
translated: By means of which actions of body and speech one does not deceive others, and so is trustworthy, one has confidence in the speech that is in conformity with that.

original: des na rtsod pa'i gnas thams cad du rtsod pa can rnams kyi dbang por gyur pas tshad mar gzhag par 'os pa'i phyir 'os pa'o //
analyzed: des na rtsod pa'i gnas thams cad du rtsod pa can rnams kyi dbang por gyur pas tshad mar gzhag par 'os pa'i phyir 'os pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one is worthy, because one is worthy to be established as a valid person in all matters of dispute, since one is the chief of those who dispute.

original: bslu ba med pa yang gsum rnam par dag pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin te /🔽gtong ba dang len pa'i tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: bslu ba med pa yang gsum rnam par dag pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin te / gtong ba dang len pa'i tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The absence of deception is also taught by the purity of the three.🔽The conventional presentation of giving and taking is as follows:

original: gang gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “One who deceives in the method of evaluation,” and so on.

original: gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa ni len pa dang gtong ba la mthon dman du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa ni len pa dang gtong ba la mthon dman du byed pa'o //
translated: In the case of weighing, deception is to make the scale tip up or down.

original: 'jal ba la g-yo byed pa ni srang mthon dman du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jal ba la g-yo byed pa ni srang mthon dman du byed pa'o //
translated: In the case of measuring, deception is to make the measure tip up or down.

original: de lta bu'i gzhal lugs la sogs pas bslu bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzhal lugs la sogs pas bslu bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: One should not deceive by such means of weighing, etc.

original: rang gi nor gtong ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: rang gi nor gtong ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to giving one's own wealth, it is said:

original: g-yo sgyu dang zhes bya ba la /🔽g-yo dang sgyus gzhan dag la kun du spyod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: g-yo sgyu dang zhes bya ba la / g-yo dang sgyus gzhan dag la kun du spyod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Not deceitful or fraudulent.

original: bden pa yang bden pa nyid du byed pa nyid do /
analyzed: bden pa yang bden pa nyid du byed pa nyid do /
translated: One does not deal deceitfully or fraudulently with others, but rather one is truthful and honest.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pa de la yang g-yo dang sgyus spyod par mi byed do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pa de la yang g-yo dang sgyus spyod par mi byed do zhes bya'o //
translated: One does not deal deceitfully or fraudulently even in that which is the domain of pure worldly convention.

original: yang na skyed gtong ba la sogs pa la yang g-yo dang sgyu mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na skyed gtong ba la sogs pa la yang g-yo dang sgyu mi byed pa'o //
translated: Or else, one does not deal deceitfully or fraudulently even in giving birth, etc.

original: nor ser sna byas pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: nor ser sna byas pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to being miserly with one's wealth, it is said:

original: nor gtams pa la ngor mi byed cing zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nor gtams pa la ngor mi byed cing zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Not miserly with regard to the wealth that is stored up.

original: de ltar na nyo ba dang 'tshong ba'i sgo nas gtong ba dang len pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / skyed gtang ba dang nor gtams pa la rnam par dag pas bslu ba med pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nyo ba dang 'tshong ba'i sgo nas gtong ba dang len pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / skyed gtang ba dang nor gtams pa la rnam par dag pas bslu ba med pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that there is no deception because of the purity of giving and taking by way of buying and selling, and because of the purity of giving birth and accumulating wealth.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang yid brtan du rung zhing zhes bya ba la smras pa /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang yid brtan du rung zhing zhes bya ba la smras pa /
translated: Another enumeration: “trustworthy” means:

original: sems can rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “the sentient beings” and so on.

original: tshad mar gyur pa nyid kyi dpang por gzhag par 'os pa yin no//
analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa nyid kyi dpang por gzhag par 'os pa yin no//
translated: They are worthy of being established as witnesses because they are authoritative.

original: yid ches pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yid ches pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of trust is it?

original: smras pa / gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa la sogs pas bslu ba med pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa la sogs pas bslu ba med pa'o //
translated: It is said: “not deceiving by way of cheating in the method of weighing and so on.”

original: gzhi des zhes bya ba ni yid brtan du rung ba dang / yid ches pa'i gzhi des bslu bar mi byed pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las kyi gzhi gang yin pa des zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhi des zhes bya ba ni yid brtan du rung ba dang / yid ches pa'i gzhi des bslu bar mi byed pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las kyi gzhi gang yin pa des zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “By that basis” means that by that basis of trust and confidence, whatever basis of action of body and so on is not deceptive, that is the meaning of “by that.”

original: 'dzin par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i ngag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dzin par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i ngag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “that which is to be grasped” means “that which is not to be transgressed.”

original: gzhan rnams kyis tshad mar gyur pas blang bar bya ba'i ngag yin pa'i phyir gzung bar bya ba'i tshig yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis tshad mar gyur pas blang bar bya ba'i ngag yin pa'i phyir gzung bar bya ba'i tshig yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “that which is to be grasped” means “that which is to be accepted” because it is speech that is authoritative for others.

original: dbang che bar grags pa ni yangs pa dang / rgya che ba dang / rnam par bkram pa ste /
analyzed: dbang che bar grags pa ni yangs pa dang / rgya che ba dang / rnam par bkram pa ste /
translated: “Great power” means extensive, vast, and expansive.

original: @43a * // rdzas drug las kun du byung ba ni dbang che bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: @43a * // rdzas drug las kun du byung ba ni dbang che bar grags pa'o //
translated: “Great power” is derived from the six kinds of superknowledge.

original: bzo'i las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs pa la mkhas pa las brtsams nas 'jig rten 'dir grags pas khyab pa ni grags pa chen po'o //
analyzed: bzo'i las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs pa la mkhas pa las brtsams nas 'jig rten 'dir grags pas khyab pa ni grags pa chen po'o //
translated: “Great fame” means that one’s fame has spread throughout the world because of one’s skill in the various arts and crafts.

original: de dag gnyi ga'i sbyor bas 'jig rten gyi bla mar byed pa ni snyan pa'o //🔽de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga'i sbyor bas 'jig rten gyi bla mar byed pa ni snyan pa'o // de bzhin du /
translated: “Great renown” means that one is honored by the world because of both of these qualities.

original: dbang che ba dang / mthu che ba dang / nus pa che ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang che ba dang / mthu che ba dang / nus pa che ba zhes bya ste /
translated: “Great power,” “great might,” and “great ability” are synonyms.

original: skye bo mang pos 'dod par bya ba yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo mang pos 'dod par bya ba yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: He is the one who is desired by many people.

original: de la dpa' ba ni snying stobs so //
analyzed: de la dpa' ba ni snying stobs so //
translated: Here, “heroic” means courage.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And that is of two kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: defiled and undefiled.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni g-yul dor dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni g-yul dor dpa' ba'o //
translated: The defiled is the courage of one who turns away from battle.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni sbyin pa la dpa' ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni sbyin pa la dpa' ba ste /
translated: The undefiled is the courage of one who gives,

original: snying stobs sbyin dang 'thab pa la zhes bstan pa'i nges pas so //
analyzed: snying stobs sbyin dang 'thab pa la zhes bstan pa'i nges pas so //
translated: because it is said that “courage is giving and fighting.”

original: brtson pa ni yangs shing rgya che ba'i las kyi mtha' la lus spro zhing sbyor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la sems spro ba ste /
analyzed: brtson pa ni yangs shing rgya che ba'i las kyi mtha' la lus spro zhing sbyor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la sems spro ba ste /
translated: “Diligent” means one who is physically engaged in vast and extensive activities and one whose mind is engaged in wholesome dharmas.

original: de dag gnyis ka yang brtson pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka yang brtson pa'o //
translated: Both of these are diligence.

original: brtan pa ni ngang brtan pa ste /
analyzed: brtan pa ni ngang brtan pa ste /
translated: “ Steadfast” means firm.

original: sdug bsngal drag po nyams su myong zhing bde ba dang bral bar gyur kyang lus dang sems la 'gyur ba med pas brtan zhing sras ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal drag po nyams su myong zhing bde ba dang bral bar gyur kyang lus dang sems la 'gyur ba med pas brtan zhing sras ba'o //
translated: Even when experiencing intense suffering and being deprived of happiness, one’s body and mind remain unchanged, so one is steadfast and strong.

original: bya ba de dang de la blo nyams su myong ba la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba de dang de la blo nyams su myong ba la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in the experience of this and that activity is expertise.

original: sbyor ba la mkhas pa ni shes nyan che ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la mkhas pa ni shes nyan che ba'o //
translated: Skill in application is great learning.

original: yang shes bya yangs pa la rjes su 'jug pa la sems pa ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: yang shes bya yangs pa la rjes su 'jug pa la sems pa ni mkhas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, expertise is the reflection on the engagement in the vast knowable.

original: shes bya zab mo la rjes su 'jug pa ni shes nyen che ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya zab mo la rjes su 'jug pa ni shes nyen che ba'o //
translated: Great learning is the engagement in the profound knowable.

original: de dag gnyis ka dang ldan pa ni shes rab chen po dang / shes rab zab mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka dang ldan pa ni shes rab chen po dang / shes rab zab mo zhes brjod do //
translated: One who possesses both is said to have great wisdom and profound wisdom.

original: ngang tshul bzang ba ni nyes par spyod pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa lus la sogs pa'i legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngang tshul bzang ba ni nyes par spyod pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa lus la sogs pa'i legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Good character is the possession of good conduct of body, etc., which is the antidote to bad conduct.

original: bzo dang las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dag la mkhas pa ni ji ltar thos pa las byung ba'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du de dag la rab kyi mthar thug par gyur pa la lhag par mkhas pa dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bzo dang las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dag la mkhas pa ni ji ltar thos pa las byung ba'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du de dag la rab kyi mthar thug par gyur pa la lhag par mkhas pa dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
translated: Skill in the various arts and crafts should be known as the possession of supreme skill in them, as taught in the Sūtra on the Levels.

original: gcig la gcig ltos nas khyad par 'di dang 'di'o zhes mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig ltos nas khyad par 'di dang 'di'o zhes mkhas pa'o //
translated: The wise one is the one who, in dependence on the other, says, This is the difference.

original: gzhi des zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i mkhas pa dag gi gzhi des so //
analyzed: gzhi des zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i mkhas pa dag gi gzhi des so //
translated: By that basis means by the basis of the wise one as just described.

original: bla mar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni gnas de dag la spyod pa na 'jig rten kun 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bla mar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni gnas de dag la spyod pa na 'jig rten kun 'dod pa'o //
translated: One becomes superior means that when one practices those bases, the world desires them.

original: de'i rigs skye bo'i @43b tshogs chen po'i zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i rigs skye bo'i @43b tshogs chen po'i zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: A great multitude of people of that type means that the wise one is praised by a great multitude of people.

original: bkur stir bya ba ni brtse ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽btsun par bya ba ni brtse ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkur stir bya ba ni brtse ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro // btsun par bya ba ni brtse ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is worthy of worship means that one is worthy of being loved.🔽One is worthy of veneration means that one is worthy of being loved and respected.

original: rim gror bya ba ni gus par bya ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gror bya ba ni gus par bya ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is worthy of homage means that one is worthy of being loved and served.

original: yang na bkur sti bya ba ni lus kyis so //
analyzed: yang na bkur sti bya ba ni lus kyis so //
translated: Alternatively, one is worthy of worship means with the body.

original: btsun par bya ba ni ngag gis so //
analyzed: btsun par bya ba ni ngag gis so //
translated: One is worthy of veneration means with speech.

original: rim gror bya ba ni yid kyis te yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gror bya ba ni yid kyis te yon tan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One is worthy of homage means with the mind, because one is the source of good qualities.

original: rnam pa de dag nyid kyis mchod par bya ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag nyid kyis mchod par bya ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: By those very aspects, one is worthy of offerings.

original: skyes pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas skyes pa zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas skyes pa zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: The term “state of being a male” refers to that by which one is called a “male.”

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: skyes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “endowed with the faculty of a male.”

original: de ltar na mi nyid kyi gtso bo nyid bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mi nyid kyi gtso bo nyid bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the essence of being a human is included.

original: mi nyid kyang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi nyid kyang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Also, being a human is threefold:

original: dman pa dang / 'bring dang mchog gis so //
analyzed: dman pa dang / 'bring dang mchog gis so //
translated: inferior, middling, and superior.

original: dman pa ni ma ning gi mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa ni ma ning gi mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The inferior is one who possesses the sex of a eunuch.

original: bar ma ni bud med kyi dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma ni bud med kyi dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The middling is one who possesses the sex of a woman.

original: mchog ni skyes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mchog ni skyes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The superior is one who possesses the sex of a male.

original: de'i phyir mchog nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog nye bar bzung nas /
translated: Therefore, taking the superior as the basis,

original: skyes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
translated: he says, “being a male” and so on.

original: yang skyes bur rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: yang skyes bur rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, the classification of a person is twofold:

original: rnam pa dang / mtshan mas so //
analyzed: rnam pa dang / mtshan mas so //
translated: by way of aspect and by way of mark.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams ni skyes pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pas skyes pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams ni skyes pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pas skyes pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Those who are in the form realm are called “men” because they have the appearance of men.

original: skyes pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pas ni ma yin mo //
analyzed: skyes pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pas ni ma yin mo //
translated: But they are not called “men” because they have the characteristics of men.

original: mi'i nang na kha cig ni skyes pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan yang bud med dang ma ning gi rnam pa lta bu yang yod pas de'i phyir tshig gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: mi'i nang na kha cig ni skyes pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan yang bud med dang ma ning gi rnam pa lta bu yang yod pas de'i phyir tshig gnyis bstan to //
translated: Among men, some have the characteristics of men but are like women or eunuchs. Therefore, two terms are taught.

original: stobs rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas stobs phun sum tshogs pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: stobs rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas stobs phun sum tshogs pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The perfection of power should be understood in terms of two kinds of power:

original: rgyu las byung ba dang / rkyen las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba dang / rkyen las byung ba'o //
translated: power that comes from causes and power that comes from conditions.

original: rgyu las byung ba ni las las skyes pa ste lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba ni las las skyes pa ste lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Power that comes from causes is power that comes from karma, and is called “innate.”

original: gya nom zhing rgya che ba'i kha zas la longs spyod pa'i rkyen las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni rkyen las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gya nom zhing rgya che ba'i kha zas la longs spyod pa'i rkyen las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni rkyen las byung ba'o //
translated: Power that comes from conditions is power that comes from the conditions of enjoying excellent and abundant food.

original: gnod pa chung ba dang nad med pa'i rang bzhin can gyis ni stobs dang po bstan te /
analyzed: gnod pa chung ba dang nad med pa'i rang bzhin can gyis ni stobs dang po bstan te /
translated: The first kind of power is indicated by the phrase “with little pain and with good health.”

original: nad mang ba la lhan cig skyes pa'i stobs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nad mang ba la lhan cig skyes pa'i stobs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: One who has many illnesses does not have the power of natural strength.

original: spro ba che bas ni gnyis pa bstan te /
analyzed: spro ba che bas ni gnyis pa bstan te /
translated: One who has great enthusiasm is taught to be the second.

original: kha zas la longs spyod pa'i khyad par gyis lus rgyas pas lus gya nom par gyur na spro ba chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //🔽las las skyes pa'i nad med pa ni gnod @44a * //
analyzed: kha zas la longs spyod pa'i khyad par gyis lus rgyas pas lus gya nom par gyur na spro ba chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no // las las skyes pa'i nad med pa ni gnod @44a * //
translated: When the body becomes excellent through the difference in the enjoyment of food and the body becomes full, great enthusiasm arises.

original: pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: pa chung ba'o //
translated: One who is free from illness born from karma has little harm.

original: dus las byung ba dang kha zas dang gnas kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i nad med pa ni nad med pa'o //
analyzed: dus las byung ba dang kha zas dang gnas kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i nad med pa ni nad med pa'o //
translated: One who is free from illness born from the difference in time, food, and place has good health.

original: de ltar sngon gyi las las skyes pa dang / rkyen ma snyoms par gyur pa las skyes pa'i nad med pas gnyi ga smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sngon gyi las las skyes pa dang / rkyen ma snyoms par gyur pa las skyes pa'i nad med pas gnyi ga smos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, both are mentioned because of being free from illness born from previous karma and born from the imbalance of conditions.

original: stobs su byed pa'i bya ba la rtsom pa dang ldan pa ni spro ba che ba'o //
analyzed: stobs su byed pa'i bya ba la rtsom pa dang ldan pa ni spro ba che ba'o //
translated: One who is endowed with the activity of undertaking the performance of strength has great enthusiasm.

original: yang gnod pa chung ba dang / nad med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gnod pa chung ba dang / nad med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, one becomes strong because of having the nature of little harm and good health.

original: reg byas bsdus pa'i nyi bar len pa'i khyad par ro //🔽spro ba che ba nyid kyis ni mthu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: reg byas bsdus pa'i nyi bar len pa'i khyad par ro // spro ba che ba nyid kyis ni mthu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The specific cause of the sense of touch is the four great elements.🔽The specific cause of the sense of touch is the four great elements.

original: bya ba thams cad la sbyor ba bzod pa'i phyir ro //🔽de gnyi ga rang bzhin gyi stobs zhes bya'o //🔽de'i phyir gzhan kha zas las byung ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi stobs zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad la sbyor ba bzod pa'i phyir ro // de gnyi ga rang bzhin gyi stobs zhes bya'o // de'i phyir gzhan kha zas las byung ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi stobs zhes mi bya'o //

original: yang stobs kyi rnam par gzhag pa gzhan bstan pa ni //🔽lus kyi dang sems kyi dbang du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yang stobs kyi rnam par gzhag pa gzhan bstan pa ni // lus kyi dang sems kyi dbang du gyur pa ste /
translated: The specific cause of the sense of touch is the four great elements.🔽The specific cause of the sense of touch is the four great elements.🔽The specific cause of the sense of touch is the four great elements.
